loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en: Asha is 32 years old and married. She practices coconut farming to earn a living. She operates her business in a conducive environment with reliable customers. Since she became a client of Yehu Microfinance, she has learned how to save because she has been trained in financial management. She dreams of improving her business in the future. She has requested a loan of 40,000 KES to buy more sacks of coconuts for her farm.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of coconuts for resale

loans.name: Rorn

texts.en:
Living in a rural village located in the Kandal Stoeng district, Rorn is 37 years old and married. She has three children, two of whom are dependent on her and still in school while the other is a garment factory worker. Rorn is a rice farmer in the local area while her husband is a motor taxi driver to help support the family's earnings. She and her husband have been in these businesses for 15 years and 10 years, respectively. Together, they can earn about 8 USD per day. 

This is the first loan for Rorn with Kiva's partner VisionFund. Now requesting a loan, she is going to use it to buy fertilizer for her farmland and use a portion of it for land plowing. She hopes this loan will enable her to grow her rice strong and also hopes to improve her family's living condition.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Mwanamkasi

texts.en:
Mwanamkasi is 40 years old and divorced. She has 7 children who are already grown. Mwanamkasi started her food pantry more than 5 years ago. Thanks to her perseverance and commitment, Mwanamkasi has been able to nurture her 7 children. 

As a result of Mwanamkasi's good service and friendliness, along with help from her family, her business is improving with each moment. Her goals are to continue working, feel useful, and move forward. Mwanamkasi needs a loan to buy rice, noodles, and baked goods to restock her business since these are the products that sell the most. She is grateful for the help she has received and views it as a good opportunity to make progress.

loans.use: to buy rice, noodles, and baked goods to restock her business

loans.name: Mao's Group

texts.en:
Mao, 54, is a rural farmer from a village of the Sangke district for ten years. Two of Mao's children are dependents and still in school while the others have their own employment. For the last 25 years, she and her husband have been farming rice to support their family, earning about 33,000 KHR per day. They save about 16,000 KHR each day for the future. 

Mao's group consists of two members. She is a fifth-cycled client while her co-member is a second-cycled client with VisionFund. She successfully used the loans to improve her family's financial burden and improve livelihood. Now Mao and her co-member are applying for a loan of 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to make more rice and sell it for a good price to make a living better.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Phorp's Group

texts.en:
Phorp is 50 years old and divorced. She lives with her two children who are still in school in a rural village of the Kandal Stoeng district. Her primary business is rice farming to make a living. The current business earns her about 18,200 KHR per day to spend for daily expenses. 

Phorp's group consists of two members. She is a second-cycled client while her co-member is a new member of VisionFund. The first loan has helped Phorp improve livelihood. She is now leading her group to apply for a loan with VisionFund. She is going to use her portion to buy some materials to build a latrine for her family. She hopes this loan will enable her to have a decent latrine for use so as to improve her family's standard for good health.

loans.use: To buy some materials to build a latrine

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is from Msambweni, single and 34 years old. She has one child, who is the source of her greatest joy and the reason why she strives hard. Fatuma tells us that she has worked since she was young, and is not afraid to work, as everything she does is for her family.

Fatuma operates a business selling kerosene from home. This is how she helps her family and provides what is needed for a good life without hardships. She says that her dream is to have a store in town to sell her products. She is requesting the loan in order to buy more kerosene, which she will sell at home, and have more to be able to offer her customers.

loans.use: to buy more kerosene

loans.name: Pov's Group

texts.en:
Pov, 25, is widowed and lives with two children, one of whom is dependent on her and still in school. Pov is a peasant who grows corn on 5 hectares of farmland and sometimes works for others for a fee. Having been in this business for almost 10 years, she can earn about 8,000 KHR per day to feed her family’s needs. The main challenge for her is lack of capital for supporting her business. 

Pov has been with VisionFund for 4 cycles while the other members have been with VisionFund from 1 to 3 cycles. The past loans has helped her afford sufficient food. Now she is leading her group of 3 to apply for a loan. As the leader, Pov is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and rice seeds for her farmland and use a portion of it for laborers. She hopes to earn more income so as to expand her current business and improve her living condition.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and rice seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Stefany Rosario

texts.es:
Stefany es una joven de 20 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de chincha, ciudad en la cual se destaca por su población de origen afroperuano, es la cuna de grandes glorias del deporte peruano, por sus hermosas playas, también esta ciudad es muy conocida por su comida ya que los pobladores de esa ciudad se les conoce por la buena sazón que tienen. Cuando disponen de un tiempo libre le gusta mucho escuchar música y sobre todo compartir momentos de unión en familia, ya que es madre de de 2 pequeños los cuyas edades comprenden 2 años y 3 meses, a quienes saca adelante sola ya que su esposo la abandono y desde ese momento se convirtió en madre y padre para sus hijos, por ello se esfuerza mucho cada día para poder darle una vida digna. Debido a sus pocos recursos económicos Stefany solo estudio hasta el quinto grado de educación secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar una carrera universitaria.

Día a día Stefany trabaja en un supermercado de su ciudad, ella supervisa la producción de las comidas preparadas, ella trabaja  alrededor de 8 horas al día y cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es muy responsable y sobre todo muy honrada y cumplida.

Stefany está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar materiales para poder realizar un reforzamiento en el techo de su vivienda, así como también comprar una pequeña cama, frazadas y cobertores ya que debido a un accidente en su vivienda, sus pequeños no tienen donde dormir y no tienen frazadas para poder protegerse del frio; de esta manera Stefany podrá mejorar poco a poco la calidad de vida de sus pequeños que es lo más importante para ella y poder seguir trabajando muy duro para poder salir adelante y cumplir su más grande sueño:” Darle una buena educación a sus hijos y poder tener su casa propia”.
texts.en:
Stefany is 20 years old and lives in the city of Chincha, a city which stands out for its Afro-Peruvian population, being the cradle of great moments in Peruvian sport, and its beautiful beaches. This city is also well known for its food, since the inhabitants of the city are known for the good seasonings that they have. When she has free time, she really likes to listen to music and above all share moments together with her family. She is the mother of two young children who are 2 years and 3 months old, who she is moving forward by herself since her husband left her and from that moment she became mother and father to her children. This is why she works so much every day to be able to give them a decent life. Given her limited economic resources, Stefany only studied to the fifth year of secondary school, but she would have liked to get a university degree.

Day after day, Stefany works in a supermarket in her city. She supervises the production of the prepared foods. She works about eight hours a day and believes that her work is going very well because she is very responsible and above all very honest and polite.

Stefany is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the help they have given her, she will be able to buy materials to be able to reinforce the roof of her house. She will also be able to buy a small bed, blankets, and bedspreads, since because of an accident in her home, her children have nowhere to sleep and they have no blankets to protect them from the cold. This way, Stefany will be able to improve the lives of her little ones bit by bit. That is the most important thing for her and to be able to keep working very hard to be able to move forward and achieve her greatest dream: to give her children a good education and be able to have her own house.

loans.use: to buy materials to be able to reinforce the roof of her house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase beams, shovels, helmets, and iron, among other items.

loans.name: Mwanarusi

texts.en: Mwanarusi resides in the town of Likoni with her husband and their 3 children. Her husband is an assistant chief. Their dream is to have better living conditions. Mwanarusi has been a merchant for 3 years. She operates a food stall, a business that earns her a lot of profit so that she can cover part of their home expenses. She will use this new financing to purchase merchandise: balers of wheat flour, sugar, maize flour, and rice. She dreams of opening a restaurant in the future. She thanks Yehu for the support they have offered with this loan and for trusting her.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise: balers of wheat flour, sugar, maize flour, and rice.

loans.name: Saret's Group

texts.en:
Originally from the Thmor Koul District of Battambang Province, Cambodia, Saret is a 34-year-old mother of four children; two of whom are dependent on her and still in school. She is a rice farmer to make a living while her husband is a construction worker in the village. Together, they can earn about 20,000 KHR per day from the current business and can manage to save about 10,000 KHR each day. 

Saret’s group consists of five members. She has been with VisionFund for five cycles while the other members have been with VisionFund from the first to five cycles. The past loans have helped her better support her family’s business and children’s education. Now, she is leading her group to apply for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and construction materials such as cement and sands, etc. for supporting her husband's business. She hopes to increase her income so as to improve her family’s lifestyle and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Lela

texts.en:
Lela is 36 years old and lives in the Martvili District with her family. She has a husband, Malkhaz; two children aged 11 and 14 years; and a father-in-law. Lela’s children go to the local school. Her father-in-law is provided with a retirement pension. Lela runs her agricultural business and Malkhaz works as a taxi driver. He serves local people with his own car; this is the main source of income for the family. Malkhaz is very sociable and attracts a lot of clients. The family works hard, but still doesn’t have enough income to make some savings and improve their living conditions.

Lela requested a loan to repair the car and change its tires. The car is damaged and it is already risky to drive long distances. For this reason, Malkhaz has stopped operations. After repairing the car, Malkhaz will be able to continue transportation. This will increase the income. Increased income will enable them to improve the family’s living conditions and repair their house, which is damaged and uncomfortable.

loans.use: to repair and change the tires of the car.

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija is a woman of high dignity who is liked by many for her wisdom and good advice. She has been tailoring for some time. However, to enable her to increase her income, she incorporated charcoal and firewood selling businesses. Thanks to her efforts, her businesses are doing very well. 

She always thinks about how she could move forward, now that she is very aware that she is a widow, and she has to look after her children. Khadija should therefore tighten her belt to continue providing a quality life to her family. She cannot do this on her own, so she is requesting a loan in the amount of 30,000 Kenyan shillings to purchase 30 sacks of charcoal and 40 bundles of firewood to sell. Khadija is grateful for this support.

loans.use: to purchase 30 sacks of charcoal and 40 bundles of firewood to sell.

loans.name: Rom's Group

texts.en:
Rom is 43 years old and lives in a village of the Ek Phnom district with her husband and eight children; four (three daughters and one son) of whom are dependent on her and still in school. She is a garment worker and supplements the family’s income through growing corn and groundnuts while her husband is a paid worker in the local area. Having been in this business for twenty years, they can earn about 40,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. However, low crop yield resulted from insects is the main challenge for her business.

Rom is leading the group of two, who live in the same village of the Ek Phnom district of Battambang province, to apply for a fifth loan with VisionFund. She successfully used the past loans to better support her family. Now, she and her group members are requesting a loan with VisionFund of 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy groundnut seeds and pay for labor. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her income and increase the crop yields so as to improve her family’s living standard.

loans.use: To buy groundnut seeds.

loans.name: Koeurn

texts.en:
Koeurn is 37 years old and lives with her husband in a village of the Thmor Koul district, Battambang province. The main source of family’s income is from vegetable selling, which she has doing for several years while her husband is a motor taxi driver earning additional income to help the family make a living. The current business earns her family about 25,000 KHR per day.
 
This is the first loan for Koeurn with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now, she is applying for a loan of 1,200,000 KHR from VisionFund to buy more vegetables for selling and to use a portion of it to buy a pumping machine. She hopes to increase her income from the current business so as to improve her living condition.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables for selling.

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en:
Fredrick is a singe gentleman aged 22 years. He supports his parents as well as his younger siblings. He operates a motorbike transport business in the Narok area and has been running the business for three years earning a monthly income of KES 45,000. 

He has borrowed his first loan of KES 75,000 from KADET LTD in which he intends to purchase another motorbike. The anticipated profit will be used to pay school fees for his school-going siblings.

His dream is to improve his family's living standards and own a residential plot.

loans.use: to purchase another motorbike.

loans.name: Kong's Group

texts.en:
Kong is 31-years-old and married. She has four children; two daughters and two sons living in a village of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. She has been involved in farming rice on four hectares of land for twelve years and supplements the family’s income by growing sesame and chilies while her husband is a construction worker. Together, they can earn about 30,000 KHR per day. Drought has destroyed her crop yield and it is the main challenge for her business. 

This is the fifth loan with VisionFund for Kong's group of two members. The past loans have helped her to better support her family. Now, leading her group member to apply for a loan with VisionFund of 1,400,000 KHR, Kong will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to increase her income from the crop yield so as to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Kibibi

texts.en:
Kibibi, 23, is married to Juma who is a mason. They have two children all of whom are attending elementary school.

Kibibi started out as a merchant over one year ago. She started out with some money she’d saved up working as an employee in a retail shop for several years. After getting married, her husband helped her open a store that has grown over the year. She currently has a large clientele in the community because of her good service and the variety of products she offers in her store.

She’s asking for the loan to buy sacks of coconuts for resale to stock the store and provide a wider variety to her customers.

loans.use: to buy sacks of coconuts for resale.

loans.name: Vorn's Group

texts.en:
Vorn, 29, lives with her husband and two children in a village of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Cambodia. To make a living, she has been in farming rice and growing chilies and sesames for almost ten years. The current business earns her about 15,000 KHR per day to feed the family. Drought is the main challenge for her farming business. 

This is the first group loan for Vorn with VisionFund. She is leading her group members to apply for a loan of KHR 1,000,000 each. She is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her paddy field. With this loan, she hopes to increase her crop yield so as to grow her family’s income to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her paddy field.

loans.name: Chreb

texts.en:
Chreb, aged 39, lives in the Kampong Cham province’s Dambae district of Cambodia. She has three daughters, all of whom are dependent on her and still in school. She has been involved in farming rice on 1.5 hectares of farmland and earns additional income by planting cassava on 4 hectares of farmland. Having been in this business for eight years, she is able to earn 60,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs.
 
She is a fourth-cycle client with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She completely paid back the past loans which have helped her relieve her family’s burden. Now she is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 KHR to buy fertilizer for her crop planting and use a portion of it to pay for plowing her paddy field. She hopes to earn more income from her current business so as to make her daily living better.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her crop planting

loans.name: Fatima Virginia

texts.es:
Fatima tiene 53 años de edad, es madre de 2 hijos, cuyas edades comprenden 20 y 2 años, a quienes ha sacado adelante sola ya que se separo del padre de sus hijos y desde ese momento se convirtió en padre y madre para ellos. Su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Ica, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido y acogedor, asimismo se desarrolla la agricultura, en especial el cultivo de esparrago, uva, paprika, entre otros. Cuando dispone de un tiempo libre le gusta mucho tocar algunos instrumentos ya que le gusta mucho la música, asimismo le encanta comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Arroz con pollo”. Con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio logro estudiar administración de empresas y con ella inicio su pequeño negocio.

Día a día Fátima trabaja en su pequeño negocio de consultoría, ella trabaja alrededor de 8 horas al día y puede atender hasta 3 clientes diariamente; ella cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es amable con los clientes y porque es honesta.

Fatima está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá refaccionar su vivienda, especialmente refaccionar las paredes, colocar un baño, ya que actualmente no tiene, asimismo colocar piso; asi de esta manera ella podrá mejorar su calidad de vida y podrá seguir luchando para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Darle una profesión a sus hijos y poder ser una gran empresaria”.
texts.en:
Fatima is 53 years old and has two children, who are between the ages of 20 and two years old. She gets ahead her children alone because she is separated from the father of her children. From that moment, she became the father and the mother for them. 

Her house is located in the city of Ica, city characterized by a warm and cozy climate. Agriculture is developed in the area, especially the cultivation of asparagus, grapes, and paprika, among others. 

When she has some free time, she likes to play some instruments, because she loves music. Also, she loves to eat one of her favorite dishes which is the delicious "Arroz con pollo" [Rice with chicken]. With a lot of effort and sacrifice, she studied business administration and she started her small business. Fatima works everyday in her small consulting business. She works around eight hours a day and she can attend up to three clients per day. She believes she is doing well in her work because she is kind and honest with the clients.

Fatima is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to their help she will be able to repair her house. Especially, she will repair the walls, install a bathroom since she currently hasn't one, and install floors. Doing so, she will improve her quality of life and will keep fighting to make her biggest dream come true: provide a profession for her children and be a great entrepreneur.

loans.use: to improve her home: repair the walls, install a bathroom, etc.

loans.name: Dy's Group

texts.en:
Dy, aged 42, lives in a rural area of the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province, Cambodia. She has four sons, all of whom are dependent on her. She makes a living through working as a construction worker, which she has done for twelve years. The current business earns her about KHR 25,000 per day to meet the family’s needs. 

Dy has been with VisionFund for six cycles and completely paid back the loans while the other member has been with VisionFund for one cycle. She has used the past loan to relieve the family’s burden and improve livelihood. Now, she and her group member are requesting a loan of KHR 1,000,000 each. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy materials such as zincs, woods, etc for repairing her house. She hopes this loan will enable her to improve her house and also hopes to earn more income to have a decent house.

loans.use: To buy materials for repairing her house.

loans.name: Nona

texts.en:
Nona is 58 years old and lives in a small village of Martvili district. She has a husband Demur, a 26-year-old son and a father-in-law. Her father-in-law is a pensioner. Nona’s son works as a water adjuster and gets a monthly salary. Her husband has a truck and takes wood from the forest. The wood is sold in nearby villages. Nona runs her agricultural business. In particular, she has a plot of land where nuts and persimmons are grown. She is involved in an animal husbandry business as well. The family owns 2 milking cows, a calf, a pig and 4 goats. Nona milks cows every day and produces cheese. She sells cheese, dried persimmons, nuts and goat kids at the local open market. The family works hard, but they still don’t have enough income to improve their living conditions.

Nona requested a loan to purchase tires for the truck because the tires are damaged and it is already risky to drive in the forest. Demur has stopped operations. After repairing the truck, Demur will be able to continue transportation and sales of wood. This will increase the sales. Increased income will enable them to improve the family’s living conditions and repair their house, which is old and damaged. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase tires for the truck

loans.name: Vanna

texts.en:
Aged 59 years, Vanna is the mother to five children; three of whom are under the family's support. To get the family out of hardship, she has to work on one hectare of rice farm in a local area whilst her husband travels to Phnom Penh (Capital City of Cambodia) to work as a construction worker to make additional income to better support the family. Vanna has been engaged in this rice farming business for 26 years. For her, the main challenges are the declining price of the rice crop and the high cost of fertilizers, which affects her income. 

To overcome these difficulties, she is applying for a new loan with Kiva's partner, VisionFund, as a first-time borrower. Vanna will use this loan to buy fertilizers and rice seeds for her farmland. She will also use a portion of it to support her married child who is in a difficult situation of lacking finance to set up a barber shop to make money as a supplemental income to keep their children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seed for her farmland.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a large quantity of potatoes for resale.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 31 years old and is married. He has four children who are between 5 and 9 years old. Emmanuel sells various goods such as: lotions, soap, onions, etc. He has five years of experience in this work and he currently employs two people to help him. 

Emmanuel has requested a Kiva loan, via Vision Finance Company, in order to buy various goods such as: lotions, soap, onion, cassava flour, bread, etc. for resale. With any profits, he will be able to buy a motorcycle and he will be able to build his own house.

loans.use: To buy various goods such as: lotions, soap, onion, breads, cassava flour etc., for resale.

loans.name: Twitekumurimo Group

texts.fr:
Emile fait partie du groupe Twitekumurimo. Le nom du groupe signifie«Aimer le travail » . Il a 30 ans, il est marie avec 3 enfants de 4 an à 9 ans, dont 1 scolarise. Il a 1 personne en charge autre que ses enfants. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de secondaire. 

Emile est agriculteur de riz. C’est son troisième cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimique et payer la main d’œuvre. 

Pour faire croitre son agriculture des riz, il planifie  d’utiliser la semence sélectionne. Dans les prochaines années, Emile voudrait être le premier agriculteur dans sa région. Avec les profits, il prévoit de payer le frais scolaire de ses enfants
texts.en:
Emile is a member of the Twitekumurimo group. The name of the group means "loving work". He is 30 years old and is married with 3 children aged between 4 and 9, one of whom goes to school. Apart from his children, he has one more person to support. He has 6 years of secondary education.

Emile is a rice farmer. This is his 3rd loan cycle with ACB. He will use his loan to buy chemical fertilizer and to pay the labourers. He plans to use selected seed in order to expand his rice growing business. In the years ahead, Emile would like to be the leading farmer in his region. With the profits, he plans to pay for his children's education expenses.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizer and pay the labourers.

loans.name: Abesamihigo C Group

texts.fr:
Silvère fait partie du groupe Abesamihigo C. Le nom du groupe signifie «Les membres des performances ». Il a 47 ans, il est marie avec 5 enfants de 5 ans à 15 ans, dont 4 scolarises. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.

Silvère est agriculteur de riz. C’est son troisième cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimique et payer la main d’œuvre.

Pour faire croitre son agriculture de riz, il planifie de solliciter d’autres prêts pour augmenter le volume de crédit demande pour finance son agriculture. Dans les prochaines années, Silvère voudrait être un meilleur producteur de riz dans sa région. Avec les profits, il prévoit de payer le frais scolaire de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Silvère is a member of the Abesamihigo C group. The name of the group means "members of performances". He is 47 years old and married with 5 children aged between 5 and 15, 4 of whom go to school. He has 6 years of primary school education.

Silvère is a rice farmer. This is his 3rd loan cycle with ACB. He will use his loan to buy chemical fertilizer and to pay the labourers. In order to expand his rice farm, he plans to request more loans so that he increases the amount of funds available to finance his farming business. In the years ahead, Silvère would like to be a leading rice farmer in his region. With the profits, he plans to pay for his children's education expenses.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers and to pay for labour costs.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi, 23, is single. She has three children and they live in downtown Msambweni. Mwanamisi has had a boutique for more than 1 year in a strategically located spot in the city of Msambweni. She sells assorted articles of clothing like shirts, t-shirts, pants, moccasins, sandals and belts for cash and on credit. Thanks to her sacrifice she’s getting ahead and also helping her husband with everyday expenses.

She’s asking for a loan to increase her stock of clothing because sales always increase starting mid-year and she wants to be prepared in the best way possible to provide her customers with a variety of quality national and imported clothes.

loans.use: to increase her stock of clothing

loans.name: Abesamihigo/ Nybshnj Group

texts.fr:
Private fait partie du groupe Abesamihigo/ Nybshnj. Le nom du groupe signifie « performers ». Il a 65 ans et il est marié avec 7 enfants de 15 à 43 ans, dont 3 scolarisés. Il a 3 personnes en charge autre que ses enfants. Son niveau d’éducation est 6 ans de primaire. 

Private est cultivateur de riz. C’est son son deuxième cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques pour son agriculture de riz.

Pour faire croitre son agriculture des riz, il planifie d’utiliser des fertilisants et machines agricoles pour augmenter la production. Dans les prochaines années, Private voudrait être  un grand vendeur de riz dans son district. Avec les profits, il prévoit d’éduquer, soigner ses enfants et construire une belle maison.
texts.en:
Private is part of the Abesamihigo/Nybshnj group, the name of which means “performers”. He is 65 years of age, married, and has seven children. His children are aged between 15 and 43, and three of them are at school. He has a further three people under his care.

Private has six years of elementary school education, and he works as a rice farmer. This is his first loan cycle with ACB, and he plans to use his loan to buy chemical fertilizers for his rice-growing business. To increase his rice crops, he plans to use fertilizers and farm machinery to expand production. Over the coming years, Private would like to become a large rice seller in his area. With his profits, he wants to educate and care for his children, as well as to build a nice house.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers for his rice farming business.

loans.name: Carolyne

texts.en:
Carolyne is a 36-year-old lady from Kisumu City and is married to John. They have three children aged 10, 17 and 17.

Carolyne operates a food kiosk which specializes in fried chicken and other foodstuff. She also sells live chickens. She has been in this business for the last four years and makes a monthly income of KES 6,000. She is now taking her first loan from KADET LTD which she will use to buy more chickens to sell.

Her dream is to grow the business.

loans.use: To buy more chickens to sell.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam has not yet given up selling food in the open air but she hopes she will be selling in a cafe in the near future. With this in mind, she is working extra hard to ensure that her dream comes true. Mariam is counting her increased number of customers who like her because she is so caring and her food is of high quality. With this loan, she wants to purchase charcoal, wheat and maize flour, cooking oil, and sugar. She appreciates the support given by both Yehu and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal, wheat and maize flour, cooking oil, and sugar.

loans.name: Felipe Neri

texts.es: Don Felipe se dedica a la venta de material para construcción de pozos desde hace 22 años y dice que para el negocio que tiene emplea a 1 hombre que le ayudan a trabajar don Felipe le vende material a la empresa de agua potable de Managua  y dice que desea aumentar el número de trabajadores ya que tiene buena demanda el material que vende por eso necesita este crédito para comprar unas mallas y maderas para construir varias coladores artesanales que se usan para colar las arenas, cemento y piedras para construir lo cual será de ayuda ya que tiene encargado un material y com mas coladores podrá sacarlo mas rápido el pedido. El dice que cuando pague este crédito la ganancia que le quede la invertirá en mejorar de la casa. También dice que aquí en MiCredito lo ha tratado bien y los créditos se lo han dado con rapidez.
texts.en:
Felipe has been making a living through the sale of well construction materials for 22 years now. He says that in his business he employs one other man who helps him with the work. Felipe sells his material to a company that produces potable water in Managua. He says that he would like to increase the number of workers he has because his building materials are in high demand. 
This is why he needs this loan to buy mesh wire and timber. He uses these to build a number of handmade strainers which are utilized to filter the sands, cement and stones. Building these will help him because the material is already ordered and with more strainers he will be able to fill the order more quickly. 
He says that once he repaid the loan, he will use the income to invest in improving his house. 
He also says that here at MiCredito he was treated very well and that he received the loan very quickly.

loans.use: to buy some mesh and timber.

loans.name: Martha Cecilia

texts.es: Martha con su anterior credikiva, compró productos de belleza mercancía variada y una lavadora para alquilarla; también su crédito le alcanzó para comprar una vitrina y una carpa, para que su esposo trabajara en mejores condiciones en su taller automotriz. Con su crédito logró aumentar su capital de trabajo,   su clientela y que   un ambiente apropiado para realizar su tarea automotriz de su esposo. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva con el que comprará una lavadora, un equipo de soldadura, productos de belleza y mercancía variada que han encargado sus clientes. Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es de mucho agradecimiento, pues está satisfecha con el servicio de crédito y pide que la sigan apoyando para ayudar a que sus hijos, reciban educación superior.
texts.en:
With her previous loan from Kiva, Martha bought various beauty products to sell and a washing machine to rent out. The loan also helped her buy a showcase and a tent so that her husband can work under better conditions in his car shop. 
With this loan, she was able to increase her work capital, her customers and create the appropriate environment for her husband to carry out his automotive work. 
Currently, she is applying for another loan from Kiva. With this she will buy another washing machine, welding equipment, beauty products and other merchandise her customers ordered. 
Her message to the lenders at Kiva is that she is very thankful. She is also satisfied with the service of the loan and she is asking that you continue supporting her to help her offer a quality education to her children.

loans.use: to buy a washing machine, welding equipment, beauty products and other merchandise.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 38 years old, married and blessed with three children aged 20, 18 and eight years respectively.  She sells milk, a business she started 11 years ago, and earns a monthly income of 17,000 KES. 

She has requested a first loan of 30,000 KES to purchase a dairy cow for efficient milk production. The profit she earns will aid her in repaying her loan. Her dream is to one day open a big dairy firm in her region.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for efficient milk production

loans.name: Noe

texts.en:
Noe is 64 years old and lives in Tskaltubo district with his sons. The family earns their living through an animal husbandry business. In particular, they have two milking cows and three pigs. Noe produces cheese and sells at the local open market. They sell piglets as well.  Noe and his sons work very hard, but they still don’t have enough income to make some savings and improve their living conditions.

Noe requested a loan to purchase food for his cattle. With this loan, he will be able to produce and sell more cheese. Noe and his sons will work hard to increase the income of the family and expand their business. With the increased income they will improve their living conditions. Noe awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase food for cattle

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is still single and continues operating her shop. She is a teacher by profession and she is devoted to her work. Her cousin helps her in managing the shop when she is undertaking her official duties. Thanks for the growth of her shop; she has increased the quantity she purchases.

Asha tells us that her aim is to expand her business and open a wholesale business in future. Her inventory has gone down but she does not have enough capital to restock it. She is therefore requesting another loan so as to add stock of wheat and maize flour, and sugar.

loans.use: to add stock of wheat and maize flour, and sugar

loans.name: Kefa

texts.en:
Kefa is 42 years old and married with four-year-olds who are in school. To earn a living, he operates a mobile phone (M-pesa) money transfer business. He operates his business in a conducive environment with reliable customers. He has employed two people in his business.

He had previously acquired a loan from Faulu Kenya which helped him to pay school fees for his children. Kefa dreams of expanding his business in different locations and buying a plot of land in the future. He is requesting a loan of 100,000 KES to open another business.

loans.use: to open another business

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel is 42 years old, married and has seven children who are in school. He operates a grocery store to earn a living. He has been in the business for seven years and has employed one person. Besides, he also does farming to supplement his income.

He had previously acquired a loan from Faulu Kenya which helped him to grow his business. He dreams of operating a wholesale business in the future. Joel has requested a loan of 30,000 KES to buy onions, tomatoes and fruits.

loans.use: to buy onions, tomatoes and fruits

loans.name: Cecilia Esperanza

texts.es: Cecilia Esperanza de cuarenta y tres años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos; ella junto a su esposo se dedican a la venta de ropa ambulante para damas, caballeros y niños, en variedad y con muchos estilos, tiene varios años con este negocio y se ha hecho de experiencia muy valiosa que le permite realizar las mejores ventas, ya tiene mucha clientela pues las personas la prefieren porque tiene producto de primera calidad y a precios accesibles además el servicio es excelente; Cecilia es una mujer emprendedora, dispuesta a salir adelante siempre esta buscando oportunidades que le permitan alcanzar el éxito que la llevara a tener un futuro mas prospero, quiere extender su negocio a otras zonas aledañas a donde comercia y necesita de mas producto, pero no posee de suficiente capital para la inversión por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar ropa por mayor. Cecilia Esperanza tiene buenas referencias de pago es responsable, asegura poder saldar la deuda y a la vez ofrecerle a su familia una vida plena.
texts.en:
Cecilia Esperanza, 43, lives with her husband and two children.  She and her husband are street vendors and sell women's, men's and children's clothing in a variety of styles.  She has been in business for several years, having gained valuable experience that enables her to sell better.  She has many customers because they prefer her high quality products and low prices, plus her excellent service.  

Cecilia is an enterprising woman who wants to get ahead and is always looking for opportunities to be successful and have a prosperous future.  She wants to take her business to other areas of the village where they need more of her products, but she does not have sufficient capital to invest.  Therefore she is requesting a loan through INTEGRAL so she can buy wholesale clothing.  

Cecilia Esperanza has a good payment record and is responsible.  She promises to pay off her debt while giving her family a full life.

loans.use: To buy clothing wholesale

loans.name: Norkulboy

texts.ru: Норкулбой  мужчина в возрасте 52 лет, женат , имеет семерых детей. Сам по профессии работает строителем, в бригаде.Но кроме этого он вместе со своей семьёй занимается откормом и продажей скота.Сейчас у него три большие коровы, которые днём пасутся на пастбище, вечером сельский пастух пригоняет их по домам.Поэтому для расширения своей деятельности Норкулбой решил получить следующий очередной кредит.На полученный кредит он хочет увеличить поголовье скота.Заранее благодарит за поддержку.
texts.en: Norkulboy is a 52-year-old man who is married and has seven children.  He works in a construction brigade.  In addition to that, he and his family raise and sell livestock.  At the moment he has three large cows that graze during the day, and then in the evening a rural shepherd drives them back home.  Norkulboy has decided to obtain a loan to expand his business.  On receiving the loan, he would like to increase the number of his livestock.  He thanks you in advance for your support.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Otamurod

texts.ru:
Отамурод житель района Шахритус. Он родился 1978 году. Отамурод живет с женой. У него четверо детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Отамурод более 10 лет занимается животноводством. Он разводит крупнорогатый скот в дальнейшем для продажи.
Отамурод просит кредит для закупа телят и бычков, чтобы увеличить поголовья скота.
texts.en: Otamurod lives in the region of Shakhritus.  He was born in 1978, lives with his wife, and has four children.  His wife is a homemaker.  Otamurod has been involved in animal husbandry for more than 10 years.  He breeds cattle for future sale.  Otamurod has requested a loan to purchase calves and bulls so he can increase the size of his herd.

loans.use: To purchase calves and bulls

loans.name: Firdovsi

texts.ru: Firdovsi uje 7 let kak zanimayetsya skotovodstvom i razvodit ovec. On ochen lubit svoyu rabotu i lubit vse vremya uludshat svoy bizness. Firdovsi seychas nujdayetsya v 1700 AZN chtobi kupit ovec dlya uvelicheniya kolichestva skota dlya prodaji. On jenat i imeyet 2 detey. Firdovsi 34 qoda. On yavlyayetsya IDP personom pereselenec iz Fuzuli goroda. Seychas vmeste so svoyey semyoy on projivayet v Fuzuli regione.
texts.en:
Firdovsi is 34 years old, married and has 2 children. He has been raising farm animals for the last 7 years. He loves his work and enjoys spending his time thinking of ways to improve his business. He now needs a loan of 1,700 Azerbaijani New Manat in order to increase the number of animals he has for sale.

Firdovsi is an internally displaced person from the city of Fuzuli. Currently he and his family live in the greater Fuzuli region.

loans.use: to purchase sheep

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es: Pablo  de 52 años es un hombre casado y padre de 3 hijos en las edades de 23 a 31. El vive en la ciudad de Cartagena con su familia, donde se dedica al comercio de frutas, verduras y tubérculos. Pablo sale diariamente desde muy temprano, con una carreta llena de estos productos y los vende a clientes que lo esperan en diferentes barrios de Cartagena y justamente en la hora que pasa por cada sector.  El oficio de carretillero lo aprendió desde muy niño, pues no pudo estudiar y debió dedicarse a producir a corta edad; por eso cuando fue adulto y organizó su hogar, logró con esta actividad salir adelante con su familia y tener su propia casa, que perdió debido a que fue azotado por la ola invernal, y hoy fue   reubicado en el proyecto de vivienda Ciudad Bicentenario, gestionado por la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, en su misión de construir comunidades sostenibles. Pablo ha continuado con su negocio, pero con prestamos onerosos que desea reemplazar, esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  con el cual comprará hortalizas, tubérculos, frutas, legumbres de contado, para ganar mayores descuentos y para que sus utilidades no se queden en manos de particulares que le han prestado dinero y es aquí donde radica el éxito de su credikiva.
texts.en:
Pablo is 52 years old, married and the father of three children between the age of 23 and 31. Together with his family, he lives in the city of Cartagena where he makes a living selling fruits, vegetables and tubers. 
Every day, Pablo leaves very early in the morning with his cart full of these products. He sells them to his clients which await him in the different neighborhoods of Cartagena at exactly the time he passes through each sector. 
He learned the trade of wheelbarrowing when he was very young. He could not study and had to make a living for himself at a young age. This is why he was able to get ahead with his business together with his family and own their own house when he was an adult and had to care for a household. They lost their house because it was destroyed in the rainy season. 
Today, they have moved to the housing project Cuidad Bicentenario managed by the foundation Mario Santo Domingo. Its mission is to build sustainable communities. 
Pablo has continued with his business but with expensive loans that he wants to replace. 
This is the reason he is asking for a loan from Kiva, the first financing which he uses through the foundation Mario Santo Domingo. With this loan he will buy garden vegetables, tubers, fruits, vegetable in cash to receive larger discounts. Like this his profits will not stay in the hands of the people who lent him money. This is the success of his credit from Kiva.

loans.use: to buy garden vegetables, tubers, fruits, and vegetable in cash.

loans.name: Nazira

texts.ru:
Назире 40 лет, замужем, имеет 4 детей, младшему из которых 3 года. Назира в качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, на протяжении  20 лет занимается полеводством  и животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы в 10,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Назиры в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется дойная корова в приплодом, 4 лошади, 1,8 га орошаемой земельной доли с фасолью и многолетними травами.   
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Назира обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку дойных коров для увеличения надоев.  Доходы от кредита Назира планирует вкладывать в развитие бизнеса, чтобы иметь возможность оплатить обучение для старших сына и дочери.
texts.en:
Nazira is 40 years old. She is married and has four children, the youngest of whom is 3 years old. As the main breadwinner of the family, for the last 20 years Nazira has been raising cattle and growing crops, a business which she started with only 10,000 Kyrgyzstan Som (KGS). Thanks to her persistent hard work, her farm now has a dairy cow and calf, 4 horses, and 1.8 hectares of irrigated land where she grows beans and perennial herbs. 

Nazira contacted the company Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 70,000 KGS, which will allow her to further develop her business by purchasing more dairy cows to increase milk production. Nazira plans to use the income generated by this expansion to pay for the education of her older son and daughter.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Bessie Magali

texts.es: Bessie Magali de treinta y cinco años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus hijos en casa propia. Ella es cosmetóloga y su trabajo lo realiza de forma ambulante visita a sus diferentes clientes hasta el hogar, tiene diez años de experiencia  en la labor y  eso le permite mantener la calidad , tiene mucha clientela fija que la recomienda siempre pues tiene los mejores precios y un excelente servicio siempre a la orden de las personas; Bessie es una mujer emprendedora, luchadora y entregada a sus sueños, piensa que no hay batalla tan fuerte para el que lucha con el corazón, ella entrega su corazón a su trabajo y sabe que así alcanzara el éxito, realiza compra y venta de material de uso personal y todo es al contado quiere aumentar el comercio pero para ello necesita de capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permite comprar cosméticos, cremas,  shampoo, peines, etc. Bessie Magali tiene buenas referencias de pago y asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez tiene la confianza que podrá ofrecerle a su familia la calidad de vida que se merece.
texts.en:
Bessie Magali, 35, lives with her husband and children in their own house.  She is a cosmetologist and provides her services to different customers in their homes.  She has been in business for ten years, which has enabled her to keep up her quality.  She has many fixed customers who always recommend her because of her good prices and excellent customer service.

Bessie is hard-working, determined, and self-sacrificing toward her goals.  She believes nothing is too hard to accomplish when you put your heart into it.  She puts her heart into her work and knows that this is how she will become successful.  She buys and sells personal care merchandise on a cash basis.  She wants to expand her business but needs the capital to do so.  Therefore, she has requested a loan through INTEGRAL, to buy cosmetics, creams, shampoo, combs, etc.  

Bessie Magali has good payment references and is committed to paying back the loan on time, while offering her family the quality lifestyle they deserve.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics, creams, shampoo and combs.

loans.name: Fozil

texts.ru: Фозил проживает в районе Кубодиен. Ему 21 год. Он женат. Образование у него среднее. Фозил зарабатывает путем разведения крупнорогатого и мелко-рогатого скота. В этой области он два года. Фозил просит кредит для закупа овец и коз с целью увеличения поголовья скота.
texts.en:
Fozil lives in the Qubadiyon district. He is 21 years old, married, and has a secondary level of education. He makes a living by rearing cattle, sheep and goats. He has been in this sector for two years. 

Fozil has requested a loan to purchase sheep and goats, with the intention of increasing the size of his livestock herd.

loans.use: to purchase sheep and goats

loans.name: Rano

texts.ru: Рано 41 лет. Она замужем. Ее мужа зовут Гайратчон и он работает строителем. Рано и ее муж на воспитании имеют четверо детей. Все ее дети учатся в университете и в школе. Рано более 19 лет работает в средней школе учительницей. Она очень успешный педагог, но ее зарплата не хватает, чтобы оплатит за учебу детей. Ее старший сын, Мухридин в этом году поступил в Таджикский Государственный Университет Коммерции. Мухриддин успешно окончил среднюю школу и  будущим он хочет стать банкиром. Рано запрашивает кредит на сумму 800 долларов США для оплаты годового договора университета, где учится ее сын. Она ждет вашу доброту. Давайте поможем молодому Мухриддину стать банкиром.
texts.en:
Rano is 41 years old and married. Her husband's name is Gairatchon, and he works as a construction worker. Rano and her husband take care of four children. All of her children study at university and at school. For more than 19 years, Rano has worked as a teacher in a secondary school. She is a very effective educator, but her salary is not enough to pay for her children's education. 

This year Rano's eldest son, Mukhriddin, was accepted to Tajik State University of Commerce. Mukhriddin successfully finished secondary school and wants to become a banker in the future. Rano is asking for a loan in the amount of 800 US dollars for payment of the annual contract with the university, where her son studies. She awaits your kindness. Let's help young Mukhriddin become a banker.

loans.use: To pay for study at university

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cheese, pork cracklings, beans, corn and vegetables.

loans.name: Juana Olimpia

texts.es: Juana Olimpia de cuarenta y siete años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y su hijo. Ella se dedica a la venta de mariscos en el merado de la localidad donde reside, tiene muchos años con el pequeño negocio y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia en las ventas, ya tiene mucha clientela pues las personas la prefieren por la calidad de su producto fresco y por su buen precio además de un servicio inigualable; Juana es una mujer emprendedora, motivada con muchas ganas de salir adelante, sabe que entre mas duro trabaje estará creando un espacio en su vida para que algo nuevo emerja y pueda alcanzar el éxito, en la ultima temporada de pesca quiere aprovechar para duplicar su inversión y así obtener mejores ganancias pero para ello necesita de capital que lo respalde por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar camarones, pesado, cangrejo, conchas, etc. Juana Olimpia tiene buenas referencias de pago y es muy responsable asegura que podrá cancelar la deuda y a la vez darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Juana Olimpia, 47, lives with her husband and son.  She sells shell-fish at the local market and has been running her small business for several years, gaining much sales experience.  She has many customers because they prefer the quality of her fresh products, her good prices and unequaled customer service.

Juana is an enterprising woman who is very motivated and determined to get ahead.  She knows that the harder she works, the better able she will be to come up with something new and become successful.  During the last fishing season she wants to take advantage and double her investment to obtain better profits.  But she is lacking capital backing and is, therefore, requesting a loan through INTEGRAL to buy shrimp, fish, crab, molluscs, etc.

Juana Olimpia has good payment references and is very responsible.  She is committed to paying back the loan on time while giving her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy shrimp, fish, crab, and molluscs.

loans.name: Ada

texts.es:
Ada tiene 44 años, tiene tres hijos, con lo que viven en una casa arrendada ubicada en la localidad de Chilca.
Casi toda su vida ha estado ligada a la elaboración de pan, pues ahora está administrando la panadería que heredó de su padre, que ha estado funcionando desde hace 42 años. Trabaja todos los días, con sus hermanos, solo descansa los domingos. Ella abastece de panes, pasteles y galletas a diversas pastelerías. Disfruta mucho de su trabajo porque le permite ser una empresaria y tener satisfacción personal cuando cumple las metas que se propone. Para más adelante está viendo la manera de adquirir maquinaria nueva para optimizar su productividad.

Este es su quinto crédito con MFP y espera mejorar su negocio, ya que tiene muchas ideas. Le gusta trabajar con su grupo porque las integrantes son personas conocidas en el rubro de su negocio y aprenden unas de otras. También promete ser puntual con sus pagos.
Ada invertirá este dinero en la compra de una máquina panificadora para la elaboración de más panes.
texts.en:
Ada, 44, has three children and they live in a rented house in the town of Chilca.

She has been making bread all her life and is now running a bakery that she inherited from her father and which has been in business for 42 years.  She works every day, alongside her brothers, and only takes Sundays off.  She sells bread, pastry, cookies and other types of bakery products.  She enjoys her work very much because it allows her to have her own business and feel the personal satisfaction of meeting one's goals.  In the future she wants to buy machinery to optimize her productivity.

This is her fifth loan through MFP and she wants to improve her business, since she has many ideas.  She enjoys working with her communal bank because all of the members are acquaintances in her business sector and they all learn from one another.  She is committed to paying back the loan on time, and will use the money to buy a bread-making machine to make more bread.

loans.use: To buy a bread-making machine.

loans.name: Erika

texts.es:
Erika tiene 31 años, vive en la casa de sus padres, con ellos y sus hermanos.
Desde hace 6 años se dedica al alquiler de departamentos en la ciudad de Lima. Su primer departamento lo compró con un dinero que tenía ahorrado más un préstamo, y en la actualidad ya tiene varios inmuebles, los cuales sigue arrendando. Pero ahora Erika desea incursionar en la hotelería, sus padres la apoyan en este nuevo objetivo y le ofrecieron una casa en el centro de su ciudad donde está comenzando a pintar y redecorar los ambientes. Espera muy pronto inaugurar su nuevo negocio.

Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, le gusta trabajar con su grupo y promete ser puntual con sus pagos.
Erika invertirá este dinero en la compra de muebles para las habitaciones de su nuevo hotel.
texts.en:
Erika is 31 years old. She lives in her parents' house with them and her siblings. For six years she has rented out apartments in the city of Lima. She bought her first apartment with some savings and a loan. Now she has various properties which she continues to rent. But now she wants to get into the hotel business. Her parents support her new objective and have offered her a house in the center of town, which she is starting to paint and redecorate. She hopes to open her new business soon.

This is her third loan with MFP. She likes working with her group and promises to make her payments on time. Erika will invest this money in buying furniture for the rooms of her new hotel.

loans.use: to buy furniture for her new hotel.

loans.name: Xhemail

texts.en: Xhemail is a 36-year-old married man with three children; one of whom is attending school. They live in a small village where the majority of people are unemployed and generate income mainly from agriculture. As is tradition, Xhemail has supported his family for many years in the same manner, using a machine to cultivate and maintain the properties of others. Recently his machine broke down and Xhemail was unable to work and generate income. He is requesting a loan to pay the costs of repairing his machine, labor needs, as well as to buy tires. With the help of this loan, he can expand the number and frequency of the work he completes, thereby generating a larger income for his family.  He is very grateful to KosInvest- KIVA for the financial support given to him.

loans.use: To pay for repairing his machine and to buy tires.

loans.name: Jesca

texts.en: Jesca is a married woman. She has five children with ages ranging from eight to 25 years. She describes herself to be determined, jovial, and patient. She operates a kindergarten where she provides an early childhood development service. She has been involved in this business for six years and employs three staff members. Her business is located within a residential area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough space for students to play. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stationery. Her business goal is to run a school with more classes within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her school compound, which will attract more students, guardians, and parents.

loans.use: to buy stationery.

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en: Mwanasiti, 29, is married to Bakari who is a businessman. They have three children that still depend on them. Mwanasiti has had her general shop for the last four years. She has very good clientele and gets help from her husband. Together, they run the business. She’s asking for this loan to buy sugar, oil, meat, tea, rice, and other items to be able to offer a variety to her customers thus improving her income.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Neng's Group

texts.en:
Neng is a 41-year-old married woman living in a rural village of Dambae District of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has four children; three (one daughter and two sons) of whom are dependent on her and still in school. To support the family, she and her husband have been growing cassava on three hectares of farmland and rubber trees on 1.5 hectares of farmland, they also supplement the family’s income through raising pigs, which they have been doing for the last ten years. The current business earns them about KHR 50,000 per day to meet the family’s needs. 

Neng’s group consists of two members living in the same village to request the first loan with VisionFund. She and her group member are applying for a loan of KHR 500,000 each. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy bowls for extracting latex and use a portion of it to spend on labor costs in her farming business. She hopes this loan will enable a positive impact on her current business improvement as well as her living standards.

loans.use: To buy bowls for extracting latex.

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
Riziki is from the village of Amkeni, Msambweni, Kenya. She has a food stall business and she tells us that she’s been in business for more than one year, so she has good knowledge of this business.

She comments that she has an established good clientele and that it’s the only food stall in the neighborhood. It’s quite a sacrifice because she must rise at dawn to do her purchases so that she can lower her costs and be able to make higher profits.

She defines herself as a very hardworking, tenacious woman who always strives to get ahead. Through her work, Riziki has managed to make some home improvements and provide her children with the necessary schooling.

She needs this loan to buy cooking fat oil, wheat flour, maize flour and other supplies that she needs to stock her store.

loans.use: to buy cooking fat oil, wheat flour, maize flour and other supplies

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is from the village of Msambweni. She’s married and has children. She is a very hardworking, responsible, and very honest woman. According to what she told us, she started out working as a farmer. Her dream has always been to have an eatery and to sell beverages in a general at home and today she has her own business; she has a regular clientele and good income thanks to her work and efforts.

Amina tells us that she wants to continue growing and this is why she always strives  working from "sun-to-sun" and why she’s asking for a loan to buy beverages, meat, condiments, vegetables and other ingredients for her eatery. She is thankful for the support she’s getting from Kiva and Yehu Microfinance.

loans.use: to buy beverages, meat, condiments, vegetables and other ingredients.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Twenty-eight year-old Fatuma lives in the southwest area of the town in a rental house. She is a single, enterprising lady. She started her business idea in 2010, because she saw a business opportunity in the area. She operates a food stall selling to the neighborhood. She's currently applying for her first Kiva loan, which she'll use to purchase food ingredients such as cooking oil, wheat and maize flour, beans, and rice. Her goal is to expand and diversify her business to a variety of dishes. Meanwhile, she maintains a sales profit of no less than 15%, and she plans to gradually increase it by buying in bulk and selling fast-changing products, so that she earns a bit more. That is the reason why she firmly believes that with her Kiva loan, she'll successfully increase her capital and be able to open a hotel.

loans.use: to purchase food ingredients such as cooking oil, wheat and maize flour, beans, and rice.

loans.name: Benter

texts.en: Benter is a married woman. She has a daughter who is five years old. She describes herself to be polite, humble, and jovial. She operates a retail store where she sells items such as sugar, salt, painkillers, eggs, bread, detergents, soda, flour, maize flour, etc. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located within a residential area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough funds for improving the retail shop. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy cooking fat, maize flour and sugar. Her business goal is to run a wholesale shop within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have improved her business. This is her first loan from SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, maize flour and cooking fat for resale.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha, 49, has ten children. She has a food cafe that with much sacrifice, she has been able to keep open. She rises at dawn to go to Msambweni market to make her purchases. Once a week, she goes to the wholesale foodstuffs market thus managing to lower costs and retain a good clientele. She comments that she does well since her store is well-stocked and she offers her customers a very good variety. Her goal is to continue growing this way to continue helping her family.

Asha needs this loan to buy utensils used for cooking, more furniture for her clients, and other items in quantity to earn better profits. In the future, she wants to enlarge the business and also to establish another cafe to be able to do her work better.

loans.use: to buy utensils used for cooking and more furniture for her clients.

loans.name: Bornface

texts.en:
Bonface is 30 years old and married to Salome. They are blessed with two children, ages 1 and 2. 

Bonface repairs bicycles, a business he ventured into 12 years ago. He earns a monthly income of KES 20,000.

Bonface wants to purchase bicycle spare parts for use in his shop. He has requested a first loan of KES 30,000.The profit he makes will help him repay his loan. His dream is to see his business expand to a garage.

loans.use: To purchase bicycle spare parts for use in his shop.

loans.name: Mwanatumu

texts.en:
Mwanatumu is 47 years old. She is married and has three children. She and her family live in Likoni, Kenya. 

Mwanatumu owns a motorcycle and has hired someone to operate it. Her husband is also a businessman. 

Mwanatumu is requesting a loan of KES 40,000 to purchase another motorcycle. In the future, she would like to incorporate hand carts into her current business.

Her goal is to ensure that her children are educated.

loans.use: to purchase another motorcycle.

loans.name: Doricus

texts.en:
Doricus is a 48-year-old lady from Nyalenda Kisumu. She is widowed but takes care of five children between the ages of 2 and 20. She has been operating a food stall business for the last six years and earns a monthly income of KES 9,000. 

Doricus is now taking her first loan with KADET LTD, which she will use to buy foodstuffs such as cooking oil, flour and sugar. She will use the expected profits to educate her children.

Her dream is to expand her food stall to a bigger one.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs such as cooking oil, flour and sugar.

loans.name: Dieu Est Ma Joie Group

texts.fr: Le groupe DIEU EST MA JOIE est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans un même quartier et qui appartiennent à un même groupe de tontine. C'est la cinquième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Zinhoué Rose est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Zinhoué Rose n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Zinhoué Rose est âgée de 33 ans et est mariée à un chauffeur du nom de Joseph. Le couple a deux enfants, dont un scolarisé et tous à leur charge. Zinhoué Rose vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple se partage les différentes charges de la maison. Pour contribuer aux différents besoins de la famille, Zinhoué Rose exerce depuis neuf ans, la couture à son domicile. Parallèlement à cette activité, Zinhoué Rose vend divers articles de couture et du charbon de bois. Cette activité lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté à ses besoins. Zinhoué Rose s’approvisionne dans sa région. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Zinhoué Rose sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe DIEU EST MA JOIE, un cinquième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce prêt leur permettra de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et d’accroître leur clientèle et leur revenu. Les premiers crédits reçus ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The Dieu Est Ma Joie (God is my Joy) group has three members, all of whom live in the same neighborhood and belong to the same savings group. This is the fifth time that this group has requested financial assistance from Alidé, in order to increase their business levels. 

The group’s representative is called Zinhoué Rose, and is pictured with her hand raised in the photo. She did not go to school, and is 33 years of age. She is married to a driver called Joseph, and the couple has two children, one at school and both under their care. Zinhoué Rose lives together with her husband and children, and the couple shares the household expenses. 

To meet her family’s various needs, for the past nine years Zinhoué Rose has worked sewing from home. In addition to this business, she also sells various sewing items and charcoal. This business allows her to provide for herself without much difficulty. 

Zinhoué Rose gets her supplies in the region where she lives. In order to satisfy her customers, increase her sales and have a higher income, she has requested a fifth loan from Alidé along with the other members of the Dieu Est Ma Joie group. This loan will allow them to increase their business levels, have more customers and increase their income. The first loans they received were successfully repaid.

loans.use: To buy sewing materials and charcoal.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 38 años, vive con su hijo, en la casa de su hermana.
Tiene 6 años de experiencia en la preparación y venta de pasteles. Ella misma realiza las tortas, pasteles y bocaditos, por la tarde las vende en la tienda que acondicionó en su casa, aunque también reparte sus pasteles a otras tiendas que se lo soliciten. Disfruta de su trabajo porque puede poner en práctica sus habilidades y creatividad para la decoración, ya que entre mejor elaborado esté el pastel, mejor precio puede obtener por cada uno.

Este es su séptimo crédito con MFP y espera dinamizar su negocio con el dinero adquirido, ya que tiene muchas ideas para mejorar sus ganancias. Además, le gusta trabajar con su grupo  porque las integrantes son personas conocidas.
Rosa invertirá el dinero de este préstamo en la compra de harina por kilos, azúcar y mantequilla, para seguir preparando sus pasteles, de diferentes sabores y texturas.
texts.en:
Rosa is 38 years old and lives with her son in her sister’s house.  She has six years of experience in the preparation and sale of pastries.  She herself make the pies, cakes and snacks and in the afternoon she sells them in the store that she set up in her house, although she also distributes her pastries to other stores that request them.  She enjoys her work because she can put her skills and creativity into practice for the decoration, since the more elaborate the cake is, the better price she can obtain for each one. 

This is her seventh loan with MFP and she hopes to energize her business with the acquired money as she has many ideas for improving her earnings.  Also, she likes to work with her group because the members are well-known people.  Rosa will invest the money from this loan in the purchase of flour by the kilo, sugar and butter in order to continue preparing her pastries of different flavors and textures.

loans.use: to purchase flour by the kilo, sugar and butter in order to continue preparing her pastries of different flavors and textures.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
Virginia tiene 44 años, vice con sus padres y hermanos, en la casa que compraron hace 30 años.
Sus principales ingresos económicos son a base de la venta de ropa y la pastelería. Esta última le agrada mucho, pues tiene amplio conocimiento en repostería y tiene sus propias máquinas. Diariamente elabora empanadas, alfajores, queques y demás, un promedio de 90 unidades como mínimo, los que reparte a las diversas tiendas de su localidad. Las temporadas de mayor demanda son los meses de fiestas patrias y navidad, en esos meses tiene que contratar personal para que la apoyen. Hace poco incursionó en la elaboración de tortas, por pedidos especiales, como matrimonios y cumpleaños, y espera dinamizar sus ventas para ganar más experiencia y clientes.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP. Le gusta de trabajar con su grupo, ya que las integrantes son personas conocidas, también promete ser puntual con sus pagos. 
Virginia invertirá este dinero en la compra de sacos de harina, mantequilla por kilos y manteca para la elaboración de sus pasteles.
texts.en: Virginia is 44 years old. She lives with her parents and siblings in the house they bought 30 years ago. Her principal income is based on the sale of clothing and baking. She greatly enjoys the latter since she is well versed in confectionery and has her own machines. She makes empanadas, alfajores , sponge cakes and other pastries every day, an average of 90 items at a minimum, which she delivers to various stores in the area. The seasons when there is the greatest demand are those of national holidays and Christmas. During those months she has to hire personnel to help her. A short while ago she ventured into making elaborate cakes because of special orders, such as for marriages and birthdays, and she hopes to energize her sales to gain more experience and customers. This is her first loan from MFP. She enjoys working with her group because the members are people she knows. She also promises to be punctual in her payments. Virginia will invest this money in the purchase of sacks of four, butter by the kilo and lard to make her pastries.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of flour, butter by the kilo and lard to make her pastries.

loans.name: Salvador

texts.es: Salvador de 42 años de edad, es una persona que se dedica de lleno a su trabajo todo con la determinación de salir adelante y brindarle todo lo necesario a su esposa y sus cuatro hijos. Salvador trabaja transportando persona a diferentes destinos como: colegios, iglesias y diferentes departamentos del país. Con el deseo de mejorar su negocio, él solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, y de esta forma comprar repuestos para su microbús, ya que para Salvador su seguridad y la de sus clientes es de mucha importancia, lo que también le permitirá contar con muy buenas referencias y más personas interesadas en contratar sus servicios. Lo que más anhela Salvador es poder salir adelante y contar con una mejor estabilidad para su hogar y su familia.
texts.en:
Salvador, age 42, is a person who devotes himself completely to his work.  He does this with the determination to get ahead and to give his wife and four children all of the necessities.

Salvador works transporting people to different destinations like schools, churches, and the different departments in the country.  He wishes to improve his business.

He is requesting a loan from Integral to buy replacement parts for his minivan.   His safety and that of his customers is very important to Salvador.  The replacement parts will also allow him to have very good references, and more people interested in contracting his services.

What Salvador yearns for the most is to be able to get ahead and to have better stability for his household and his family.

loans.use: to buy replacement parts for his vehicle.

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is a married man. He has a son who is 3 years old. He describes himself as honest, careful and hardworking. 

He operates a barber shop where he provides hair cut services. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located along a busy road and his primary customers are students, residents and businesspeople. 

He describes his biggest business challenge as frequent disturbance by local authorities and the high cost of electricity and rent. 

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy a shaving machine. His business goal is to expand his business by opening beauty saloon services within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will have expanded his business and improved the living standard of people.

loans.use: to buy a shaving machine and pay for the renovation of the barber shop.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María tiene 38 años, está casada con Isaac, con quien tiene dos hijos: Joel y Margot. Viven en una casa alquilada desde hace 8 años.
Sus 7 años de experiencia en la agricultura y ganadería le ayudaron a poseer los ingresos necesarios para mantener a sus hijos y educarlos. Sus principales sembríos constan de maíz, papa y cebada, los que cultiva en sus propios terrenos agrícolas que se ubican en los alrededores de su localidad. Se siente agradecido por el apoyo que recibe, pues de esa manera puede distribuir el capital de trabajo sin descuidar los gastos familiares. Los animales que cría son ovejas y cerdos, los cuales engorda para vender en la feria de los domingos. Gusta mucho de sus actividades, por lo que piensa incrementar su capital de trabajo para poder producir en mayor cantidad.

Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “Nuevo amanecer” y este es su séptimo crédito con MFP. En todo este tiempo (más de 3 años) obtuvo el dinero necesario para invertir en el desarrollo de su negocio, por lo que promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le agrada pertenecer a su grupo, donde todas las personas son responsables.
María invertirá este dinero en la compra de fertilizantes naturales para esparcir entre sus sembríos de maíz. También comprará cinco ovejas.
texts.en:
Maria is 38 years old and married to Isaac, with whom she has two children, Joel and Margot. They have been living in a rented home for 8 years.

Her 7 years of experience in farming and stockbreeding helped them to earn the income necessary to support their children and educate them. Her principle crops consist of corn, potatoes and barley which she cultivates on their own land located in the surrounding area. She is grateful for the help she is receiving, which enables her to use working capital without neglecting family expenses. The animals she is raising are sheep and pigs, which she fattens to sell at Sunday markets. She greatly enjoys her work and plans to increase her working capital in order to produce in greater volume.

Maria belongs to the “Nuevo amanecer” Communal Bank and this is her seventh loan from MFP. In all of this time (more than three years), she obtained the money needed to invest in the development of her business and thus promises to be punctual in making her payments.
