In addition, she likes belonging to her group, where all the people are responsible. She will invest the money in the purchase of natural fertilizer to spread in her maiz fields. She will also buy five sheep.

loans.use: to purchase natural fertilizers and five sheep.

loans.name: Elsa Isela

texts.es: Elsa de 33 años de edad, es una señora muy trabajadora, la cual vive junto  a  dos hijos los cuales se dedican a estudiar.  Elsa posee su propia tienda de productos perecederos en la cual comercializa: golosinas, sodas, jugos, leche, pan, granos básicos y otros más, el negocio se encuentra en su casa de habitación, lo que es de mucho beneficio para ella debido a que le permite cuidar de su hogar al mismo tiempo que atiende su tienda. A pesar que cuenta con mucha competencia, ella posee varios clientes los cuales a diario consumen de sus productos. Elsa solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para surtir la tienda, comprando productos por mayor, de manera que cuente con todo lo necesario para atender de la mejor manera a sus clientes y así obtener algunos nuevos. Elsa desea mucho poder aumentar sus ventas y de esta forma vivir mejor junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Elsa, age 33, is a very hard-working woman.  She lives with her two children who go to school.

Elsa has her own store where she sells perishable products like candy, sodas, juice, milk, bread, basic grains, and others.  The store is located in her house.  This is very helpful to her because it allows her to take care of her household at the same time she is tending to her store.  In spite of having a lot of competition, she has various customers who consume her products daily.

Elsa is requesting a loan to stock her store.  She will buy wholesale products in order to have everything needed in order to tend to his customers in the best way.  This way she will get some new customers.  Elsa wishes to be able to increase her sales, and by doing so she wishes to live better with her family.

loans.use: to buy perishable products to sell.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a 25-year-old single mother of a 6-year-old child. She runs an M-pesa shop (a mobile phone-based money transfer service), a business she ventured into two years ago, and earns a monthly income of KES 25,000. 

She has requested a second loan of KES 60,000 to add more float to her M-pesa business. The profit she earns from this business will help her open another branch. 

Her dream is to see her business prosper as well as to educate her child.

loans.use: To add more float to her M-pesa money-transfer business.

loans.name: Tumaini

texts.en:
Tumaini, age 25, is a married lady with no children yet. Her husband is a teacher. They live in a rental house but she says that they have plans to own a house in future.

She established her own source of income last year with the help of her husband. She manages a motorcycle. She has hired a gentleman to operate it. Tumaini is happy since it has been a profitable project.

The loan she is currently requesting is her first loan, and it is for 10,000 KES. With this loan she wants to service her motorcycle to increase its efficiency. In addition to this business, she sells khangas (traditional African print cloth), which she operates fully by herself. 

She hopes to repay her loan in due time so as to request more loans. Her dream is to save funds for the anticipated children's education.

loans.use: to service her motorcycle.

loans.name: Phylis

texts.en:
Phylis is a 39-year-old lady from Kisumu city. She is widowed but takes care of two children, age 18 and 24 years.

She operates a clothes-selling business where she sells new clothing and has been doing this for the last 12 years. She makes a monthly income of KES 30,000. 

She is now taking her first loan from KADET Ltd., which she will use to buy more stock of new clothes. Her profits will be used to educate her children.

Her dream is to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more stock of new clothing.

loans.name: Nkirimpa

texts.en:
Nkirimpa is 34 years old. He is married to Sikinan, who works as a teacher. They are blessed with two children, age 2 and 12 years.

He has been in business for six years in which he earns KES 20,000 monthly. 

This is his first KADET Ltd. loan, which he will use to purchase more animals for sale. The profit he gets he will use to expand his business. His dream is to have a better future for his family.

loans.use: to purchase more animals for resale.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 47 years old. She is married to Reuben and blessed with four children aged 26, 23, 21 and 18 years. She has a wholesale shop where she sells sacks, a business she started 28 years ago. She earns a monthly income of 50,000 Kenyan shillings (KES). 

She has requested a second loan of 60,000 KES to purchase sacks and polyethylene bags for sale. The profit earned from the business will help her repay her loan and buy additional stock.

Her dream is to expand her business, build rental houses and be able to cater for her family's needs.

loans.use: To purchase sacks and polyethylene bags for sale.

loans.name: Fitore

texts.en:
Fitore is living in the southern part of Kosovo. She works in an agricultural pharmacy. Fitore is recently married. Her husband works as a television salesman.

She always dreamed of owning a pharmacy shop, and she was fortunate enough to be able to achieve this after she graduated. She started an agricultural pharmacy business with a few items with money she managed to raise on her own. She sells all agricultural products such arboriculture, farming and also agricultural tools.

Now she is requesting a loan in order to buy different agricultural materials for her business to sell in the store. This would assist her in expanding her business and attaining growth, as she will be able to supply more items for her customers and sell a larger range of products.

In the near future, she is hoping to have children. Her goal is to grow her business and to be able to save money for her future children.

She is very grateful for Kiva support to help her to continue growing and developing her business!

loans.use: To buy different agricultural materials for her business.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a 37-year-old man from Kisumu City. He is married to Dorothy, and they have seven school-going children. He operates a fish-selling business, a business he has been doing for the past 13 years. Charles makes a monthly income of 5,000 Kenyan shillings (KES). 

He is now taking his first loan from KADET LTD., which he will use to buy fresh fish for sale. Charles intends to use the anticipated profits to increase his stock and become a main supplier.

His dream is to be successful in the fish-selling business.

loans.use: To buy stock of fresh fish for sale.

loans.name: Lumnije

texts.en:
Lumnije is a 28-year-old widow. She has one child. Lumnije lives in the southern part of Kosovo in the Ashkali community. The Ashkali community is typically poor and has substandard living conditions. Lumnije owns a small farm stable with a cow. She provides milk and milk products for the family. She wants to expand her farm and to add more cows in order to sell milk products in her area.

To earn more money, she also works as a caregiver (babysitter), which is a common way for women in this community to earn a small income. She loves what she does and is committed to it because she likes caring for babies. 

Because she is a widow, she must work harder and longer hours to earn enough money for living expenses. With a goal to further grow her farm business, she requested a loan from KosInvest-Kiva to renovate her stable. 

She is hoping to be able to save money for her child’s education expenses. She is aware that without Kiva lenders support, her life will be difficult. She really appreciative this help!

loans.use: To renovate her stable.

loans.name: María Luz

texts.es: María Luz de cincuenta y nueve años de edad vive junto a su familia, ella se dedica a la venta de sandalias de forma ambulante, tiene de varios estilos y tamaños, para damas, caballeros y niños, comercia en todos los lugares aledaños a su localidad y se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues las personas saben que el producto es de primera calidad, a precio accesible y además con un buen servicio; María es una mujer activa, dedicada a su labor y  muy soñadora, quiere alcanzar un futuro mas prospero y esta dispuesta a lograrlo, en los últimos meses tuvo algunas perdidas en las ventas y quiere recuperarse pero no posee de suficiente capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar sandalias por mayor. María Luz tiene buenas referencias de pago, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda en el periodo establecido y a la vez tiene la confianza que podrá ofrecerle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maria Luz, 59 years old, lives with her family. She is a traveling shoe saleswoman and has various styles and sizes for ladies, gentlemen and children. She markets her wares in surrounding areas and has acquired many customers because people know that her products are top quality at accessible prices and that she provides good service.

Maria is an active woman, who is dedicated to her work and very much a dreamer. She wants to achieve a more prosperous future and is ready to do so. In recent months she had some sales losses and wants to recuperate them, however she does not have sufficient capital.  Thus she is applying for a loan from INTEGRAL, which will allow her to purchase shoes wholesale. Maria Luz has a good payment history and assures that she will be able to pay off the debt within the established time period. At the same time she is confident that she will be able to provide a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy shoes wholesale.

loans.name: Domitila

texts.es: Domitila de 49 años de edad,  vive junto a su hija con quien se dedican a su propio negocio. Ella es madre soltera quien trabaja muy duro por sacar adelante  a su hija adelante y brindarle  todo lo mejor y necesario. La señora Domitila posee una tienda en la que comercializa productos perecederos y de primera necesidad, la cual está ubicada en su casa de habitación. Ella solicita un préstamo por medio del cual tenga la capacidad económica de surtir su negocio, esto debido a que Domitila no cuenta con el dinero necesario para hacerlo, y es muy necesario tanto para ella como para su hija, ya que es este el negocio que les permite solventar sus gastos familiares. Ella desea poder surtir su tienda con productos como detergente, comida enlatada, pan, golosinas, bebidas, productos plásticos y otros  más, los cuales son de primera necesidad en un hogar y que también son los que se solicitan más en una tienda. Domitila espera mejorar las ganancias y de esta forma contar con una vida más estable.
texts.en:
Domitila, age 49, lives with her daughter, with whom she works in her own business.  She is a single mother, and she works very hard to get her daughter ahead and to give her the best and everything she needs. 

Domitila has a store where she sells perishable products and basic needs products.  The store is located in her house.

She is requesting a loan to stock her business.  This is because Domitila does not have the money needed to do so.  It is much needed by her as much as for her daughter.  It is this business that’s allows them to cover the family expenses.

She wishes to be able to stock her store with products like detergent, canned food, bread, candy, drinks, plastic products, and others.  These are  basic needs products for the household.  They are also the products that are most requested in the store.

Domitila hope to improve her income in order to have a more stable life.

loans.use: to buy bread, drinks, and plastic products to sell.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es: Luis de 65 años de edad, es un hombre muy responsable, el cual vive junto a su esposa la cual se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar. Él es un señor  muy trabajador quien posee su propio negocio el cual es una tienda en la que comercializa productos perecederos y de primera necesidad, su negocio está ubicado en su casa de habitación en donde son muy conocidos. Luis solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de productos como: bebidas, pan, golosinas, desinfectantes, detergentes, pan, cereales y todos los productos que más son solicitados por sus clientes. El mayor deseo de Luis  es el de poder mejorar sus ventas, ya que son estas las que le permiten sostener a su hogar.
texts.en: Luis is 65 years old. He is a very responsible man. He lives with his wife, who tends to the house. He is a very hardworking man who has his own business, which is a store where he sells perishable and basic necessity products. His business is located in his house, where they are very well known. Luis is asking for a loan with which he can buy larger quantities of products such as: beverages, bread, snacks, disinfectants, detergents, bread, cererals, and all of the products that are asked for the most by his customers. Luis' biggest wish is to be able to improve his sales, since these allow him to support his home.

loans.use: to buy disinfectants, detergents, bread and cereals.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 36 years old from Ndunyu and is married with four children who are between 1 and 12 years old.

Stephen is a farmer and has applied for his second loan from KADET LTD to enable him buy fertilizers and pay for labor. He is optimistic that his farm will do well after the loan.

He hopes to buy a piece of land in the near future and build a house.

loans.use: To buy feed, fertilizers and pay for labor

loans.name: Priscah

texts.en:
Priscah is 28 years old and single. She supports her parents financially. She runs an M-PESA business, which is a mobile-phone-based money transfer service. She ventured into this business two years ago and earns a monthly income of KES 30,000. 

Priscah has requested a second loan of KES 60,000 to buy more Safaricom credit cards for sale. 

The profit she earns from this business will help her open another branch. Her dream is to see her business expand and create employment opportunities.

loans.use: to buy more Safaricom credit cards for sale.

loans.name: Milka

texts.en:
Milka is a 40-year-old lady from Kisumu City and is married to Joseph. They have 5 children between 10 to 20 years old. Milka operates a business selling fish, which she has been doing for the last 20 years and makes a monthly income of 10,000 KES. 

She is now taking her first loan from KADET LTD which she will use to buy more stock of fish for sale. She hopes to make a good profit which she will use to supplement her fish stock.

Her dream is to be a successful entrepreneur.

loans.use: To buy more stock of fresh fish for sale.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 25 years old, married to Tom and blessed with one child. She sells grocery goods, a business she started 4 years ago, and earns a monthly income of 5,000 KES. 

She has requested a first loan of 20,000 KES to purchase more beans, maize, fruits and vegetables for sale. The profit from her business will help her educate her children in the future as well as improve her living standard of her family. 

She dreams of being a landlady in the near future.

loans.use: To puchase fruits, vegetables, beans and maize for sale.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: Monica is 42 years old and from Nyandarua South. She is married with 6 children who are all in school. Monica is a farmer and has been for the past 24 years. She has applied for her third loan from KADET LTD to enable her pay school fees for her children. She hopes to educate her children to university level in the near future.

loans.use: To pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more clothing to sell

loans.name: Pedro Francisco

texts.es: Pedro de 58 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa y cuatro hijos menores de edad, quienes se dedican a estudiar. Pedro posee una  venta de tortillas donde su esposa se dedica a elaborarlas, y él le ayuda a repartirlas de casa en casa, lo que les permite brindar un mejor servicio y de esta forma contar con más clientes. Desde hace varios años que posee esta venta de tortillas, siendo la única fuente de ingresos, por lo que es de mucha importancia para Pedro el sacarla adelante y mejorarla día con día, razón por la que solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, por medio del cual pueda comprar toda la materia prima para la elaboración de las tortillas como: mayor cantidad de maíz, cal, gas propano y leña para coser el maíz que posteriormente llevan al molino para convertirlo en masa y así elaborar las tortillas. El mayor deseo de Pedro es aumentar la cantidad de producción para percibir mayores ganancias.
texts.en: Pedro is 58 years old. He lives with his wife and four minor children, who are in school. Pedro has a tortillas selling business. His wife makes them and he delivers them door to door. This allows him to to offer a better service and thus have more customers.  He has had the tortilla business for several years and it is his only source of income. That is why it is very important for Pedro to get it ahead and improve it day to day. That is the reason why he is asking INTEGRAL for a loan. With it, he will be able to buy all of the raw materials to make the tortillas: a larger quantity of corn, propane gas and firewood to cook the corn that will later be taken to the mill to make it into dough and then make the tortillas. Pedro's biggest wish is to increase his production quantity to make more income.

loans.use: to buy corn to make tortillas.

loans.name: Varuzhan

texts.en:
Varuzhan is 45 years old. He is married and has three children, including two daughters and one son. Varuzhan’s elder children are married and live separately while his younger son attends school. Varuzhan’s wife is unemployed.

Varuzhan has been repairing cars in Kajaran for more than five years. He buys old, broken-down cars, repairs them and then sells them for profit. Also, he takes orders for car repairing. 

Varuzhan has his own workshop near his house; this allows him to cut down on his expenses. Additionally, Varuzhan works as a forester since he is the only breadwinner in the family. However, he earns the majority of his income through his auto-repairs business. 

Varuzhan needs a 1.000.000 AMD loan to buy old and broken-down cars, which he will repair and sell for a profit. This is Varuzhan’s second loan from Nor Horizon.

loans.use: to buy old and broken-down cars for his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more bricks for sale

loans.name: Anastase

texts.en:
Anastase is 32 years old and is married with three children. Anastase sells various goods such as sugar, lotions, cooking oil, etc. He has three years of experience in this work, and he currently employs three people to help him. He works from 6 a.m. until 7 p.m. every day. 

Anastase has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to buy various goods such as sugar, lotions, cooking oil, beans, maize, etc., for resale. With any profits from this loan, he will be able to save money for his future and reinvest in his business.

loans.use: To buy various goods such as sugar, lotions, cooking oil, beans, maize, etc., for resale.

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es: Jorge  con su credikiva compró productos naturales, como vitaminas y mercancía variada con los que respondió a su clientela de acuerdo con los pedidos y con ello incrementó el volumen de sus ventas. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, con el cual comprará nuevamente productos medicinales de origen natural, y mercancías varias como  accesorios y  perfumería entre otros. Su inversión de crédito en su negocio es exitosa porque tiene una clientela fija que le refiere nuevos clientes y una experiencia de 35 años que la hacen líder entre ellos. Ella se encuentra muy agradecida con la Fundación y con Kiva por el apoyo económico recibido, espera continuar recibiéndolo para alcanzar sus metas de prosperidad empresarial, familiar y personal.
texts.en: Jorge bought natural products with his Kiva loan, such as vitamins and varied merchandise with which he responded to the customers according to their orders and with this he increased his sales volume. Right now, he is asking for a Kiva loan with thich he will buy natural medicinal products and varied merchandise such as accesories, perfume and more.  His loan investment in his business is succesful because he has regular customers who refer new customers to him, and because he has 35 years experience, which makes him a leader among them. He is very grateful to the Foundation and to Kiva for the financial support he has received. He hopes to continue receiving it to reach his goals of business, family and personal prosperity.

loans.use: to buy natural medicinal products and varied merchandise such as accesories, perfume and more.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en: Angelina is 42 years old, married and has eight children, ages 8 to 22. She describes herself as social and friendly. She operates a retail store where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for two years and employs one staff member. Her business is located along a road in a busy market and her primary customers are residents from the local area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more clothes to resell. Her business goal is to improve her business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children with the profits made .

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is a married gentleman, 23 years old. He supports his wife and 4-year-old son. He operates a motorbike transport business in the Narok area and has been running the business for two years, earning a monthly income of KES 45,000. 

He is requesting his first loan of KES 75,000 from KADET LTD to purchase his own motorbike. The anticipated profit will be used to pay school fees for his child as well as to start a business for his wife.

His dream is to improve his family's living standards and own a residential plot.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Jeniffer

texts.en:
Jeniffer is widowed and  has three children who attend school. She sells new clothes, which she has been doing for eight years. Her primary customers are the residents of her village. 

Jeniffer is requesting a loan for 30,000 KES, which she will use to buy more clothes to sell.  She joined Yehu because of their saving policies, which allow them to save as little as they can.  Her highest monthly expense is food. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Jeniffer aspires to expand the business and open a new shop in the future. She has a number of customers who at times take clothes on credit. The majority of her customers repay their debts. However, not all customers who take her clothes on credit pay on time. Some of them are reluctant to pay, which poses a challenge to her.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Chantal

texts.en: Chantal is 30 years old and married with three children between the ages of 1 and 8. Chantal sells clothes. She has 10 years of experience in this business, and she employs two persons to help her. Chantal has requested a loan from Kiva in order to purchase more clothes to sell. She will use any additional profits to reinvest in her business and to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: David

texts.en: Daniel is 53 years old and is married with four children who are all in school. He is a farmer and has applied for his second loan from KADET LTD to enable him to pay for his children's school fees. He hopes to be the top farmer in Nyandarua in the near future.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a widowed woman. She has 6 children and all are enrolled in school. Margaret sells new clothes and owns a tailoring shop. She's worked in this business for 10 years. Her primary customers are residents and passersby. Margaret's other source of income includes income from her own children. 

Her highest monthly expense is school fees. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Margaret will use the Kes 20,000 loan to fund her business by buying more clothes for resale. She  aspires to expand the business and open a retail shop in the future. She joined Yehu because of the short loan processing lead time.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more bananas for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a refrigerator and a Meko gas cooker for efficiency in his operations.

loans.name: Negba Group

texts.en:
The group Negba is community based with 18 memberships, with 1 male and 17 females. Their ages range between 25 years and 56 years, with 14 members married with children and 5 members single without children. They sell products like cooking utensils, eggs, food stuff, rice, vegetables, plates, hair creams, drinks, flour, fish, second hand clothing, underwear and cooking oil. They are in their 2nd loan cycle with ID-Ghana.

Ebenezer is a goldsmith and he is married with 2 children. He is also the only male in the group and led the group to pay their previous loan without trouble. He designs and manufactures beautiful items like jewelry and supplies customers in Accra and Tema. He buys the gold from Obuasi, a mining town in Ghana. He has been doing this work for 10 years. He needs this loan to support and improve his business so that he can meet his customers' requests. He needs financial support. He will want to operate a big jewelry shop in the future.

They need a total amount of 5,050 Ghana cedis to be able to meet their customers' demands.

loans.use: To buy more gold so that he can manufacture more jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Dagbede Group

texts.fr: Le groupe DAGBEDE est composé de trois personnes qui sont des amies appartenant à un même groupe de tontine. C'est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Gbèdandé Pierrette est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Gbèdandé Pierrette est âgée de 38 ans et ne vit plus avec son mari. Gbèdandé Pierrette a peu fréquenté l’école. Gbèdandé Pierrette est mère de trois enfants, dont certains scolarisés. Gbèdandé Pierrette vit seule avec ses enfants. Pour contribuer aux différents besoins de la famille, Gbèdandé Pierrette vend de la nourriture à son domicile. Parallèlement à cette activité, Gbèdandé Pierrette vend des boissons. Ces activités lui permettent de répondre sans grande difficulté à ses besoins. Gbèdandé Pierrette s’approvisionne dans sa région. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Gbèdandé Pierrette sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe DAGBEDE, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce prêt leur permettra de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et d’accroître leur clientèle et leur revenu.
texts.en:
The DAGBEDE group is made up of three friends who all belong to the same savings group. This is the first time that this group is seeking the financial aid of ALIDé, in order to expand its business.

Gbèdandé Pierrette, the group's representative, is the woman who is raising her hand in the photo. Gbèdandé Pierrette is 38 years old and is no longer living with her husband. She had very little schooling. She is the mother of three children, some of whom have received schooling. She lives alone with her children.

In order to support her family, Gbèdandé Pierrette sells food from her home. On the side, she also sells beverages. These businesses allow her to support her family without too much difficulty. Gbèdandé Pierrette stocks up on supplies in her region.

Striving to satisfy her customers and increase her sales and revenue, Gbèdandé Pierrette, along with the other members of the DAGBEDE group, is seeking a first loan from ALIDé. This loan will allow them to expand their business as well as increase their customer base and revenue.

loans.use: to buy beverages

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy is 40 years old, married to Pius, and blessed with three children aged 18, 10 and 7 years old. She sells blinders (net curtains), a business she started 10 years ago, and earns a monthly income of around KES 80,000. She has requested a second loan of KES 40,000 to purchase three bales of net curtains for sale. Profit from her business will be plowed back into her business. Her dream is to buy a plot of land and build rental houses.

loans.use: To buy one bale of net curtains for resale.

loans.name: Mwaka

texts.en:
Mwaka continues the operation of selling groceries in her grocery store. She says that it is running very well and that she hopes to increase her sales.

Mwaka is requesting another loan so as to invest it in her business. This loan will enable her to purchase more groceries such as tomatoes and oranges, among other staples.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries such as tomatoes and oranges, among other staples.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy essential materials like tires and an engine for his motorbike.

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.en:
Charles is 34 years old, from Naivasha, and is married with three children who are all in school.

Charles has a quarry business which he has been operating for the past 10 years, and he has applied for his first loan from KADET LTD to enable him to buy more stones to use in his quarry.

He hopes to buy a lorry to assist in the distribution of stones.

loans.use: To buy stones for his quarry.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
Mohamed is a married man. He has 7 children. Mohamed operates a retail shop and sells a variety of consumer goods including flour, sugar, beans, etc. He's worked in this business for 15 years. His primary customers are neighbors. Mohamed's other source of income includes farming and his greatest challenge is caused by price fluctuation. His highest monthly expense is food. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

He will use the Kes 30,000 loan to add stock to his shop by buying bags of sugar, rice, bundles of maize flour and other shop related items. Mohamed aspires to become a wholesaler in the future. He joined Yehu because of its clear and affordable policies.

loans.use: to add stock by buying bags of sugar, rice,bundles of maize flour and other shop related stuffs.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 54 years old, from Naivasha, and is married with six children who are aged between 21 and nine years old.

Paul has a business of hawking assorted goods and has applied for his second loan from KADET LTD to enable him buy basins, cooking pans and other goods to add to his stock.

He hopes to be able to own a shop in the near future.

loans.use: To buy basins and cooking pans.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Jenipher

texts.en:
Jenipher is a 30-year-old lady from the Nyalenda area of Kisumu City. She is married to Washington, and they have six children between the ages of six months and 12 years. Jenipher operates a secondhand-clothing business, a business she has been running for the last eight years. She makes a monthly income of 20,000 KES. 

She is now taking her first loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to buy more clothing to sell. Jenipher will use the expected profits to pay house rent and other basic needs. Her dream is to improve her family’s living standards.

loans.use: To buy stock of clothing to sell.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is 37 years old and married. She is a farmer, which she has been doing for nine years.  She earns a monthly income of 20,000 KES.

Arin is requesting her first loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to purchase farm inputs. She was introduced to KADET by one of their field officers. She hopes to educate her children to high levels.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs.

loans.name: Lucia Pabla

texts.es: Lucia con su credikiva compró productos que se encontraban en descuento en sus catálogos e hizo su gran venta a clientes que habían solicitado su pedido y a nuevos que consiguió y adicionó a su registro de cartera.  En la actualidad tiene mucho entusiasmo en su negocio y está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva, para hacer una nueva inversión que haga crecer un poco mas su capital de trabajo, por eso con su credikiva responderá una vez mas a pedidos hechos por su clientela, como calzado para damas e infantil por docenas. Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente:  “Doy gracias a Dios por haber encontrado una entidad que apoye a los pequeños microempresarios a salir adelante, tanto en la parte económica con la financiación, como en la parte intelectual con sus capacitaciones. “
texts.en: Lucia has used past Kiva loans to stock her retail business with discounted products that she bought from catalogs and sold to her customers, both those who had already ordered from her and those who she subsequently found and added to her list of customers.  She says that the business has been a success and that she is applying for a new loan that she will use to expand it.  The investment will allow her to fill orders that she has already received, orders for merchandise such as women's and children's shoes.  She asked us to pass along a message to Kiva lenders: "I am grateful to have found an organiation that helps small businesses like mine get ahead, not only with financial help, but with training too".

loans.use: to stock her retail business.

loans.name: Simeon Bernardo

texts.es: El Señor Simeón tiene 51 años de edad y vive en una casa de su propiedad ubicado en la comunidad de Tolomosa Norte de esta ciudad de Tarija, Simeón es casado y tiene 5 hijo de 4, 6, 7, 9 y 11 años de edad, desde hace más de 30 años que se dedica a la producción, Simeón tiene que trabajar para sacar adelante a sus hijos, Simeón nos indica que quiere tener mejores ingresos económicos para salir adelante, pero nos cuenta que tiene la necesidad de comprar más semillas y algunos fertilizante para tener mejor resultados de su producción y así también incrementar sus ingresos, como él ya tiene experiencia en el rubro el crédito será destinado directamente para compra de semillas, abonos y fertilizante que son necesarios para la actividad, para de esa forma poder incrementar sus ingresos. Simeón nos cuenta que quiere mejorar su nivel de vida de sus hijos, además para eso necesita mejorar sus ingresos, el próximo crédito que solicite será para mejorar las condiciones de su casa.
texts.en:
Simeón is 51 years old and lives in the home he owns in the community of Tolomosa Norte in the city of Tarija. Simeón is married and has five children, who are ages four, six, seven, nine, and eleven. He has been farming for thirty years.

Simeón has to work to provide for his children. He tells us he wants to have better financial income so that he can get ahead, but says he needs to buy more seeds and some fertilizer in order to obtain better results from his production and also increase his income. Since he already has experience in this business, he will use the loan directly to purchase the seeds and fertilizer he needs for his work, so that he can increase his income. 

Simeón tells us he wants to improve his children's standard of living, and in order to do so he needs to improve his income. He will use the next loan he requests to improve his housing conditions.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Felicita Del Socorro

texts.es: Felicita del socorro, casada, con 4 hijos de los cuales 1esta bajo su responsabilidad porque es menor de edad y esta estudiando. Felicita tiene 13 años de tener su actividad económica como es la pulpería (el negocio consisten en la venta de productos de consumo diario como: (arroz, frijoles, azúcar, sal, queso, cuajada, huevos, leches frescos, verduras, tiste, pan, entre otros. En la actualidad ella necesita surtir un poco mas su negocio por lo tanto esta solicitando el financiamiento para invertir en capital de trabajo, le agradece a Fundación y el programa kiva la ayuda que le brindan a los pequeños comerciante para tener un forma de ingresos digna.
texts.en: Felicita del Socorro is married and has four children one of which is a minor attending school and still in her care.  Felicita has had her grocery store for 13 years.  She sells basic staple items like rice, beans, sugar, salt, cheese, curd, eggs, fresh milk, vegetables, tiste [corn meal and cocoa drink] and bread, among others.  She needs to stock her store a little better now which is why she’s asking for a loan to use as working capital.  She thanks the Fundación and Kiva for the help they are giving small merchants to have a dignified way of earning income.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Mukeni

texts.en: Mukeni is a married woman who has eight children. Three of the children are enrolled in school. Mukeni operates a secondhand-clothing business and sells her goods at the market. She's worked in this business for two years. Her primary customers are neighbors and town dwellers. Her greatest challenge is caused by seasonality, and her highest monthly expense is food. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Mukeni will use the 10,000 KES loan to buy more clothes to sell. She aspires to expand her business and start a poultry business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to resell

loans.name: Margort

texts.es: La socia MARGORT sigue perteneciendo al banco comunal “MINIBANK” de la Asociación Arariwa, ella es natural de la ciudad del Cusco y vive en esta hermosa ciudad, ella es casada y fruto de esta hermosa relación tiene un hijo, ella es profesora y trabaja en uno de los colegios de la ciudad del Cusco y enseña adolecentes,Ademas,   ella sigue dedicándose al pequeño negocio de venta de material de mantenimiento de casas como por ejemplo yeso, cemento, etc. La socia Margot en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales de decoración de interiores como por ejemplo yeso. La socia Margot se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Margot is still a member of Asociación Arariwa’s “Minibank” communal bank.   She is from the beautiful city of Cusco and still lives in this beautiful city.  She’s married and has a son.  She’s a teacher and works in one of the city of Cusco’s schools teaching teenagers.  She also continues working in her business selling home building supplies like plaster, cement, etc.  

On this occasion, Margot needs the loan to buy interior decorating supplies like plaster, for example.  She is grateful for the opportunity provided by this means and commits to make her payments as scheduled.

loans.use: to buy building supplies.

loans.name: Norberta

texts.es: La socia Norberta sigue perteneciendo al banco comunal “MINIBANK” de la Asociación Arariwa, ella es natural de la ciudad de la Cusco y vive en esta hermosa ciudad, ella es casada y fruto de esta hermosa relación tiene tres hijos, ella es ama de casa y también se dedica a alquilar carros, ella alquila a diferentes personas automóviles para que puedan brindar servicio de trasportes en la misma ciudad del Cusco. La socia Norberta en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para hacer mantenimiento de los carros. La socia Norberta se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Norberta is still a member of Asociación Arariwa’s “Minibank” communal bank.   She is from the city of Cusco and still lives in this beautiful city.  She’s married and has three children.  She’s a housewife and also leases out cars so that they can provide transportation services in the city of Cusco.

On this occasion, Norberta needs the loan to service the cars.  Norberta is grateful for the opportunity provided by this means and commits to make her payments as scheduled.

loans.use: to service her cars.

loans.name: Alvaro

texts.es: Álvaro con su credikiva hizo compras a un mayor volumen y de contado, su negocio estaba colmado de artesanías, camisetas de futbol, artículos deportivo, bolsos y similares, que vendió rápidamente y esto se debió al dinero producto de su crédito y a su cercanía con el Estadio Metropolitano, cuna del balompié colombiano.  Hoy esta muy agradecida por este apoyo económico que le ha dado liquidez para hacer compras puntuales y tener mucho mas surtido su negocio. En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo financiamiento mediante el cual comprará productos de bisutería, camisetas de la selección Colombia, calzado y bolsos aprovechando que en el Estadio ya mencionado se llevarán a cabo las eliminatorias del Mundial  de Brasil-2014. Su experiencia la potencialidad de la demanda de aficionados al futbol que disfrutaran los eventos, hace que la inversión de su credikiva, se proyecte con gran éxito.
texts.en: Álvaro used past Kiva loans to pay cash for wholesale supplies of the merchandise he sells.  His business was stacked to the ceiling with football shirts, sports equipment, bags, etc., all of which he quickly sold.  He says that he owes his good luck to your loans and the proximity of his business to Estadio Metropolitano, the home of Colombian football.  He wants to thank you for your help because your loans have provided the capital he needs to stock his business.  He is applying for a new loan now that he will use to buy merchandise--Colombia team football shirts, for example--that will be in great demand by Metropolitano football fans in the lead-up to the 2014 World Cup in Brazil.  He's learned alot about the retail business and he expects this investment to be a great success.

loans.use: to stock his retail business.

loans.name: Debbie

texts.es: Debbie de 60 años de edad vive en la ciudad de Barranquilla y se dedica a la actividad comercial, tarea que inició después de haber trabajado como empleada, e impulsada por su esposo decidir emprender una actividad generadora de ingresos, aprovechando su potencial de servicio no explorado. Así fue como poco a poco invirtieron un pequeño capital en la compra de mercancías y Debbie estructuró una clientela, con la que le fue muy bien y pasaron a ser  sus  fijos compradores. Gradualmente a su negocio fue agregando otros servicios, como el de telecomunicaciones vía celular e internet e impresiones. Sus ideas de negocio poco a poco han dado sus frutos, pues les ha acercado cada vez mas clientela y mas servicios con los que genera ingresos. Hoy ve la necesidad de ofrecer el servicio de fotocopiaje,  adicionar  una vitrina y comprar productos de papelería, para ubicarlos de manera ordenada en su exhibición.  Sus ventas las realiza de contado y también tiene una cartera de cuentas por cobrar de mercancías,  entre su mas  efectiva clientela, que crece cada vez mas. En la actualidad su capital de trabajo es insuficiente para hacer esta inversión y por eso  acude a un credikiva, primera financiación a la que aplica en la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  con la cual realizará todas las inversiones antes mencionadas. Su crédito será efectivo pues adicionará un servicio muy demandado por su clientela que genera dinero circulante de manera inmediata, así mismo agregará papelería que diversifica también su oferta y también es un producto que vende de contado y que ordenará desde un principio en una hermosa vitrina desde donde impactará en cada época como la que se acerca en la cual se celebra el día del amor y de la amistad que es una de las comercialmente mas rentables en el año,  donde las ventas se incrementan .
texts.en:
Debbie, 60, lives in the city of Barranquilla and works in commerce, a task she started after having been working as an employee and encouraged by her husband to start her own income generating activity taking advantage of an unexplored service potential.  This was how they gradually invested a little capital into buying merchandise and Debbie acquired customers she did well with and who later became regular customers.  

Gradually, the business added other services like mobile phone telecommunications, Internet access and photocopying services.  Her business ideas have gradually been bearing fruit for every day she has more customers and more services that generate income.  Today, she sees the need to offer photocopying services, to add a display case and to buy stationery supplies to display in an orderly fashion.  She sells for cash and also has a few merchandise credit accounts among her best customers which grow more every time.

At present her working capital is insufficient to make this investment which is why she’s calling on a Kiva loan, her first financing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to make all the investments mentioned above.  Her loan will be effective because she’ll be able to add a service that has high customer demand and generates cash immediately.  In addition, she’ll add stationery supplies which will diversify her offer and it’s also a type of product that sells for cash and that she will be able to organize from the get-go in her beautiful new display case where she’ll be able to create an impact each season like the upcoming one when the Day of Love and Friendship is celebrated which is one of the year’s most profitable when sales increase.

loans.use: to buy a photocopier, a display case and stationery supplies.

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en: Sylvia is a single mother of five children, and two of her children go to school. Sylvia doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has a business selling hardware and has been in this business for one year. She has applied for loan of 900,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of cement, nails and iron bars to stock her store. She works six days a week and sells on a retail basis only. Sylvia's major business challenges include seasonality and transportation. She aspires to have a fully stocked hardware shop and also to build her own house. She resides in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Sylvia's monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bags of cement, nails and iron bars to sell

loans.name: Leana Alexi

texts.es: Leana compró útiles escolares e insumos con los que fabricó uniformes de diario y de educación física, respondiendo oportunamente a su clientela. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, con el cual comprará materias primas e insumos para fabricar bolsos y nuevos uniformes deportivos, así como también comprará útiles, escolares con los cuales planea aumentar su capital de trabajo y así mismo su clientela. Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente:“ Muchas gracias por su apoyo el cual ha sido de gran ayuda,  ya que ha permitido buscar nuevas líneas de productos, para ofrecer a la población escolar; espero continuar recibiendo su apoyo. “
texts.en:
Leana bought school supplies and supplies she used to manufacture every day and physical education uniforms thus responding to her customers in a timely way.  She is currently applying for a Kiva loan to buy raw materials and supplies to manufacture tote bags and new athletic uniforms as well as to buy school supplies to increase her working capital and her clientele.

Her message to Kiva lenders is the following: “Thank you very much for your support which has been of great help because it’s made new production lines possible to offer to the school age population; I hope to continue receiving your support.”

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and sewing supplies.

loans.name: La Perla Del Oriente Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento LA PERLA DEL ORIENTE está  compuesto por doce integrantes once mujeres y un varón,  la presidenta del banco es la Sra. María tiene 40 años, se dedica  a la actividad de elaboración y  venta de pan, tiene su panadería que se encuentra ubicado en su mismo domicilio, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. María va a utilizar este préstamo para la compra de harina por cantidad para la elaboración de variedad de panes  y así de esta manera brindar un mejor servicio a  sus clientes e incrementar sus ganancias,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, la Sra. María va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando utensilios e insumos para la elaboración de sus panes, la Sra. María  es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada a ella ya sus compañeras de grupo ya que en algunos casos mantienen solas a sus familias.
texts.en: The communal bank "La Perla del Oriente" is made up of 12 members, including 11 women and 1 man.  The president of the bank is Maria.  Maria is 40 years old, and has a business making and selling bread from a bakery located in her house.  This is Maria's first loan cycle with this institution.  Maria will use this loan to buy flour in bulk to make a variety of breads.  This way she will be able to provide better service to her customers and increase her earnings.  The reason she is requesting this loan is so that she can continue to improve her business.  Maria will use the profits to continue buying utensils and supplies for her bread-making business.  Maria is a very hardworking person who feels happy about the opportunity being provided to her and her fellow group members, because some those members are the sole support of their families.

loans.use: to buy flour in bulk

loans.name: Rina Carmela

texts.es: La Sra. Rina tiene 40 años, casada con tres  hijos que son de las edades de 13, 11 y  9 años todos se encuentran en edad escolar, la Sra. Rina  se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pan empanadas y variedad de repostería, su panadería  que se encuentra ubicado  en la zona Vino Tinto,  este préstamo es su cuarta secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Rina  va a usar este préstamo para la compra de harina, manteca y azúcar por cantidad ya que tiene  un horno de mayor capacidad y quiere incrementar su producción y así satisfacer la demandada de sus clientes  Sra. Rina enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia de una panadería que produce en mayor cantidad, la Sra. Rina con este crédito mejorara sus ganancias, ella  es una persona  con ganas de superación se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado ya que esta es la única fuente de ingresos que tiene para mantener a su familia.
texts.en:
Rina, 40, is married and has three children whose ages are 13, 11 and 9; all are school age.  Rina works baking read, turnovers and assorted pastries.  Her bakery is located in the Vino Tinto zone.  This loan is her fourth sequence in the institution and Rina will use this loan to buy flour, shortening and sugar in quantity because she now has a larger capacity oven and she wants to increase production to meet customer demand.

The business challenge Rina faces is competition from a bakery that produces in larger volume.  With this loan, Rina will improve her profits.   She’s a person who very much wants to improve and feels happy and grateful to the institution for the support provided since it’s the only source of income she has to support her family.

loans.use: to buy raw materials at wholesale.

loans.name: Giannina Paola

texts.es:
Giannina es una joven de 24 años de edad, la cual vive en la ciudad de Chincha, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido y acogedor, asimismo se encuentran playas hermosas y sobre todo es conocida porque sus pobladores tiene un don para la preparación de platillos típicos ya que los hacen de manera muy deliciosa. Cuando Dispone de un tiempo libre a Giannina le gusta mucho ver televisión ya que la distrae un poco, asimismo le encanta disfrutar de uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Arroz Chaufa”. Ella estudio la carrera Técnica de contabilidad y es algo que la llena de alegría.

Día a día Giannina trabaja como obrera en un vivero de su ciudad desde hace un año, ella labora alrededor de 8 horas diarias; ella cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es responsable y sobre todo tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante.

Giannina está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá realizar mejoras en el cuarto donde vive, ya que es alquilado, ella realizara la construcción de una cerca de material noble, de esta manera ella tendrá mas seguridad y podrá seguir trabajando cada día para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener su casa propia y poder tener un mejor empleo”.
texts.en:
Giannina, 24, lives in Chincha, a city famous for its warm and pleasant climate, its beautiful beaches and, above all, its people's gift for preparing the region's traditional dishes, known far and wide for being the best.  

In her spare time, Giannina likes to watch television--a welcome distraction, she says--and make "arroz chaufa", a traditional rice dish that's a great favorite of hers.  She studied accounting in school and says that she liked it very much.  She has worked as a laborer in a "vivero" (could be a plant nursery, but not clear) for a year now.  She works 8 hours a day.  She says that the job is going well because she is responsible and, above all, because she is driven to get ahead.  

Giannina wants to thank Kiva lenders because your past loans have provided the funds she's needed to make improvements to the room where she lives.  It's a rented room but she wants to make additional improvements with materials that will make the space safer and more comfortable.  She says that she will continue to work hard to fulfill her dreams, "To have a house of my own and a better job".

loans.use: to pay for house improvements.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy school supplies, uniforms and pay tuition.

loans.name: Ana Luz

texts.es: La señora Ana Luz, de 43 años de edad, vive en Olanchito, Yoro, junto a sus 4 hijos y su  esposo. Ella hace dos años y medio que decidió dedicarse al negocio de cría y venta de cerdos. Anteriormente tenía una pulpería y miro que este negocio es más rentable. Ahora quiere hacer crecer el negocio aumentando la cantidad de animales. Ha solicitado varios préstamos a ODEF para mantener el negocio. Actualmente el que solicita de 10,000 Lempiras es el quinto préstamo otorgado con el cual va comprar más cerdos para cría y venta y también su alimentación como el concentrado. Espera incrementar la cantidad de animales y poder recibir más ganancias, ya que su meta es sacar adelante a su familia y que tenga una vida mejor.
texts.en:
Ana Luz, 43, lives in Olanchito, Yoro, with her four children and her husband.  Two years ago she started raising pigs to sell.  She used to have a grocery store but she noticed that this business is more profitable.  Now she wants to make the business grow by increasing the number of animals.  

She has asked ODEF for several loans to stay in business.  She is currently requesting 10,000 lempiras which is the fifth loan granted that she will use to buy more pigs to raise and sell and also to buy feed like concentrate for them.  She expects to increase the number of animals in order to earn higher profits since her goal is to move her family forward so that they will have a better life.

loans.use: to buy pigs and feed.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en: Annet is a single mother of three children, and all her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (sister and brother). Annet has a business selling local gin and has been in this business for ten years. She has applied for a loan of 900,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more jerrycans of local gin. Annet works at the market seven days a week and sells both retail and wholesale. Her major business challenges include transportation and thieves. She aspires to see her business grow enough so that she can buy a delivery van to ease transportation. She would also like to build rental rooms. She resides in her own house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding her family.

loans.use: To buy more jerrycans of local gin to sell

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en: Mejumaa is a married woman with three children. All of the children are enrolled in school. Mejumaa operates a tailoring business and sells her goods in the shop. She has worked in this business for two years. Her primary customers are neighbors and town dwellers. Her greatest challenge is caused by seasonality, and her highest monthly expense is food. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Mejumaa will use the 10,000 KES loan to buy clothing materials and sewing thread. She aspires to expand her business in the future. Her aim is to see her children become professionals.

loans.use: to buy clothing materials and sewing thread.

loans.name: Emilce

texts.es: Emilce  de 41 años de edad es una mujer casada que tiene 2 hijos en las edades de 10 y 15 años, con los que sueña ver convertidos en profesionales de éxito y son ellos su mayor sueño por el cual trabaja esforzadamente, con tal de aportarles a su bienestar. Emilce tiene un pequeño taller donde  confecciona ropa femenina, como faldas, vestidos, blusas y pantalones, mediante las operaciones de diseño, corte, preparación, ensamble y acabado de piezas, desde hace 12 años, cuando trabajó como operaria, para solo después de realizar 3 cursos de perfeccionamiento de la técnica confeccionista,  decidió emprender su propio negocio, comprando su primera máquina, trabajando sobre medidas y gradualmente   incursionado con la modalidad  de “a todo costo”. Su meta mas adelante es exportar sus productos en países latinos y continuar dándoles estudios profesionales a sus hijos. Su mayor desafío es tener un flujo de efectivo, que le permita hacer compras de contado y obtener precios de oportunidad, mientras realiza las ventas de dos maneras, a crédito cuando las hace a todo costo y de contado cuando ofrece el servicio, con este esquema ha logrado responder a las necesidades de sus clientes. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará  materias primas e insumos, pues desarrollará ropa femenina que ha encargado  su creciente clientela y a ella quiere continuar fidelizándola.
texts.en:
Emilce, 41, is married and has two children who are 10 and 15 years old who she dreams becoming successful professionals; they are her greatest dream and for whom she works hard to provide with wellbeing.

Emilce has a small sewing workshop where she manufactures women’s clothes like skirts, dresses, blouses and pants.  She designs, cuts, prepares, assembles and finishes the pieces.  She started out 12 years ago working as an employee and then took three courses to perfect her dressmaking techniques and decided to start her own business.  She bought her first machine and worked to order gradually moving into working in the ‘all included’ modality.  Her goal for later on is to export her products to other countries in Latin America and to continue providing her children with professional studies.  

Her greatest challenge is having cash flow that will allow her to make cash purchases thus obtaining special prices.  She sells in two ways: on credit when she provides the all-included and for cash when she does the sewing only.  This way of operating has allowed her to meet her customers’ needs.

She is currently applying for a Kiva loan, first financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to buy raw materials and supplies because she will make women’s clothes ordered by her growing clientele that she wants to continue to retain.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies and raw materials.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es: La Sra. Catalina tiene 50 años y tiene  2 hijos que ya son independientes, ella  vende calcetines para varones, mujeres, niños y niñas además de ropa interior lencería, su puesto se encuentra en un ad las calles más concurridas  de la ciudad de La Paz este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra.  Catalina  va a usar este préstamo para la compra de una sombrilla y más mercadería para su negocio su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de capital para la compra de mercadería le gusto mucho la atención que le dimos y la forma en que Kiva trabaja, la Sra. Catalina enfrenta retos en su negocio que son solo puede salir a vender en las noches ya que la alcaldía le prohíbe vender en el día, aun así no pierde ánimo para sacar adelante a su familia,  va a utilizar los beneficios comprando mas calcetines para niños debido a que se acercan las fiestas patrias y por los desfiles escolares, habrá más demanda, lo  único que ella quiere es que sus hijos progresen y estén sanitos.
texts.en:
Catalina is 50 and has two independent children. She sells men's, women's, and children's socks, underwear, and lingerie. Her stand is located on a busy street in the city of La Paz. This is her first loan cycle with the institution. Catalina will use the loan to buy an umbrella and more merchandise for her business and needs the loan because she lacks working capital to make these purchases. She loves the attention she receives from the institution and the way that Kiva operates.

Catalina faces a business challenge: the mayor's office prohibits her from selling during the day, so she can only sell in the evenings. However, that has not discouraged her from providing for her family. She will use the loan to buy more children's socks since the upcoming national holidays and student parades will increase demand. Her only wish is that her children thrive and are healthy.

loans.use: to buy an unbrella and more merchandise.

loans.name: Juan Luis

texts.es: El Sr. Juan Luis de 37 años de edad es divorciado y vive con su mama mientras repara su casa. El trabaja en una agencia de seguridad de la localidad como guardia, su mama es la única dependiente económica y ella comenta que el ha sido de gran ayuda, es un hijo ejemplar y un hombre trabajador a pesar del hecho de que su esposa lo abandono eso no lo ha detenido ni le ha quitado sus ganas de seguir adelante superándose día a día. El está solicitando de nuestra ayuda para colocar el portón en su domicilio y así poderla habitar ya que la inseguridad en nuestra ciudad ha ido en aumento. Juan Luis agradecerá la ayuda que se pueda brindar.
texts.en: Juan Luis, 37, is divorced and is living with his mother while he repairs her house.  He works as a guard for a security agency in his town.  His mother is his only dependent, and she comments that he has been a great help to her and that he is an exemplary son and a hardworking man who, in spite of the fact that his wife left him, has not let that stop him or diminish his desire to get ahead and succeed.  He is requesting our help to put a gate around his house so that he can live more securely, because the insecurity has been increasing in his city.  Juan Luis appreciates the help that is being provided.

loans.use: to build a gate around his house

loans.name: Maria Juana

texts.es: Maria Juana, soltera con 59 años de edad con 4 hijos mayores de edad, independiente, tiene actividad económica una pulpería desde hace 9 años, ella es una persona muy trabajadora, responsable a pesar de su edad y problemas se salud quiere seguir trabajando para seguir siendo independiente económicamente, Maria Juana necesita el financiamiento para comprar productos de consumo diario como:  arroz, azúcar, frijoles, aceite, pan, jabón, leche, detergente, frescos naturales, jugos enlatados, cuajadas, entre otros.
texts.en: Maria Juana, 59, is single.  She has 4 grown children, all independent now.  She has operated a general store for 9 years.  She is a responsible, hard-working woman and, despite her age and health problems, wants to continue working so that she won't have to rely on help from others.   Maria Juana will use this loan to buy merchandise--rice, sugar, beans, cooking oil, bread, soap, milk, detergent, canned and fresh juices, etc.--to stock her business.

loans.use: to stock her general store.

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es: Marisol de 52 años de edad vive al sur occidente de la ciudad con sus 4 hijos en las edades de 19 a 28 años, allí tiene una tienda donde vende ranchos, víveres, refrescos, bebidas y artículos en general de la canasta familiar. Ella emprendió su negocio desde el año 1986, inicialmente vendiendo artículos de manera ambulante y posteriormente cuando se le presentó la oportunidad de aprovechar la clientela de una vecina que cerró su tienda, ella  emprendió su propia aventura,  comprando los artículos de mayor rotación en la canasta familiar, como arroz, aceite, carnes tubérculos, verduras etc. y poco a poco fue agregando otros productos. Sus ventas las realiza de contado de lunes a domingos y desde las 6 de la mañana abre sus puertas a la clientela,  hasta las 9 de la noche; sus principales clientes son las amas de casa del sector y vecinos en general, que encuentran en su tienda,  la solución a sus necesidades e intereses de compra. En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva, crédito # 11 que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con los anteriores financiamientos  ha logrado aumentar sus utilidades  y tiene un sueño de prosperidad que es ampliar su negocio hacia el ramo de la ferretería y muy seguramente con su disciplina lo logrará. Con su credikiva comprará Bebidas y víveres que son los productos que presentan mayor rotación y requiere tener muchos de ellos entre sus inventarios, para rotar así mismo su capital y lograr mayores ingresos y esto es justamente lo que logrará con su credikiva.
texts.en:
Marisol, 52, lives in the southwest of the city with her four children whose ages range from 19 to 28 years.  She has a store there where she sells snacks, foodstuffs, soft-drinks, beverages and general staple items.  She started her business in 1998 initially selling from place to place and then when the opportunity arose to take over clientele from a neighbor’s who was closing her store she started her own business venture buying basic staples like rice, oil, meat, tubers, vegetables, etc. at wholesale gradually adding other products.

She sells for cash Monday through Sunday from 6 in the morning until 9 at night.  Her main customers are housewives in the area and neighbors in general who find in her store what they need and are looking for to buy.

She is currently applying for a Kiva loan, the 11th loan she’s gotten from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She used previous loans to increase her profits and her dream is to prosper and expand the business into hardware; she’s disciplined enough to accomplish this.

She will use her Kiva loan to buy beverages and foodstuffs which are the products that sell the most and she needs to have many of them in inventory so that her capital will turnover and her income will be greater which is what the Kiva loan will make possible for her to accomplish.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs and soft-drinks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fabric, accessories such as sliding buckles, thread, and buttons.

loans.name: Bignona Bassene Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est créé le 28 Mars 2002. Les deux membres sont liées par la caution solidaire. Leur activité principale est le commerce de détail.
Mme Aïda est l'emprunteur vedette du groupe. Sur la photo, elle est gauche, levant la main. Elle est mariée et mère de 09 enfants âgés entre 31 et 15 ans. Elle s'approvisionne dans un village environnant.
Avec ce prêt, elle envisage de renforcer son activité et les bénéfices serviront à augmenter son niveau d'épargne et aider son mari à la prise en charge des enfants pour la nourriture, la santé et la scolarité.
texts.en:
This group was created on March 28, 2002.  The two members are bound by a mutually enforceable guarantee.  Their main commercial activity is retail sales.

Aïda is the featured borrower of this group.  In the photo, she is on the left with her hand raised.  She is married and is the mother of nine children between the ages of 15 and 31.  She purchases her supplies from a nearby village.  With this loan, Aïda plans to strengthen her business. She will use her income to increase her savings and to help her husband in providing food, healthcare and education for their children.

loans.use: to buy fish, peanut butter and other products for resale

loans.name: Madina

texts.en:
Madina  is married with five children, and three of her children go to school. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

She has a business selling green bananas. She has been in this business for six years. She sells to all categories of people on a retail basis and works from her home. She generates additional income by selling charcoal.

She has applied for a loan of 600,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bunches of bananas. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. She aspires to become a wholesaler and also to educate her children up to university level.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas

loans.name: Subira

texts.en:
Subira is a married woman. She has one child, who is a source of her joy and motivation for her hardwork. 

Subira operates a beauty salon. She's worked in this business for three years. Her primary customers are area residents and passersby. Her family's other source of income includes income from her spouse. Subira’s highest monthly expense is food. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor water. 

Subira will use the 15,000 KES loan to fund her business by buying a salon dryer and beauty chemicals. She aspires to expand the business in the future.

loans.use: to buy a salon dryer and beauty chemicals

loans.name: Claudia Cordelia

texts.es: Claudia de  58 años de edad casada, con dos hijos mayores de edad, tiene por actividad económica la venta, tiene por actividad económica una pulpería  y un kiosco, la pulpería la tiene en su casa de habitación y el kiosco en la Terminal de buses de la localidad, tiempo de dedicarse al pulpería 20 años, ella tiene varios años de trabajar con Fundación la cual le ha ayudado a crecer poco a poco invirtiendo en capital de trabajo en la actualidad con las ganancias es que pudo comprar el kiosco  y lo abastece con  los proveedores que le ofrecen desde hace varios años, su sueños y metas es incrementar un poco mas su inventarió y terminar de pagarles los estudios universitario a su hijo menor el cual depende totalmente de ellas objetivo que esta a punto de lograrlo ya que su hijo pronto culminara su carrera. con el financiamiento comprara productos de consumo diario como: arroz, frijoles, aceite, pan, azucar, galletas, gaseosas, jugos entre otros.
texts.en: Claudia, 58, is married and has two grown children.  She owns a corner shop that she has operated from a space in her house for 20 years and a kiosk that she set up more recently at a local bus terminal.  She is a long-standing client of Fundacion and says that they have helped her grow her business.  She invested a bit at a time over the years, buying merchandise for her corner shop and eventually saving enough to buy the kiosk.  She says that she wants to add new products and earn enough to pay her youngest son's university fees.  He's almost finished with school now, so she's very close.  She will use this loan to buy merchandise--rice, beans, cooking oil, bread, sugar, snacks, cold drinks, etc.--that she will resell.

loans.use: to stock her retail business.

loans.name: Jackeline

texts.es:
Jackeline tiene 29 años, tiene dos hijos: Almendra y Ángel. Juntos viven en una casa que alquila desde hace 7 años. 
Ella posee terrenos de cultivo propios que se ubican a dos horas de caminata desde su localidad, y además alquiló otros terrenos agrícolas donde pueda sembrar mayor cantidad. Produce papa, maíz y alverja y en sus 3 años de experiencia en esta actividad ha vendido sus cosechas en la feria de la ciudad, con esas ganancias puede brindar alimentación y educación a sus hijos. Le gusta mucho su trabajo, pues disfruta del campo y de vivir allí; la dificultad es cuando los precios bajan, “a veces son inestables los precios en el mercado, se gana menos”, comenta. Ahora desea mejorar e incrementar sus sembríos para obtener buenas ganancias. 

Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “Nuevo amanecer” y este es su tercer crédito con MFP. En todo este tiempo (más de un año) obtuvo el dinero necesario para invertir en el desarrollo de su actividad, por lo que promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le agrada pertenecer a su grupo, donde todas las personas son responsables.
Jackeline invertirá este dinero en la compra de 120 sacos de fertilizantes naturales para esparcir entre sus sembríos de maíz.
texts.en:
Jackeline, 29, has two children, Almendra y Ángel, with whom she lives in the house she has rented for 7 years. She owns farmland that is a two-hour walk from her house. She also rents some higher quality plots. She grows potatoes, corn, and vetch. During her 3 years working as a farmer, she has sold her harvests in the city fairs and used the proceeds to feed and educate her children. She loves to work and would like to live close to the fields. When prices drop, things become difficult. "Sometimes market prices are unstable, and you earn less," she says. She would like to increase and improve her plantings to achieve higher profits. 

She belongs to the communal bank “Nuevo amanecer” [New Dawn], and this is her third loan cycle with MFP. During this time (over a year), she has received the money she needed to invest and develop her business, and, therefore, she promises to make her payments. She is also happy to belong to her group, whose members are responsible. Jackeline will use the loan to buy 120 sacks of natural fertilizer to spread on her corn plantings.

loans.use: to buy 120 sacks of natural fertilizer to spread on her corn plantings.

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en:
Deborah  is married with five children, and only one of her children goes to school. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

Deborah has a restaurant. She has applied for a loan of 600,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more foodstuffs like beef, chicken, cassava, sweet potatoes and bunches of bananas. She has been in this business for 10 years and sells to all categories of people on retail basis seven days a week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and ever-increasing prices for food. She aspires to own a fully stocked restaurant and also to build her own house.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs like beef, chicken, cassava, sweet potatoes and bunches of bananas

loans.name: Mangoase Group

texts.en:
Mangoase Group is made up of one man and one women. They sell firewood and fish.They are both married and their average age is 54.They live with their families at Teshie.

Tawiah is a 62-year-old women who sells fish. She has been doing this job for 20 years. She buys the fish from the fishing harbor and sells it to customers. She is married to a carpenter who is 51 years old. Currently, all three children are grown and fully taking care of themselves. Tawiah helped her husband to pay for their school fees through the sale of fish. 

This is Tawiah's fourth loan cycle with ID Ghana. She took a third loan amount of 600 Ghana cedis and paid it back successfully, completing payment on 04/07/2012. She now needs a loan of 800 Ghana cedis so that she can buy more fish to supply to her customers because demand for fish has gone up.

Together, the members of Mangoase Group need a total amount of 1,100 Ghana cedis to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To buy more fish to supply to customers.

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.es:
Fortunata tiene 63 años, está casada con Jorge, con quien tiene seis hijos, de los cuales ahora sólo viven con uno de ellos: Alexander. Su casa es propia, la heredó de su madre.
Ella trabaja junto a su esposo, todas las mañanas se dirigen a sus terrenos agrícolas, ya tiene 5 años de experiencia en la siembra de maíz, papa y cebada, los que comercializan en la ciudad durante la feria de los domingos. Sus terrenos agrícolas son propios, pues durante todos estos años de trabajo duro pudieron ahorrar lo necesario para tener una vejez segura. “Me gusta sembrar, es lo que aprendí desde pequeña, mis padres me enseñaron a trabajar la tierra y vivir de ella”, afirma. Es por esa razón que desea mejorar su producción y continuar con las mismas fuerzas para seguir sembrando.

Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “Nuevo amanecer” y este es su quinto crédito con MFP. En todo este tiempo (más de 2 años) obtuvo el dinero necesario para invertir en su desarrollo, por lo que promete ser puntual el pago de sus cuotas. Además le agrada pertenecer a su grupo, donde todas las personas son responsables y solidarias.
Fortunata invertirá el dinero de este préstamo en la compra de 10 sacos de fertilizantes naturales para esparcir entre sus sembríos de maíz.
texts.en:
Fortunata is 63 years old and is married to Jorge. They have six children together, and currently only one, Alexander, lives with them. She owns her home, which she inherited from her mother.

She works with her husband. Every morning they head out to their plots of farm land. She has five years of experience growing corn, potatoes, and barley, which they sell in the city at the Sunday market. They own the plots of land they farm, since over all these years of hard work they were able to save up what they needed in order to have security in their old age. “I enjoy farming. It is what I learned as a child. My parents taught me how to work and live off the land," she says. That is why she wants to improve her production and continue on with the same energy so that she can keep farming.

She belongs to the solidarity group Nuevo Amanecer, and this is her fifth loan with MFP. During all this time (over two years) she obtained the money she needed to invest in her development, so she promises to pay her installments timely. She also enjoys being a part of her group, where all the members are responsible and supportive people.

Fortunata will invest the money from this loan in the purchase of ten sacks of natural fertilizer, which she will use on her crops of corn.

loans.use: to purchase ten sacks of natural fertilizer to use on her crops of corn.

loans.name: Bessy Carolina

texts.es:
Bessy de 32 años de edad, está casada y vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos en el municipio de San Pedro Sula. 
Ella hace tres años consiguió un puesto de venta en el mercado para establecer su propio negocio, donde vende todo tipo de medicinas naturales, vitaminas, ungüentos y suplementos alimenticios.
