Atiende su negocio todo el día, es muy trabajadora. Esta solicitando un préstamo a ODEF para surtir el negocio y tener una mejor solvencia económica, comprara hierbas naturales y vitaminas. Con esta inversión espera incrementar las ventas y hacer crecer el negocio. Su meta es tener un fondo de ahorro y hacer mejoras en el hogar para vivir mejor.
texts.en:
Bessy, 32, is married and lives with her husband and two children in the municipality of San Pedro Sula.  She got a sales stand in the market three years ago to open her own business; she sells all types of natural medicines, vitamins, unguents and nutritional supplements.  She tends to her business all day; she’s very hardworking.

She’s asking ODEF for a loan to stock her business in order to attain better economic solvency.  She will buy natural herbs and vitamins.  With this investment she plans hopes to increase sales and make the business grow.  Her goal is to have savings and to make some home improvements in order to live better.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise.

loans.name: Gaspard

texts.en: Gaspard is 60 years old and is married. He has three children who are between 3 and 6 years old. Gaspard sells various goods such as lotions, soap, rice, sugar, cooking oil, etc. He has three years of experience in this work and he currently employs one person to help him. Gaspard has requested a Kiva loan, via Vision Finance Company, in order to buy various goods such as lotions, soap, rice, cooking oil, sugar, etc. for resale. With any profits, he will be able to increase his business and he will be able to build his own house.

loans.use: To buy various goods such as lotions, soap, rice, sugar, cooking oil, etc. for resale.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan  is married with five children and only one of her children goes to school.  She doesn’t’ take care of additional family members. She has a restaurant and has been in this business for 10 years. She has applied for a loan of 600,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more foodstuffs like bunches of bananas, beef, chicken, and sweet and Irish potatoes.  Besides this restaurant business she generates additional income through selling mobile phone airtime.  

Susan's major business challenges include thieves and defaulters. She is aspiring of seeing her business grow into  a fully stocked restaurant and also to build her own house.  She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, rent and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more  bunches of bananas, beef, chicken and sweet and Irish potatoes

loans.name: Betty

texts.es:
Betty tiene 23 años, está casada con Marcos, todavía no tienen hijos. Viven, desde hace 3 años, en una casa alquilada.
Desde que unió con su esposo emprendió el negocio de compra y venta de llantas, pues notaron que en su zona no existen tiendas que vendan repuestos para autos. Es así que hace 2 años comenzó con el negocio, ya tiene clientes fijos que le piden cada mes un par de llantas; “el ingreso es constante, pues las carreteras no son asfaltadas, solo son de tierra y piedras, por lo que las llantas se desgastan constantemente”, afirma. En cada venta de una llanta llegan a ganar un promedio de 50 soles, por par 100 soles. Sus clientes son fijos, por eso Betty desea abrir su propia tienda de llanta al por mayor, ya se encuentra juntando el capital necesario para lograr su objetivo.

Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “Nuevo amanecer” y este es su tercer crédito con MFP,  por lo que promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le agrada pertenecer a su asociación donde todas las personas son responsables. 
Betty invertirá este dinero en la compra de más llantas para abastecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Betty is 23 years old and is married to Marcos. They don't have children yet. They have lived for three years in a rented house. Since they married, she has started a business buying and selling tires, because they noticed that in their area there are no stores that sell spare parts for cars. That's why she started the business two years ago. She now has regular customers who order a pair of tires from her every month. She says, "The income is constant, because the roads are not asphalted. They are made of earth and rocks, which means that tires wear out constantly." For each tire sale, they earn an average of 50 soles, or 100 soles for a pair. Her customers are regular, so Betty wants to open her own store for wholesale tires. She is already gathering the necessary capital to achieve her goal.

Betty belongs to the solidarity group Nuevo Amanecer and this is her third credit with MFP, so she promises to be on time with her payments. In addition, she is pleased to be part of her group where all the people are responsible. Betty will invest this money in buying tired to supply her business.

loans.use: to buy more car tires to supply her business.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet  is a single mother of four children and two of her children go to school.  She doesn’t take care of any additional family members.  She has a business selling cameras, batteries and film and accessories.  She has been in this business for eight years and sells to all categories of people, both retail and wholesale. 

Harriet has applied for a loan of 600,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more boxes of batteries, cells, and camera film.  She doesn’t have any other income generating activity.  Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves.  She is aspiring of seeing her business grow big so that she owns a fully stocked shop of camera batteries and film.    She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water.  Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of cameras, batteries, cells and film

loans.name: Steven

texts.en:
Steven is 22 years old and married without children. He sells various goods such as dishes, clothes, soap, etc. Steven employs two people to help him and he works from 6 am until 9 pm every day of the week with five years of experience.

Steven has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to buy more dishes, clothes, soap, lotion, etc. for resale. With any profits, he will be able to save money for his future and reinvest in his business.

loans.use: To buy various goods such as dishes, lotions, soap, clothes, etc. for resale.

loans.name: Winifride

texts.en: Winifride is 28 years old and is married. Winifride sells various goods such as cassava flour, sugar, soap, salt, etc. She has ten years of experience in this work with two employees to help her. Winifride has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase various goods such as cassava flour, sugar, soap, salt, etc., for resale. With any profits, she will be able to save money for her future and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To expand her business by buying more cassava flour, rice, sugar, milk, soap, salt etc.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline designs and crafts jewelry with Andean silver and colorful gemstones. She would like to expand production by investing in a bulk purchase of raw materials.

Jacqueline has been selling through NOVICA since 2006. This is her story:

Jacqueline owes her artistic inclinations to her mother, a fashion designer. "I used to go to nearby markets for a necklace or a bracelet, but I was never satisfied with what I saw. So, I used to buy more than one, tear them apart, and make one piece according to my own design. Eventually I decided to learn about design and silversmith techniques, visiting several workshops and learning from those who would have me around. I haven't stopped ever since. My jewelry designs fill me with satisfaction. My motivation comes from knowing that someone might feel happy when they wear my designs. My inspiration comes from my children, a daughter and a son, who fill my house with happiness and give me strength to try new things every day."

"I'd like to thank you in advance for the help you're giving me. I hope to have good sales for the holidays, and need capital to get ready. I also want to develop new designs. Many thanks for your support."

Use the link below to view Jacqueline's silver jewelry on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/artistdetail/index.cfm?faid=5957

loans.use: to purchase raw materials in bulk for the crafting of her jewelry designs

loans.name: Claude

texts.en:
Claude is 27 years old and is married with two children. He sells various goods such as: lotions, salt, soap, sugar, clothes, etc, from a store which operates from 6 a.m.until 8 p.m. six days per week. He currently employs three people to help him and he has three years of experience in this work. 

Claude has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to buy various goods such as: lotions, salt, soap, sugar, clothes, etc. to resell. He plans to use any profits generated from this loan to satisfy his family's basic needs and to reinvest in his business.

loans.use: To buy various goods such as: lotions, soap, sugar, clothes, etc. to resell.

loans.name: Neudis

texts.es: Neudis de 26 años de edad se dedica ofrecer  servicios de mejoramiento personal, aplicando técnicas de belleza y estética a una clientela que ha ido conquistando poco apoco con su excelente servicio personal. Ella es casada y madre de un pequeño que tiene 4 años, motor de la vida de ella y su esposo, por el cual trabajan para generara cada día mas bienestar familiar. Neudis antes de iniciar su negocio, trabajó en un spa mientras estudiaba, allí adquirió toda su experiencia e inició su oferta inicialmente a domicilio y posteriormente se instaló en un local,  donde aun ofrece tratamientos corporales y de belleza, en sus instalaciones y también hace domicilios programados.  En la actualidad para hacer tratamientos corporales, arrienda el equipo y esto le sale cada vez más costoso, por eso está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará un equipo para tratamientos corporales y también insumos para aplicar masajes.  Su meta mas adelante es aumentar su equipamiento para atender cada vez con mayor calidad y mas eficientemente.
texts.en: Neudis, 26 years old, works offering personal improvement services, applying beauty and aesthetic techniques to her clientele that she has won little by little with her excellent personal service. She is married and a mother to a little boy who is four years old, the driving force in her life and the life of her spouse. Therefore, she works to improve her family's life every day. Neudis, before opening her business, worked in a spa while she studied. There, she acquired all of her experience. She started her business going to customers' houses and later moved it to its own location, where she still offers physical and beauty treatments. She also still goes to customers' houses. Currently, in order to give more physical treatments, she rents the equipment, which is getting more and more expensive. For this reason, she is applying for a Kiva loan, her first loan through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, through which she will purchase equipment for physical treatments and supplies to give massages. Her goal is to add to her equipment in order to attend to more and more clients with better quality and efficiency.

loans.use: to buy equipment for physical treatments and supplies to give massages.

loans.name: Jennifer Elieth

texts.es: Jennifer Elieth, de 31 años de edad, casada, con 2 hijos menores de edad, tiene por actividad la venta de golosinas, la cual distribuye de forma ambulante, desde hace 3 años, negocio que inicio por la necesidad de tener un fuente de ingresos y así ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa. El financiamiento lo quiere para compra golosinas como: meneitos, caramelos, chicles, bombones, chocolates, tortillitas, huevitos, galletas, paletas mérmelos entre otros.
texts.en: Jennifer Elieth, 31, is married and has two minor children.  Her activity for the last three years has been selling snacks from place to place, a business she started because she needed to have a source of income to help her husband with household expenses.  She needs the loan to buy such sweets as: maneitos, [corn puffs], caramels, chewing gum, bonbons, chocolates, potato chips, cookies, lollipops, etc.

loans.use: to buy assorted candies and chewing gum.

loans.name: Modesta Alicia

texts.es: Silvia Modesta de 80 años de edad, soltera con un hijo mayor de edad independiente totalmete , tiene por actividad economica la venta de cosa de horno , desde ha 29 años, Silvia expresa sus ganas de serguir trabajando para sentirse util e independiente economicamente , a pesar de los problemas de salud a los que enfrenta, el negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitacion , el financiamiento lo  quiere para compra productos para la elaboracion de cosa de hornos como: maiz, leña, azucar, queso, arroz, frutas, leche, canela, entre otros.
texts.en: Silvia Modesta, 80, is single and has an adult son who is completely independent.  Her economic activity is selling baked goods; she’s been in business 29 years.  Silvia says that she wants to continue working to feel useful and be economically independent despite the health problems she faces.  Her business is located at home and she needs the financing to buy products like corn, firewood, sugar, cheese, rice, fruit, milk and cinnamon among others to produce baked goods.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and supplies.

loans.name: Makhabat

texts.ru:
Махабат 45 лет, замужем, имеет 5 детей, младшему из которых 9 лет. Махабат в качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, на протяжении  2 лет занимается полеводством  и животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы в 10,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Махабат в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется 3 дойных коровы с приплодом, 9 голов мелкого рогатого скота, 1,3 га орошаемой земельной доли с репчатым луком и морковью.   
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Махабат обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку дойных коров для увеличения надоев.  Доходы от кредита Махабат планирует вкладывать в развитие бизнеса за счет посадки перца, чтобы иметь возможность оплатить обучение для детей.
texts.en: Makhabat is 45 years old, married and has five children, the youngest of whom is nine years old.  To provide the primary source of income for her family, Makhabat has been involved in farming and animal husbandry for two years, having started this business with an initial sum of 10,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to her hard work, today her business contains three dairy cows with offspring, nine small livestock and 1.3. hectares of irrigated land plot with onions and carrots.  In order to further develop her business, Makhabat requested a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy dairy cows in order to increase milk volumes.  She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into developing her business by planting pepper in order to have an ability to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is single and has three children.  She takes care of additional family members (cousins). She sells tomatoes, which she has been doing for 15 years. She works seven days a week and works at the market on retail. She does not have any other income-generating activity.   

Agnes is requesting a loan for 500,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more boxes of tomatoes.  Her major business challenges Include seasonality and defaulters.  She would like to expand her business so that she can start growing tomatoes herself.  She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: to purchase boxes of tomatoes.

loans.name: Yessica

texts.es:
Yessica tiene 26 años, está casada con Carlos, tienen un hijo de 10 años, Kener.
Se caracteriza por ser una mujer muy valiente, ella se dedica al trasporte de pasajeros, maneja un motocarro desde su anexo a la ciudad. Ella es una de las pocas mujeres que desarrollan esta actividad, pues la mayoría de choferes son varones. Pero también distribuye su tiempo con trabajos eventuales, como la limpieza de jardines y veredas para la municipalidad. Le gusta estar ocupada, por ello constantemente también ayuda a su cuñada a ordeñar sus vacas, con ello puede obtener leche fresca para a su hijo. Por su parte, su esposo trabaja como albañil en una empresa constructora donde recibe un sueldo mensual. El deseo de Yessica es adquirir otro motocarro para poder aumentar sus ganancias.

Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, donde espera de un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Promete, una vez más, cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas y le agrada ser parte de su grupo porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias.
Yessica invertirá el dinero solicitado en completar sus ahorros para comprar un motocarro.
texts.en:
Yessica is 26 years old, married to Carlos, and has one 10-year-old son named Kener.

She is a very brave woman who works transporting passengers. She drives a motorcar from its enclosure in the city. She is one of few women who do this, since the majority of chauffeurs are men. But she also holds some temporary jobs, such as cleaning the gardens and paths of the city. She likes to stay busy, so she is always also helping her sister-in-law milk her cows, which gives her fresh milk for her son. For his part, her husband works as a bricklayer in a construction company where he receives a monthly salary. Yessica's wish is to get another motorcar to increase her earnings. 

This is her third loan with MFP, where she is waiting on a small loan so that she can complete her objectives. She promises, once again, to pay the payments on time. She is pleased to be part of her group because all of its members are responsible and supportive.

Yessica will invest the loaned money to complete her savings to buy a motorcar.

loans.use: to complete her savings to purchase a motorcar.

loans.name: Irma

texts.es: Irma de cuarenta y ocho años de edad vive junto a sus dos hijos Mauricio y Daniel en casa propia. Ella se dedica a la confección de diferentes prendas de vestir, vestidos, blusas, faldas, pantalones, entre otros todo para damas, caballeros y niños, tiene varios años con el negocio que esta ubicado en su vivienda y ya tiene mucha clientela pues las personas saben que la ropa esta a la vanguardia, es elaborada con material de primera calidad y al gusto del cliente pero sobre todo a un precio accesible, es caracterizada por su gran amabilidad y el buen servicio,  adicional a la confeccion vende productos por catalogo para completar los gastos del hogar; Irma es una mujer emprendedora, activa y con muchas ganas de salir adelante, siempre esta dispuesta ha aprovechar las oportunidades que se le presentan pues sabe que eso le abrirá camino al éxito, últimamente ha aumentado la demanda de sus servicios y necesita invertir en materia prima para aumentar la producción pero necesita de capital para lograrlo por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar tela por mayor, agujas, hilos y productos de catalogo. Irma tiene buenas referencias de pago, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Irma, 48, lives with her two children, Mauricio and Daniel, in her own house.  She works sewing various articles of clothing like dresses, blouses, skirts and pants among others for women, men and children.  She’s been in business several years and it’s located at home.  She has a large clientele because people know her clothes are cutting-edge, made with top quality materials and her service is good.  In addition to sewing, she also sells merchandise via catalogue to earn enough for household expenses.

Irma is an enterprising, active woman who very much wants to get ahead.  She’s always ready to take advantage of opportunities that arise because she knows that this will open paths to success for her.  Demand for her services has increased lately and she needs to buy raw materials for production but needs capital to do so which is why she’s asking INTEGRAL for a loan to buy fabric at wholesale, needles, thread and catalogue merchandise.  Irma has good payment references and is sure she will be able to repay the loan while at the same time provide her family with better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fabric at wholesale, thread and catalogue items.

loans.name: Mayra

texts.es: Mayra con su anterior creikiva compró artículos para el hogar, accesorios domésticos, juveniles, ropa, cosmético y calzado; con ello logró buenas ventas y reinvertir en su negocio, ampliando su capital de trabajo un poco mas.  Ella está muy satisfecha con su inversión y está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva, con el cual comprará cosméticos, vestidos y calzado, pedidos que ha tomado de su clientela  en su actividad  de preventa, para que su clientela se sienta complacida y regrese a comprarle, pues ellos son la razón de ser de su negocio y eso Mayra lo reconoce y es justamente lo que constituye el éxito de Kiva.
texts.en: Mayra used her previous loan to buy household items, domestic accessories, juvenile products, clothing, cosmetics and shoes. She succeeded in having good sales and reinvesting in her business by increasing her working capital a little more. She is very pleased with her investment and is applying for a new loan with which she will purchase cosmetics, dresses and shoes, all customers’ orders she took at her pre-sale. She wants her customers to feel satisfied and to return to buy from her since they are the reason she is in business and Mayra recognizes that and this is just what makes Kiva such a success.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, dresses and shoes.

loans.name: Kunduz

texts.ru:
Кундуз 54 года, вдова, воспитала 6 детей. Кундуз работает социальным работником в сельской управе  «Долоно» и в качестве дополнительного источника дохода для своей семьи, на протяжении  5 лет занимается полеводством  и животноводством, начав этот бизнес с группового кредита от Бай Тушум. Благодаря упорному труду Кундуз в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется 1 дойная корова с приплодом, 15 голов мелкого рогатого скота, 1 лошадь, ежемесячная прибыль от хозяйства составляет около 4,000 сом (KGS). Также Кундуз обрабатывает 1,8 га земли, где выращивает фасоль, картофель и многолетние травы. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Кундуз обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку дойных коров в целях увеличения надоев.  Доходы от кредита Кундуз планирует вкладывать в развитие бизнеса посредством постройки сеновала, а в дом планирует провести паровое отопление.
texts.en: Kunduz is 54 years old, a widow and raised six children.  She works as a social worker at the village "Dolono" council and, to provide additional source of income for her family, has been involved in farming and animal husbandry for five years, having started this business with a group loan from Bai Tushum.  Thanks to Kunduz's hard work, today her business contains one dairy cow with offspring, fifteen small livestock and one horse, and the monthly profit from the business amounts to about 4,000 som (KGS).  She also works on 1.8 hectares of land, where she grows beans, potatoes and perennial herbs.  In order to further develop her business, Kunduz requested a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy dairy cows in order to increase milk volumes.  She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into developing her business by building a hayloft and plans to install steam heating for her house.

loans.use: to purchase dairy cows

loans.name: Heriberto

texts.es: Heriberto de 36 años vive en el municipio de Puerto Colombia, lugar ubicado a orillas del Mar Caribe, visitado por turistas usualmente los fines de semana, para lograr descanso y diversión en sus playas. Heriberto dio apertura a un estadero hace 6 años,  aprovechando que su residencia está frente a una cancha,  donde se practica futbol. Sus ventas se incrementan los fines de semana,  con la práctica deportiva que ocurre frente a su negocio, en el cual   vende cervezas, refrescos, jugos naturales y mecatos. Él además tiene otro negocio mediante el cual vende mercancía variada, actividad donde es apoyado por su esposa. Heriberto es un joven emprendedor que siempre se encuentra explorando nuevas oportunidades de negocios, recientemente se asocio con un amigo y está en la tarea de vender teléfonos celulares de gama baja y media, además invirtió en 2 motocicletas que las tiene trabajando como medio de transporte en el pueblo y recibe una renta diaria. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace ala Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,   pues requiere comprar un enfriador para ofrecer bebidas y refrescos en su punto máximo de enfriamiento y también invertirá en cajas de gaseosas y cervezas, para hacer de cada fin de semana, una oportunidad de generar ingresos con la satisfacción de su clientela  y planear el crecimiento futuro de su familia.
texts.en:
Heriberto, 36, lives in the municipality of Puerto Colombia, a spot located on the shores of the Caribbean, that’s visited by tourists on weekends to rest and enjoy the beaches.  Heriberto opened a snack bar six years ago taking advantage of the fact that his house is across from a soccer field.  His sales increase on weekends with all the teams practicing across from his business.  He sells beer, soft-drinks, fruit juices and packaged snacks.  He also has another business selling varied merchandise that his wife helps him with.

Heriberto is a young entrepreneur who is always exploring new business opportunities.  He recently partnered with a friend and is in the low to medium price mobile phone sales business.  He also invested in two motorcycles that he has working providing transport in the town that produce a daily rental fee for him.  

He’s currently applying for a Kiva loan, first financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, because he wants to buy a cooler to be able to offer beverages at their coldest possible; he will also buy cases of beer and soft-drinks so that every weekend will be an opportunity to generate income by satisfying his customers and he can plan for his family’s future growth.

loans.use: to buy a cooler.

loans.name: Rita Morena

texts.es: Rita Morena de cincuenta y tres años de edad vive junto a sus dos hijos en casa propia; ella posee una panadería y elabora pan en variedad dulce y salado, quesadillas, semita, tortas, pastelitos, pan francés, entre otros tiene varios años con el negocio y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia que le permite obtener el mejor pan con un sabor exquisito, el negocio esta ubicado en el lugar donde vive ya tiene mucha clientela pues las personas la prefieren porque su producto es de primera calidad, a precios accesibles pero sobre todo con un excelente servicio; Rita es una mujer muy trabajadora desde muy temprano empieza su labor y pone cada día todo su esfuerzo y dedicación pues sabe que al final de la jornada de trabajo podrá compartir un momento con lo mas importante para ella su familia, como toda comerciante quiere acrecentar su negocio pero no posee de capital que la respalde por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar harina, azúcar, levadura, leche, etc. Rita Morena tiene buen record de pago, asegura poder saldar la deuda y a la vez ofrece llevar a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
Rita Morena, age 53, lives with her two children in her own house.  She has a bakery, and she makes a variety of bread.  She makes sweet breads, rolls, quesadillas, tarts, cakes, pastries, and French bread, among others.  She has been in this business for several years, and this has gifted her with a lot of experience.  This allows her to get better bread with an exquisite taste.

The business is located in the place where she lives, and she already has a lot of customers.  People prefer her because her product is first class at accessible prices.  However, above all, they prefer her excellent service.  Rita is a very hard-working woman.

She starts her work very early, and she puts forth all of her effort and dedication every day.  She knows that at the end of her work day she will be able to share time with what is most important to her, her family.

Like all merchants, she wants to increase her business.  However, she does not have the capital to do so.  That is why she is requesting a loan from Integral.  She will use the loan to buy flour, sugar, yeast, and milk, etc.  Rita Morena has a good payment record, and she is sure that she will be able to settle her debt and also provide her household with financial security.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, yeast, and milk.

loans.name: Katiana Paola

texts.es: Katiana con su anterior credikiva compró artículos de tocador indispensables para el ejercicio de su actividad y realizó adecuaciones locativas, para ofrecer una mejor atención a su numerosa clientela, a quien le ofrece servicio de mejoramiento de su imagen personal, manicure, pedicure etc. Con su credikiva anterior sus ventas se incrementaron y su clientela se encuentra muy satisfecha. En la actualidad Katina está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva con el cual comprará productos de alta rotación como cremas, perfumes, y continuará sus adecuaciones locativas hasta lograr el confort que sus clientes  requieren, porque este es su sueño de prosperidad. Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente: “Gracias por hacer cumplir mis sueños para seguir creciendo como persona y empresaria “.
texts.en:
Katiana used her previous Kiva loan to buy indispensable dressing table items for her activity and did some physical improvements to the site to offer better service to her numerous clientele who she offers personal image improvement services, manicures, pedicures, etc.  Thanks to her previous Kiva loan her sales increased and her customers are very satisfied.

Katiana is currently applying for an new Kiva loan to buy more of the products that are her best sellers like creams and perfumes and will continue doing physical upgrades to her space to provide the customer comfort they require because this is her dream of prosperity.

Her message to Kiva lenders is: “Thank you for making my dreams a reality to continue growing as a person and as a businesswoman.”

loans.use: to buy merchandise and to do physical improvements to her salon.

loans.name: Makhburat

texts.ru: Махбурат 40 лет, воспитывает 4 детей.  Махбурат в качестве основного источника дохода для семьи занимается животноводством  и растениеводством.  Начатое 13 лет  назад со стартовой суммы в 1,000 сом (KGS)  хозяйство имеет на сегодня  1 дойную корову с приплодом, 2,04 га орошаемой земли, где выращивает хлопок, кукурузу и рис. Ежемесячная прибыль от хозяйства составляет около 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Махбурат обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дойных коров для увеличения надоев молока и повышения продаж молочной продукции. Доходы Махбурат планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства, чтобы иметь возможность оплатить учебу для детей.
texts.en: Makhburat is 40 years old and raising four children.  To provide the primary source of income for her family, she is involved in animal husbandry and farming.  The business, started thirteen years ago with an initial sum of 1,000 som (KGS), today contains one dairy cow with offspring and 2.04 hectares of irrigated land, where she grows cotton, corn and rice.  The monthly profit from the business amounts to about 10,000 som (KGS).  In order to further develop her business, Makhburat requested a loan in the amount of 80,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy dairy cows in order to increase milk volumes and sales of dairy products.  She plans to invest the earnings into a continued expansion of her business in order to have an ability to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase dairy cows

loans.name: Godfred

texts.en:
Ghanaian artisan Godfred specializes in hand-carved wood masks. He would like to invest in the purchase of raw materials such as wood, metal plates, and paints to increase his production.

Godfred has been selling through NOVICA since 2010. This is his story:

"As a child, I used to make boats with worn-out metal utensils, which I would float in water. Due to financial constraints, my parents could not further my education, so I had to drop out of school and join my uncle, who was a wood carver. Thanks to the woodcarving, I've been able to educate my four children, and I know that with constant sales, I'll be able to give them a brighter future than I had. This motivates me to wake up each day to carve! I have trained about 30 people to carve and some of them have now set up their own workshops. I currently have five people working with me. My dream is to one day have a big workshop to train a lot of people – especially school dropouts who think life has ended because their parents couldn't further their education. Their success in the art of carving would be my legacy."

"I thank you for your support through this microcredit; it will help me so much! I will be able to increase my production, which in turn means I will have more to sell."

Use the link below to view Godfred's masks on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/artistdetail/index.cfm?faid=7252

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of raw materials such as wood, metal plates, and paints to increase his production

loans.name: Nitu

texts.en: Nitu is 30 years old.  She is married and has one child, aged 8.  In 2007, she established her grocery store business.  Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid 6 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent one to buy grocery goods for her business.  In the future, Nitu plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support. In the Kathmandu Valley, a small grocery store, called a pasal, is an important part of the local economy.  Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home.  Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margins.  By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability.  While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: To buy grocery goods

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
Paulina tiene 55 años, está casada con Sergio, con quien tiene cuatro hijos, pero ahora sólo viven con uno de ellos. Su casa es propia, la compraron hace 25 años.
Ella posee una carretilla desde hace 4 años, con la que vende frutas y flores, de forma ambulatoria. “Todo depende del mes, por ejemplo en el mes de mayo y noviembre vendo flores, los demás días del mes vendo frutas”, comenta. Su secreto es comprar las frutas por cajones y a menor precio, de esa manera se asegura poder tener mayores ganancias. Mientras que las flores las siembra ella misma: “gladiolos”, “lluvia” e “ilusiones”, las cuales vende en la temporada cuando los pobladores visitan los cementerios. Pero como Paulina es una mujer muy trabajadora, también se dedica a la compra y venta de animales en la feria de su ciudad los días sábados. 

Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “Nuevo amanecer” y este es su noveno crédito con MFP. En todo este tiempo (más de 4 años) obtuvo el dinero necesario para invertir en el desarrollo de su negocio, por lo que promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. 
Paulina invertirá el dinero de este préstamo en la compra de cajones de frutas para abastecer su negocio y si el dinero le alcanza comprará también ovejas.
texts.en:
Paulina is 55 years old, is married to Sergio with whom she has four children, but only one currently lives with them. They own their house, which they bought 25 years ago.

She has owned a wheelbarrow for four years, with which she sells fruit and flowers in a market. "Everything depends on the month, for example, in the month of May and November I sell flowers, and in the rest I sell fruit," she says. Her secret is to purchase the fruit by the box at a lower price, and in this way she can make more money. Meanwhile, the flowers she plants herself: "gladiolus," "rain," and "illusions," which she sells at the time when people visit cemeteries. But, as Paulina is a very hard-working woman, she also works buying and selling animals in the city market on Saturdays.

She belongs to the group "Nuevo Amanecer" (New Sunrise) and this is her ninth loan with MFP. In all this time (more than four years), she has obtained the money necessary to invest in the development of her business, and because of this she promises to be on-time with her payments.

Paulina will invest the money from this loan in the purchase of boxes of fruit in order to supply her business, and, if there is enough money, she will also buy sheep.

loans.use: to purchase fruit boxes to supply her business, and, if there is enough money, to buy sheep.

loans.name: Berta Santos

texts.es: Berta Santos de cuarenta y dos años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus tres hijos en casa propia; Ella se dedica a la venta de productos de uso personal, cremas, desodorantes, perfumes, entre otros, tiene varios años con el pequeño negocio y eso le ha regalado muy buena experiencia en las ventas, comercia de forma ambulante y desde su vivienda, ya tiene mucha clientela pues las personas la prefieren por su producto de calidad, a precios accesibles y sobre todo por el excelente servicio; Berta es una mujer emprendedora, enérgica, con muchas ganas de salir adelante, siempre esta buscando alternativas que le abran puertas a un futuro mas prospero y no piensa rendirse hasta alcanzarlas; en los últimos meses tuvo perdidas y desea recuperarse pero no posee de suficiente capital para la inversión por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar cremas, perfumes, cosméticos, desodorantes, etc. Berta tiene buena calificación de pago y es muy responsable, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda en el periodo establecido y al mismo tiempo ofrece darle a su familia una vida plena.
texts.en:
Berta Santos, 42, lives with her life companion and their three children in her own house.  She sells personal use items like creams, deodorants, perfume, among others.  She’s had this small business for years and it’s provided her with good sales experience.  She sells from place to place and at home.  He has a large clientele because people prefer her because of her quality products, her accessible prices and above all for her excellent service.  

Berta is an enterprising, energetic woman who very much wants to get ahead and is always looking for alternatives that will open doors to a more prosperous future and she does not plan to give up until she reaches it.

She had some losses the last few months and wants to recuperate but does not have enough capital for the investment so is asking INTEGRAL for a loan to buy creams, perfumes, cosmetics, deodorants, etc.  Berta has good payment record and is very responsible.  She is sure that she will be able to repay the loan as scheduled while offering her family a full life at the same time.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is married with four children, and all of her children go to school.  She doesn’t take care of additional family members.  She has a tailoring business and has been in this business for six years. She has applied for a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more rolls of clothing materials and needles. She sells on a wholesale basis only and works six days a week.  Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters.  She aspires to see her business grow into a tailoring school. She also wants to build her own house. She resides in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity but no piped water.  Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more rolls of clothing materials and needles

loans.name: Ysabel

texts.es:
Ysabel tiene 40 años, vive en una casa que alquila desde hace 20 años, junto a su familia; su esposo Adolfo y su hijo Joel.
Cuando conoció a su esposo él se dedicaba a la venta de medicinas naturales, entonces ella comenzó a ayudarle. Su negocio consiste en la compra de platas medicinales con las que elaboran medicinas caseras, que venden en la feria de su localidad. Adolfo tiene 63 años, y 35 años de experiencia, es por esa razón que Ysabel lo ayuda en la elaboración, con el fin de aprender los secretos de la medicina natural; “mi esposo ya es conocido, los pobladores conocen mi casa y recibo las visitas de ellos constantemente, pues hay muchas enfermedades que no son curadas en los hospitales”, afirma. 

Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “Nuevo amanecer” y este es su séptimo crédito con MFP. En todo este tiempo (más de tres años) obtuvo el dinero necesario para invertir en el desarrollo de su negocio, por lo que promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le agrada pertenecer a su grupo porque todas las personas son responsables.
Ysabel invertirá este dinero en la compra de más plantas medicinales para la elaboración de las medicinas naturales.
texts.en:
Ysabel is 40 years old, and lives in a house that she has rented for more than 20 years along with her family: her husband Adolfo and her son Joel. When she met her husband, he was working selling natural medicines. She began to help him. The business consists of buying medicinal plants with which they make home-made medicines that they sell in their town's market. Adolfo is 63 years old and has 35 years of experience. This is why Ysabel helps him make the medicines, with the goal of learning the secrets of natural medicines. "My husband is already known, the townspeople know my house and I receive visits from them constantly, since there are a lot of illnesses that are not cured in the hospitals," she says. 

She belongs to the solidarity group Nuevo Amanecer and this is her seventh credit with MFP. In all this time (more than three years) she received the necessary money to invest in her business, which is why she promises to be on time with her payments. In addition, she is pleased to be part of her group because all the people are responsible. Ysabel will invest this money in buying more medicinal plants to make natural medicines.

loans.use: to buy more medicinal plants to make natural medicines.

loans.name: Martha Esperanza

texts.es: Martha Esperanza, de 52 años , soltera, con  tres hijos , del cual 1 es menor de edad  y esta bajo su responsabilidad, tiene por actividad economica la costura y venta de gaseosas, cuenta con  11años de experiencia actividad que consisten en la elaboracion de todo tipo de prenda de vestir como: (pantalones, camisas,  faldas, vestidos,  el financiamiento lo quiere para invertir en capital de trabajo como hilos, agujas, carretes, telas, bobinas, aceite de maquina entre otros  ya que ha sido de gran ayuda para  a los pequeños comerciantes, para tener una herramienta de trabajo propia
texts.en: Martha Esperanza, 52 years old, is single with three children, one of whom is a minor and under her responsibility. In order to make a living, she sews and sells soft drinks. She has 11 years of experience, which consists of the making of all types of clothing such as: pants, shirts, skirts, and dresses. She wants to invest the money in working capital such as thread, needles, spools, fabrics, and machine oil, among other things, since it would be a major help to her small business to have the proper tools for the job.

loans.use: to buy: pants, shirts, skirts, dresses, needles, thread, spools, cloth, and machine oil, among other things.

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.es: María del Carmen de cuarenta y uno años de edad vive junto a su grupo familiar conformado por su compañero de vida y sus hijos; ella se dedica a la venta de zapatos y sandalias para damas, caballeros y niños, tiene en varios estilos y muy a la moda, comercia de forma ambulante por la localidad donde vive y por los municipios aledaños a  la comunidad, ya tiene mucha clientela fija pues las personas la buscan por la calidad de su producto, por los precios accesibles pero sobre todo por el servicio inigualable que siempre esta a la orden de las de los clientes; María es una mujer activa, dedicada a su labor, luchadora pero lo mas importante soñadora quiere cumplir cada una de sus metas por eso trabaja día con día con esfuerzo y motivación sabe que solo así alcanzara el éxito, como toda buena comerciante quiere acrecentar el negocio pues así aumentaran las ganancias, necesita invertir pero no posee de suficiente capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito  que le permite comprar zapatos y sandalias por mayor. María del Carmen tiene buenas referencias de pago, se hace responsable del pago de la deuda y al mismo tiempo tiene la esperanza que podrá darle a su familia la calidad de vida que se merecen.
texts.en:
María del Carmen, 41, lives with her family group composed of her life companion and their children.  She sells shoes and sandals for men, women and children; she has several styles that are very much in vogue.  She sells from place to place throughout her neighborhood and in adjacent municipalities.  She has quite a large number of regular customers because people seek her out because of the quality of her products, her affordable prices and above all for the unequalled service she offers; she is always at her customers’ service.

María is an active woman who is dedicated to her work.  She is tenacious and above all a dreamer which is most important.  She wants to reach each and every one of her goals which is why she works day to day with much effort and dedication because she knows that this is the only way to attain success.

Like all good merchants, she wants to expand the business in order to increase profits.  She needs to invest but does not have sufficient capital to do so which is why she’s asking INTEGRAL for a loan to be able to buy shoes and sandals at wholesale.  María del Carmen has good payment references and she takes on the commitment of the debt while at the same time hoping to be able to give her family the quality of life they so deserve.

loans.use: to buy shoes and sandals at wholesale.

loans.name: Fanny Matilde

texts.es: Fanny continua con el negocio que empezó hace 11 años después de una crisis en su matrimonio, para poder mantener a sus hijos decidió vender jugos en especial de sandia recorriendo diversos sectores, cuando por fin reunió capital comenzó a comprar ropa para vender. En la actualidad sus hijos mayores le ayudan con la venta recorriendo todo el día buscando clientes, entre los artículos que ofertan están los pantalones, camisas, blusas. Uno de sus mayores problemas por el tipo de negocio que tiene es la competencia y la transportación de su mercadería y que al sector le faltan obras y las calles están deterioradas. Con el préstamo que solicita comprara mercadería para la venta ya que aun tiene 2 hijos que estudian en el colegio fiscal y le gustaría que terminaran. Su sueño a futuro es poder abrir un almacén de ropa fijo.
texts.en:
Fanny continues with the business she started 11 years ago during a crisis in her marriage.  In order to support her children she decided to sell juices, especially watermelon, throughout various sectors.  When at last she gathered enough capital she started to buy clothes to resell.  Currently, her older children help her to sell spending all day looking for customers.  Among the items she sells are pants, shirts and blouses.

One of her biggest problems because of the type of business she has is competition and transporting her merchandise because in her sector services are still lacking and the streets are in bad shape.  

She will use the loan she’s requesting to b buy merchandise to sell since she still has two children attending public school and she’d like them to finish.  
Her dream for the future is to be able to open a permanent clothing store.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Jose De La Cruz

texts.es: Jose de la cruz de 28 años de edad, soltero tiene por actividad económica una vulcanizadora ,  a la cual de dedica de desde muy joven ya que su padre y hermano le enseñaron dicho oficio lo cual ha sido muy bueno como alternativa de trabajo, los problemas y desafíos que ha enfrentado  actualmente han sido de salud de su padre y hermano, el negocio consisten en la compra  de  reparación de llantas, vende neumáticos de carros, bicicletas,  motocicletas, parches entre otros .uno de sus  mas grandes sueños es llegar a tener su propia familias.gracias al apoyo que Fundación León 2000 le brinda es que ha podido salir adelante con su negocio y obtener estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Jose de la Cruz, 28 years old, is single and works as a vulcanizer, which he has done since he was very young since his father and brother taught him said trade, which has been a very good alternative job. The problems and challenges that face him currently have been the health of his father and brother. The business consists of the purchase and repair of tires, the sale of tires for cars, bicycles, motorcycles, and patches, among other things. One of his biggest dreams is to have a family of his own. Thanks to the support brought by Fundacion Leon 2000, he has been able to advance his business and and obtain economic stability.

loans.use: to repair tires, to sell tires for cars, bicycles, motorcylces, and patches, among other things.

loans.name: José Isabel

texts.es: José de 60 años de edad es el propietario de un negocio de miscelánea y papelería ubicado al norte de la ciudad; él fue durante muchos años vigilante en una academia de educación  técnica y aprovechando esa situación decidió instalar en un local contiguo ese negocio, un punto comercial para vender productos de papelería y miscelánea; Poco a poco este lugar fue conocido por mucha gente y  José entonces fue agregando otros productos y servicios como el de llamadas, fotocopiaje y transcripciones de documentos.  En su negocio es apoyado por su esposa y su hija en la atención del público, pues como está ubicado cerca a una universidad, muchos son los estudiantes que solicitan papelería, servicios de comunicación, fotocopiaje y transcripciones. Como José es un buen negociante, está siempre pendiente de la oportunidad para generar ingresos, así es que también vende queso por libras,  que trae desde el departamento del Magdalena y representa un ingreso mas con el que genera bienestar a su familia conformada por su esposa y sus dos hijos. En la actualidad requiere un surtido de fólderes, agendas, resmas de papel y cartulina, en un volumen importante para aprovechar descuentos por la compra de estos productos. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará estos artículos para tener un inventario disponible de las mercancías de mayor rotación y ganarse el costo de la oportunidad y en esto consiste el éxito de su inversión. Su meta es seguir ampliando su negocio hasta convertirlo en una de las papelerías mas importantes dela ciudad y aumentar cada vez mas su bienestar y el de su familia..
texts.en:
José, 60, owns a variety and stationery store located in the north of the city.  He worked for many years as a custodian at a technical education academy and taking advantage of that situation decided to locate his business in a site next door.  It was a commercial site to sell stationery supplies and miscellany.  Gradually the place became known to many people and José started to add other products and services like photocopying and document transcription.  His wife and daughter help him with customer service in the shop because being located near a university many of the students require paper goods, communication services, photocopying and transcriptions.

Because José is a good merchant, he’s always on the lookout for opportunities to earn income so he also sells cheese by the pound that he brings from Magdalena Department and that represents an additional source of income he uses to provide wellbeing for his family consisting of his wife and two children.

He currently needs a supply of folders, agendas, reams of paper and construction paper in significant amounts in order to take advantage of volume discounts on said products.  This is the reason for his turning to a Kiva loan, his first financing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to buy said items to have his best selling merchandise in inventory so that he can earn back the cost of the merchandise thus having a successful investment.  His goal is to continue expanding his business until it becomes one of the city’s most important stationery stores and to increase his family’s wellbeing more all the time.

loans.use: to buy folders, agendas, reams of paper and construction paper in large amounts.

loans.name: Modestina

texts.es: La Señora Modestina tiene 37 años madre soltera de 2 hijos menores dependientes, vive y trabaja en una comunidad rural 2do Toncoli que se encuentra a 52 km de la ciudad de Cbba, desde hace 15 años se dedica a la agricultura es la fuente de su ingreso económico produce papa, haba en terreno de 3 has herencia de sus padres, Doña Modestina necesita capital para compra de insumos agrícolas (abono orgánico y semilla de papa) para ampliar sus cultivos y aumentar la producción en la siguiente campaña agrícola, Doña Modestina nos comenta que ahora sembrara en mas superficie garantizando la seguridad alimentaria para su familia y mejorar sus ingresos para ahorrar dinero y así construir su casa propia porque actualmente vive en la casa de sus padres.
texts.en:
Modestina, age 37, is the single mother of two minor, dependent children.  She lives and works in a rural community, Segundo Toncoli, which is 52 kilometers from the city of Cochabamba.

She has farmed since she was 15 years old, and it is her source of income.  She produces potatoes and beans on three hectares of land that she inherited from her parents.

Modestina needs capital to buy farming supplies (organic fertilizer and potato seeds) in order to enlarge her crops and increase production during the next agricultural season.

Modestina tells us that she will now plant in a bigger area, guaranteeing food security for her family.  She will improve her income in order to save money to build her own house.  She currently lives in her parents’ house.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson is 48 years old and married to Jane. They live in Ndunyu Njeru and have five children. Nelson plants cash crops such as maize, beans, and potatoes.

This will be Nelson's second loan and he plans to buy two bags of fertilizer. With the anticipated income he plans to expand his farming business.

In the future, he plans to expand his farming by planting more cash crops and thereby make more income. He plans to be able to provide good education for his children.

loans.use: to buy two bags of fertilizer.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children and two of her children go to school. She has no additional family members. 

She operates a retail shop and also rears poultry from home. She sells her products on retail basis. She has been in this business for the last 10 years. She also gets additional income from rental houses. She works seven days a week. 

Amina has requested a loan of 400,000 Uganda shillings (UGX) from MCDT – SACCO to buy sugar, cooking oil, flour, soap, and animal feeds. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to build more rental houses and also to own a wholesale shop. She lives in a rented house. The family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her major expenses include paying for utility bills and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more bags of sugar, cooking oil, flour, soap, and animal feeds.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet is married with four children and all her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members: her mother. 

She has a business of tailoring and has been in this business for 16 years. She has applied for a loan of 1,500,000 Uganda shillings (UGX) from MCDT-SACCO to buy more rolls of clothing materials and threads. She generates additional income through knitting sweaters.

Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. She works from her home and sells on wholesale only. She is aspiring of seeing her business grow big so that she owns a tailoring school and also to employ three young girls to assist in tailoring. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include paying school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more rolls of clothing materials.

loans.name: Ildeblande

texts.en:
Ildeblande is aged 50. He is married and has four children aged between 9 and 17. He is married to a farmer and he has been a rice farmer for 8 years. He wants the loan to use in the rice production to pay for labor costs and fertilizer. With the profits from the business he will be paying for medical insurance for his family members and school fees for the children.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Cresencio

texts.es: La señor Cresencio es natural de la comunidad de San Isidro Alto aproximadamente a 8 km al este de Tiraque, actualmente vive en la comunidad con sus familia a su cargo de él, la vivienda donde vive es construido de barro con techo de teja tipo rustico. La actividad a que se dedica es la agricultura que produce papa, haba y cereales al mismo tiempo se dedica al servicio de albañil los productos agrícolas son producidos en los terrenos de herencia de su padre que actualmente vive con su esposa, el  señor prácticamente el crédito que está solicitando es para insumos agrícolas para poder incrementar la producción al año, así de esa manera de mejorar sus ingresos económicos para mantener su familia. En la zona donde vive el señor produce estacionalmente manifiesta que cosecha dos veces al año la producción, y los trabajos agrícolas realizan con sus hijos en algunos casos con ayuda de sus vecinos en aine.
texts.en: Cresencio comes from the community of San Isidro Alto, approximately 8 km east of Tiraque. He currently lives in the community with his family, who are dependent on him. The house where they live is constructed of clay with a rustic-type tile roof.  The work to which he dedicates himself is agriculture, producing potatoes, beans and grains. At the same time, he also works as a mason. The agricultural crops are produced on lands passed down from his father, who is currently living with his wife. The borrower will use the loan he is requesting for agricultural supplies, so that he can increase his production for the year. In this way, he will increase his income to support his family economically. In the area where he lives, crops are produced seasonally. He notes that he harvests his crops twice a year, and that he carries out his agricultural work together with his children, and in some cases with the help of his neighbors.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Nuriya

texts.ru: Нурие 40 лет, замужем, мать 3 детей. В 2009 году, в поисках источника дохода для своей семьи,  Нурия начала свой бизнес в торговле запасными частями к автомашинам со стартовой суммой в 50,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря настойчивости  и упорному труду,  Нурия сумела развить свой бизнес  с ежемесячным доходом  в 10,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день ассортимент товаров не представлен в изобилии, и по этой причине Нурия обратилась  в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на закуп запасных частей к микроавтобусам Форд.  Доходы от кредита Нурия  планирует вложить в развитие бизнеса, так как планирует обучить младших детей в ВУЗе.
texts.en: Nuriya is 40 years old, married and is a mother of three children.  In search of a source of income for her family, she started her own business in sales of automotive spare parts in 2009 with an initial sum of 50,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to persistence and hard work, Nuriya was able to develop her business to have a monthly income of 10,000 som (KGS).  Today, there is not an abundance of merchandise variety, and this is why Nuriya requested a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to purchase spare parts for Ford minivans.  She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into business development because she plans to educate her younger children at a university.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts

loans.name: Uulkan

texts.ru: Уулкан 47 лет, замужем, мать 2 детей. В 2009 году, в поисках источника дохода для своей семьи,  Уулкан начала свой бизнес в торговле детской и школьной одеждой со стартовой суммой в 30,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря настойчивости  и упорному труду,  Уулкан сумела развить свой бизнес  с ежемесячным доходом  в 15,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день ассортимент товаров не представлен в изобилии, и по этой причине Уулкан обратилась  в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на закуп школьной одежды к открытию школьного сезона.  Доходы от кредита Уулкан  планирует вложить в развитие бизнеса, так как планирует обучить  сына в ВУЗе.
texts.en: Uulkan is 47 years old, married and is a mother of two children.  In search of a source of income for her family, she started her own business in sales of children's and school clothing in 2009 with an initial sum of 30,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to persistence and hard work, Uulkan was able to develop her business to have a monthly income of 15,000 som (KGS).  Today, there is not an abundance of merchandise variety, and this is why Uulkan requested a loan in the amount of 70,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to purchase school uniforms prior to the start of the school season.  She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into business development because she plans to educate her son at a university.

loans.use: to purchase school uniforms

loans.name: Mchekwisha

texts.en:
Mchekwisha is an enterprising woman with a lot of enthusiasm. She is still in her business of selling water to the neighborhood. 

This is her third loan with Yehu and second with Kiva. She has a good repayment reference since she has successfully repaid her first loan and is about to complete her second loan. The loan she is now requesting will be used to purchase a water tank. This will help Mchekwisha stock enough water to help her during scarcity times.

loans.use: to purchase a water tank.

loans.name: Martires Segundo

texts.es: Martires es un hombre trabajador desde muy corta edad, a sus 59 años no encontraba trabajo en una empresa por lo que decidió invertir en la compra de una tricimoto. El negocio es rentable y le da tranquilidad ya que se siente útil teniendo un trabajo estable. Trabaja desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche, no le preocupa la delincuencia porque como son varios compañeros tienen una ruta establecida y se cuidan. El servicio que brinda tiene un costo de 0.25 a 0.50 ctv. por persona dependiendo del lugar donde se dirija. El préstamo que está solicitando en esta ocasión es para mejorar su vivienda por lo que comprara cemento, hierro, arena, piedras y otros materiales que necesitaría, espera terminar la construcción y el enlucido. Espera a futuro poder ampliar el negocio con la compra de otra tricimoto.
texts.en: Martires has been a hard-working man since a young age.  At 59 years old, he couldn't find work with company, and so he deicded to invest in the purchase of a "tricimoto" (a trike used for transporting passengers). The business is profitable and gives Martires a sense of peace; he feels useful having a stable job.  He works from 6:00 in the morning until 10:00 at night.  He is not worried about crime becuase there are others in the same line of work.  They have established routes and watch out for each toher.  The service Martires offers costs from $0.25 to $0.50 per person depending on where the passenger is going.  The loan that Martires is requesting at this time is for improvements to his home.  He will purchase cement, iron, sand, stone and other materials that he will need.  He hopes to finish the construction and the plaster work.  In the future, he hopes to expand his business with the purchase of another "tricimoto."

loans.use: to purchase cement, iron, sand, stone and other materials.

loans.name: Marziya

texts.ru: Marziya zamujem i imeyet 3 detey. Ona yavlayyetsya IDP personom i pereselenec iz Fuzuli goroda kotoriy seychas yavlyayetsya okkupirovannimi. Seychas ona projivayet v Fizuli regione vmeste so svoim mujem i detmi. Marziya 50 let. Ona uje 11 let kak zanimayestay skotovodstvom i razvodit korov, dlya prodaji molochnix produktov. Ona prodayet v magazini kefir, yogurt, Ayran( nacionalniy napitok kotoriy delayut iz yogurta) i t.d. Seychas ona nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit korovi dlya razvitiya svoyego biznessa i uvelicheniya molochnogo produkta dlya prodaji. Etomu biznessu ona nauchilas u svoyey starshey sestri.
texts.en: Marziya is married and has three children.  She is an IDP from the city of Fuzuli, which is now an occupied territory.  She currently lives in the Fuzuli region together with her husband and children.  Marziya is 50 years old.  She has been involved in animal husbandry for eleven years and breeds cows to get dairy products.  She kefir, yogurt, Ayran (national beverage made from yogurt), etc. at a store.  Marziya currently needs 2000 AZN to buy cows in order to develop her business and increase the quantities of milk products for sale.  She learned this business from her older sister.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Alexandra Miryam

texts.es: Alexandra vive en Quevedo en la casa de sus padres ya que es soltera y es ahí donde tiene su negocio de venta de ropa. Comenzó hace varios años cuando estaba en el colegio y empezó a ofrecer y vender ropa y artículos varios a sus compañeras. Le gusto tanto que ahora esto es su forma de vida ya que realiza la venta sola todo el día a cualquier hora, entre los artículos que más vende están las blusas, vestidos, interiores, pantalones. Las ventas son directas y al contado ya que el crédito es para las personas que conoce por mucho tiempo disminuyendo el riesgo de que no le pague. El préstamo que está solicitando es para comprar mercadería y así aumentar sus ventas, espera a futuro poner una boutique.
texts.en: Alexandra lives in Quevedo in her parents' house since she is single and that's where she has her clothes selling business. She started several years ago when she was in school and started to sell clothing and assorted articles to her classmates. She liked it so much that now it's her way of life since she sells by herself all day at any hour. Among the articles that she sells the most of are blouses, dresses, underwear, and pants. The sales are direct and in cash since credit is for the people she has known a long time, lessening the risk that they don't pay her. The loan she is applying for is to buy merchandise and that way increase her sales. She hopes to open a boutique in the future.

loans.use: to buy blouses, dresses, underwear, and pants.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es: Maribel  de 33 años de edad vive en la ciudad de Cartagena con su esposo y sus 4 hijos en las edades de 2 a 15 años. Ella para apoyar los ingresos del hogar tiene una pequeña variedad en su propia casa donde vende artículos femeninos mercancía variada c como cosméticos, telas, electrodomésticos menores y juegos femeninos. Su negocio nació una vez su esposo se fue a Panamá, buscando mejores oportunidades de ingresos para su familia, y ella debió asumir todos los gastos mientras él se radicaba y estabilizaba sus ingresos. Así fue como inició poco a poco vendiendo uno a uno entre amigos y posteriormente agregó una clientela mayor, por recomendación de su primera clientela doméstica. En la actualidad su mayor desafío es tener el capital de trabajo suficiente, para responder  su sueño de ampliar su local y formar a sus hijos con valores cristianos  y ofrecerles una educación de calidad, para que tengan éxito en sus vidas. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará perfumería, accesorios femeninos juveniles, juguetería y papelería como empaque, porque Maribel aprovechará el día del amor y la amistad para hacer su mayor venta del año, como tradicionalmente ocurre en esta temporada. Con su credikiva aumentará sustancialmente su volumen de ventas y esto sí que es de gran éxito.
texts.en:
Maribel, age 33, lives in the city of Cartagena with her husband and four children ages 2 to 15. In order to help out with the household income, she has a small variety store in her home. She sells a variety of items for women such as cosmetics, cloth, small home appliances, and women's outfits.
Her business was born when her husband went to Panama in search of better opportunities for making an income for his family; she was required to assume all of the costs while he got settled and his income stabilized. Bit by bit, she started selling to friends, and eventually built up a larger clientele from recommendations from her first local customers. Currently, her greatest challenge is having enough working capital in order to fulfill her dream of expanding her store, raising her children with Christian values, and offering them a quality education so that they will have success in their lives. She is now applying for a Kiva loan, her first loan from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which she will buy perfume, accessories for young women, toys, and stationery items such as wrapping paper. Maribel is going to take advantage of Valentine's Day [celebrated in September in Colombia] in order to have her highest sales of the year as normally occurs in this season. With her Kiva loan she will expand her sales volume substantially. This will be a great success.

loans.use: to buy perfume, accessories for young women, toys, and stationery items such as wrapping paper.

loans.name: Emilia

texts.es: Emilia  de 51 años de edad es la propietaria de un taller de confecciones  con los que genera los ingresos de su hogar. Ella tiene un hijo de 17 años, con quien sueña ver convertido en un profesional exitoso y es el motor de su vida, pues a él  tiene dirigido sus mayores esfuerzos. Emilia produce prendas de vestir femeninas, su negocio cuenta con varias maquinarias industriales y usualmente ocupa uno o dos operarias; adicionalmente cuenta con un pequeño almacén en el cual exhibe la ropa que produce. Sus tareas las realiza fabricando por tallas y sobre medidas, con una calidad excepcional, aprendida desde hace 30 años siguiendo los pasos a su madre, quien practicaba este arte. En su punto comercial, Emilia tiene planes de ofrecer un mayor confort a sus clientes y esta es la razón por la cual acude  aun credikiva, con el cual comprará un aire acondicionado y también se provisionará de telas que están a la moda y fabricará nuevos diseños que muy seguramente venderá a la juventud, objeto de su directriz comercial con esta inversión. Su meta mas adelante es continuar ampliando su taller y posicionar su marca, su mayor desafío es la competencia de ropa importada que usualmente ingresa a la ciudad, pero responde a esta situación ofreciendo en el mercado su atención uno a uno, que implica mas trabajo,  pero con ella masifica su venta individual y sostiene su clientela.
texts.en:
Emilia, 51, owns a dressmaking workshop where she generates income for her household.  She has a 17 year-old son who is the motivation for her life, and she dreams of seeing him become a successful professional.  It is for him that she puts forth her maximum efforts.  Emilia produces garments for women.  In her business she has a number of industrial sewing machines and she usually has 1 or 2 employees.  She also has a small store where she displays the clothing that she makes.  She makes her garments tailored to order, and also by sizes, with exceptional quality.  She learned this trade 30 years ago following in the footsteps of her mother, who used to practice this art.  

In her store, Emilia wants to offer more comfort to her customers, and this is the reason why she is requesting a Kiva loan.  She will use the loan to buy an air conditioner, and she will also stock up on fabrics that are in style, making new designs that will sell well to young people, which is her goal with this investment.  For the future, her goal is to continue to expand her workshop and position her brand.  Her main challenge is the competition from imported clothing which flows into the city.  But she responds to this situation by offering personalized one-on-one attention to her customers.  This takes more work, but this way she can expand her individual sales and maintain her customer base.

loans.use: to buy an air conditioner and to stock up on fabrics that are in style

loans.name: Maria Clemencia

texts.es: Maria tiene en Quevedo un bazar el cual lo heredo de su mamá hace varios años ya que ella dejo de trabajar por su edad, lo tomo a su cargo e invirtió en el mejorando la atención y renovando la mercadería. Ahora aparte de bazar también vende interiores, blusas, pantalones y vestidos, esta variedad le permite tener más clientes. Esta felizmente unida y tiene 2 hijos quienes estudian en el colegio fiscal y una nena que tiene pocos meses de nacida, es por su familia que ha decidido hacer un préstamo para invertir en mercadería de la papeleria como cuadernos, laminas, cartulinas ect, con la finalidad de mejorar sus ventas y de esta manera también su futuro. Su meta es crecer como persona principalmente estar bien consigo misma y con Dios para que con sus bendiciones se proyecten en su negocio y su familia.
texts.en: Maria has a store in Quevedo which she took over from her mother a few years ago.  Her mother stopped working because of her age and Maria took over the business.  She invested in improving their service and renewing their merchandise.  Now, in addition to the paper goods, she sells undergarments, blouses, pants and dresses.  The variety enables her to have more customers.  Maria is happily married and has 2 children who are go to the public school and a baby girl who is just a couple of months old.  Maria has decided to take out a loan for the sake of her family.  She will invest in the purchase of paper goods like notebooks, paper, poster board etc. with the goal of improving her sales and thereby her future.  Maria's main goal is to grow as a person and to feel good about herself and close to God so that her prayers project into her business and her family.

loans.use: to purchase notebooks, pens, paper etc.

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith is a single mother of four children and all her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. 

Edith has a business of a beauty salon and has been in this business for 8 years. She has applied for a loan of 1,000,000 Uganda shillings (UGX) from MCDT SACCO to buy more boxes of cream relaxers, braids, and weaves. She works from home and sells on retail basis only seven days a week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and the ever increasing prices of cream relaxers.

She is aspiring of owning a bridal salon and also to own a fully stocked beauty salon. She resides in rented house and the family has access to electricity and no piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, rent, and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of cream relaxers, braids, and weaves.

loans.name: Wellington Fernando

texts.es: Wellington se independizo hace varios años gracias a su mamá quien le enseño desde temprana edad a ser comerciante. Hoy en día se dedica de lleno a esta actividad vendiendo en su mayoría blusas, sabanas, toldos recorriendo la ciudad desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 4 de la tarde. Se siente satisfecho consigo mismo ya que a sus 20 años tiene un negocio estable el cual le permite cubrir sus gastos estudiantiles y personales. El préstamo que está solicitando es para la comprar de mercadería mejorando sus ventas, su sueño inmediato es poder terminar la universidad y ejercer su profesión.
texts.en: Thanks to his mother, who taught him sales at a young age, Wellington went out on his own a few years ago.  He currently makes his living selling primarily blouses, sheets and canopies throughout the city.  He works from 7:00 in the morning until 4:00 in the afternoon.  Wellington feels satisfied with himself since at 20 years old he has a stable business that allows him to cover his educational and personal expenses.  The loan that he is requesting is for the purchase of merchandise to improve his sales.  His dream for the near future is to finish up at the university and to practice his profession.

loans.use: to purchase blouses, sheets and canopies.

loans.name: Olimpia Yesenia

texts.es: Olimpia tiene 36 años y a vivido la mayor parte de su vida en Isla Trinitaria, su casa es de cemento y tiene todos los servicios básicos. Ella se dedica a la venta de artículos para mujeres y hombre por catalogo de marcas reconocidas. Escogió esta actividad porque le gusta mucho las ventas y lo vio como una fuente de ingreso por lo que decidió inscribirse y empezar su negocio, actualmente lo realiza solo bajo pedido para asegurar la venta del producto. Realiza el trabajo 3 días a la semana ya que solo hace sus visitas cuando tiene pedidos. Lo que más vende son los perfumes, desodorantes, maquillajes, cremas, labiales, etc. como tiene varios años con el negocio le gustaría poder ofertar variedad por lo que el préstamo que solicita es para la compra de productos y ropa, de esa manera podría mostrar al cliente y hacerlo interesar para una compra efectiva. Su meta futura es abrir un local para que mejoren sus ventas.
