El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de red de pesca) mismo que adquiere de las ferias de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo adecuara en negocio. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es soltera y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta que le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta los desembolsos.
texts.en:
The “Rey de Reyes” (King of Kings) communal bank will start its first cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Villa Adela Focal Center.  It has six members led by a governing board headed by Teófila, President.  The communal bank members are in a variety of businesses among which we have the sale of natural medicines, raw fish sales, knitting and selling sweaters, Broasted chicken sales, veil and shawl knitting and Herbalife sales.

The loan they’ll take out will benefit small micro businesses.  Teófila’s is one of them and she indicates that this is the second time she’s joined Pro Mujer having been invited by one of the institution’s promoters who visited her at home.  She currently sells raw fish.  She relates that she acquired this business from her parents since she was a girl; they are fishermen.

The loan she’ll take out now is to increase capital.  She will buy fishing net in the city of El Alto’s street market that she’ll then adjust for her work.  This way of working allows her to generate income needed to support her family the best way possible since she’s single and has three children.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the disbursements.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María tiene 48 años, hace 24 años enviudó, desde entonces cuida de sus cuatro hijos sola. Actualmente sólo vive con tres de ellos, en la casa que compró hace 5 años. A pesar de que sus hijos son mayores y ya conformaron su familia, ella continua viviendo con ellos, pues siempre soñó con criar a sus nietos.

Ella tiene una tienda de comestibles que acondicionó en su casa, pero no es la única actividad que realiza pues también cría de ganado vacuno, tiene cinco vacas, de las que extrae la leche que producen y la vende a sus vecinos. También tiene ovejas y gallinas, pero para su propio consumo, pero cuenta que si tiene cualquier eventualidad las vende en el mercado. Pero la actividad que le ayudó a solventar los gatos de sus hijos cuando eran pequeños fue el bordado de fustanes típicos, el precio de estas prendas es alto porque tarda mucho tiempo en terminarlas. Ahora solo realiza uno al mes, porque ya no tiene la necesidad económica de antes. 

Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “Los emprendedores” y este es su quinto crédito con MFP, por tanto agradece el que le dan para cumplir con sus objetivos. Promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas y además le agrada ser parte de su asociación, pues lleva muchos años de conocerlos.
María invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de bebidas por cajas para su tienda de comestibles y si el dinero le alcanza comprará alimento balanceado para sus animales.
texts.en:
María, 48, was widowed 24 years ago.  Since then she’s cared for her four children alone.  She currently lives with only three of them in the house she purchased five years ago.  Despite her children being adults now and with families of their own, she continues to live with them because she always dreamed of raising her grandchildren

She has a grocery store at home but this isn’t her only activity for she also raises cattle; she has five cows that produce milk she sells to her neighbors.  She also has sheep and chickens but only for her own consumption though she does relate that if she has any unforeseen need she sells them in the market.  But the activity that helped her cover her children’s expenses when they were little was embroidering traditional skirts.  The price of these garments is high because it takes a long time to finish them.  Now, she only makes one a month because she does not have the same economic need she did back then.

She belongs to the “Los Emprendedores” (The Enterprising Ones) communal bank and this is her fifth MFP loan.  She is grateful because they help her reach her objectives.  She promises to make her payments.  She enjoys being part of her communal bank because she’s known them for many years.  María will use the requested money to buy beverages by the case for her grocery store and if the money goes far enough she will also buy animal feed.

loans.use: to buy cases of soft-drinks and  if possible, animal feed.

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en: Perlita is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has two children. Perlita has a video-k shop that offers different kinds of songs. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to pay for the maintenance of her video-k machine (karaoke machine). Perlita is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Perlita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of her video-k machine

loans.name: David

texts.es:
El señor David tiene 29 años de edad, vive junto a su compañera de vida, con quien convive desde hace 3 años, se dedica a trabajar como empleado de vigilancia. Su esposa se dedica  a los oficios domésticos y a la administración de su pequeña tienda.

David trabaja  como empleado de vigilancia en una empresa desde el 27 de  septiembre del  año 2009. En este lugar trabaja un día de por medio, es decir, en turnos de 24 horas. En su tiempo libre aprovecha para dedicarse al cultivo de maíz en pequeñas parcelas de producción de 1 manzana (7,000 metros cuadrados) esto lo hace con el apoyo de sus familiares en su lugar de origen que esta a 50 kilómetros aproximadamente de la ciudad.

La tienda, es administrada directamente por la señora, funciona desde hace dos años, se dedicó a este negocio debido a que dejó de funcionar la empresa para la que trabajaba, debido a la experiencia adquirida en la manejo de tienda, lo que aprendió cuando vivía con su madre,  decidió iniciarla con fondos de la indemnización recibida. 

La mercadería que oferta en su local de venta, la compra en el mercado municipal  y  centros comerciales en la ciudad donde reside  que esta a 1.5 kilómetros de distancia de su vivienda.

El préstamo será invertido en la compra de mercadería para la tienda  y $120.00 para la compra de fertilizantes para  el cultivo de maíz

El préstamo servirá para que mantengan sus iniciativas y deseos de progresar, al incrementar el volumen y diversificación de productos de primera necesidad  a ofertar en la tienda y para mejorar la productividad del área de cultivo de maíz.

Confía  en  su experiencia y capacidad de administración, desea hacer crecer su negocio, manifestando que prefiere el auto-empleo, débido a  que le permite dedicarle mayor tiempo a su familia y mejorar su relación, a la vez sus ingresos son mejores que el salario mínimo al que podría aspirar al desempeñarse como empleada. Desea procrear hijosr y poder cuidarles de forma personalizada.
texts.en:
David, 29, lives with his life companion that he’s lived with for three years.  He works as a security guard and his wife does domestic chores and runs their small store.  David has been working for a security firm since September 27, 2009.  He works 14-hour shifts, a day on and one off.  In his spare time he cares for his corn crop in small parcels on one manzana (7,000 square meters).  Family members help him with this work which is located in his place of birth fifty kilometers approximately from the city.

The store is run directly by his wife.  It’s been in operation two years.  He went into this business because he stopped working for the firm he’d been working with.  Because of the experience he’s gained working managing a store when he still lived with his mother he decided to open his store with the money he got from his severance pay.

He buys the merchandise he sells in his store at the municipal market and in shopping centers in the city where he resides that’s 1.5 kilometers from home.  He will use the loan to buy merchandise for the store and $120 to buy fertilizer for the corn crops.

The loan will help him maintain his initiatives and desire to make progress by increasing volume and diversification of basic staples available for sale in his store and to improve the productivity of his corn crops.

He trusts that his experience and management ability.  He wants to make his business grow because he prefers to be self-employed because it allows him more time to spend with his family and to improve his relationship.  At the same time, his income is higher than the minimum wage he’d be able to hope for working as an employee.  He wants to have children and be able to give them personalized care.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for his store and farm supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more products from AVON to resell

loans.name: Alona

texts.en:
Alona is married and has seven children.  Alona is 46 years old and lives in San Roque, Panaon, Misamis Occidental.
Alona sells snacks to earn a living and has had this business for 8 years. She has requested a loan of 9000 to purchase ingredients for her snack vending business.
Alona has been a member of PMPC for 8 years. In the future, Alona hopes to engage in another type of business.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for her snack vending business

She has had this business for 6 years. Rosela has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients for snacks like flour, cheese and rice.  She is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for snacks like flour, cheese and rice

Arlene has a hog raising business to earn a living and has had this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan of 18,000PHP to be used in purchasing feeds for her existing hog raising activity.
Arlene has been a member of PMPC for almost 2 years. In the future, Arlene hopes to engage in another type of business.

Caridad is 49 years old and lives in Biasong, Lopez Jaena. She is widowed and has three children.  Caridad works in the fish industry and sells fish for a living. She has been doing this for 15 years. She has requested a loan of 20,000 to purchase boxes of assorted fish . 

Caridad has been a member of PMPC for 4 years. Caridad hopes to save for her family needs in the future.

loans.use: To purchase for boxes of assorted fish

location.town: Plaridel - Biasong, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidenta

She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy stock of canned goods, snacks & beverages. Khezza Marrie Dawn has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Khezza Marrie Dawn hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

texts.en:
Leonor is 58 years old and lives in Matugas Bajo, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has two children. Leonor has a coconut and copra business and earns approximately PHP3,000 each month doing this type of work. She has a requested a loan of 8000PHP to be used in purchasing more coconut and copra to sell. 
Leonor has been a member of PMPC for 5 years. In the future, Leonor hopes to engage in another type of business. Leonor is the leader of a 2 person group.  Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has her own business.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 37 years old and married with one child. She lives in Unidos, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. For the past two years, Mary Ann has run a business selling charcoal and she earns 5,000 PHP each month. She has been a member of PMPC for five years.  

Mary Ann is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan to purchase wood to make charcoal. In the future, she hopes to succeed in her business.

loans.use: to purchase wood to make charcoal

texts.en:
Flordeliz is 49 years old and is separated. She has five children and lives in the Philippines. For the past six years, Flordeliz has run a business buying and selling ready-to-wear clothing such as t-shirts, pants, and blouses. She is a new member of HSPFI.

Flordeliz is requesting a 5,000 PHP loan to buy more clothing to sell. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

She has been a member of HSPFI since 2012.

Cecelia is requesting a 5,000 PHP loan to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages. In the future, she hopes to improve her business and save for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en: Concepcion is 49 years old and lives in Sinonoc, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 2 children. She is in the business of selling appliances and ready to wear items. She earns approximately PHP 8,000 each month. Concepcion has requested a loan of 12,000 PHP to purchase additional goods for her existing ready to wear business.  She has been a member of PMPC for almost 2 years. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods for her existing ready to wear business

loans.name: Gertrudes

texts.en:
Gertrudes  is 58 years old and widowed. She lives in the Philippines. For the past eight years, Gertrudes has run a sari-sari (food/retail) shop where she buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products, and beverages. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2012.

Gertrudes is requesting a 5,000 PHP loan to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is 31 years old and is married with three children. She lives in the Philippines. For the past two years, she has run a sari-sari (food/retail) shop where she buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products, and beverages. Jennifer has been a member of HSPFI since 2012.

loans.name: Marianita

texts.en:
Marianita is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married, with six children. 

Marianita is providing "habal-habal," or motorcycle, transport services, with her husband as the driver. She has had this business for four years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to pay for the maintenance.

Marianita is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her services.

loans.use: to pay for motorcycle maintenance.

loans.name: Rochel

texts.en:
Rochel is 29 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married, with four children. 

Rochel sells grown and matured chickens. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy animal feed for the her chickens.

Rochel is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for her chickens.

loans.name: Mary Claire

texts.en:
Mary Claire is 24 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married, with two children. 

Mary Claire has pigpen, and she sells grown and matured pigs. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy animal feeds for the pigs.

Mary Claire is a new member.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Nelisa

texts.en: Nelisa is  35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has four children. Nelisa  has a food/retail shop (sari-sari store) that sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy stock of canned goods, snacks & beverages. Nelisa  has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Nelisa hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is a single mother of four children and three of her children to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has a business of a restaurant and has been in this business for three years. 

She works at the market seven days out of every week and sells to all categories of people on retail. She has applied for loan of 300,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bunches of bananas, beef, fish, and Irish potatoes.

Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. She is aspiring to own a fully stocked restaurant and also to build her own house. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity, but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more foodstuffs like bunches of bananas, fish, beef, and Irish potatoes.

loans.name: Nestor

texts.en:
Nestor is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married, with seven children. 

Nestor is providing "motorela," or motorcycle, transport services. He has had this business for three years. He requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to pay for the maintenance.

Nestor is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, he hopes to improve his services.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of his motorcycle.

Julius has a corn field.  He grows, harvests, and sells corn during harvest time.  He has had this business for five years. He requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy fertilizer for the corn.

Julius is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, he hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his corn.

Rosalia is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her services.
