loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia tiene 36 años, tiene dos hijos: José y Janeth, a los que cuida en la casa que adquirió hace 6 años. 
Ella es una mujer admirable, pues cuida de sus hijos sola, se las ingenia para poder ganar el dinero necesario, ya que su único sustento es la crianza de cerdos. Cuenta con 15 ejemplares que engorda y cuida con mucha dedicación, ya que vende su carne por pedidos y en ocasiones se los compran vivos; “todo depende del cliente”, afirma. Le va muy bien en este negocio, obtiene buenos ingresos que le permiten criar a sus hijos, pero para llevar un ingreso extra al hogar también trabaja como peón en diferentes chacras durante la cosecha, y también trabaja en las ladrilleras de su localidad. Su deseo a futuro es abrir un restaurante en su casa, ya que no existe ninguno en su zona.

Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “Los emprendedores” y este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por tanto agradece el apoyo que le dan para cumplir con sus objetivos. Promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas y además le agrada ser parte de su asociación, pues lleva muchos años de conocerlos. 
Julia invertirá el dinero de este préstamos en la compra de comida balanceada para sus animales.
texts.en:
Julia is 36 years old and has two children, Joseph and Janeth, whom she cares for in the home she bought six years ago.
She is a remarkable woman; she cares for her children alone and she manages to earn sufficient money through raising pigs.  This is their only income. She has 15 main pigs whom she fattens and takes care of with a great deal of dedication.  She sells their meat to order and sometimes sells the pigs live. "Everything depends on the client", she says. She is doing very well in this business.  She has a good income which allows her to raise her children, but to bring home extra income she also works as a laborer in various fields during the harvest, and as a brick layer in the nearby area. Her wish for the future is to open a restaurant in her home, as there are none in her area.

She belongs to the solidarity group "The Entrepreneurs" and this is her second loan with MFP.  She is very grateful for the support they give her to meet her goals. She promises to comply with the payments of her loan and also enjoys being associated with them since they have known each other for many years.  Julia will invest the money from this loan in buying nutritionally balanced food for her animals.

loans.use: to buy nutritionally balanced food for her animals.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy animal feed for her pigs

loans.name: Aleja

texts.es: La Sra. Aleja tiene 37 años tiene 2 hijos que son de las edades de 9 y 15 años,  ella se dedica  a la  venta y  crianza de cerdos en la localidad de Abapo, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Aleja va a usar este préstamo para la compra de cerdos para su negocio, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de capital para la compra de cerdos, la Sra. Aleja enfrenta retos en su negocio que son mejorar su calidad de vida y  va a utilizar los beneficios para mejorar la calidad en la alimentación de sus cerdos,  su deseo es poder tener una granja donde pueda criar cantidad de cerdos para que de esta manera pueda mejorar su estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Aleja is 37 years old and has two children, ages 9 and 15. She works raising and selling pigs in the town of Abapo. This loan is her first within the institution. Aleja will use this loan to buy pigs for her business. Her reason for applying for this loan is the lack of capital to buy pigs. Aleja confronts challenges in her business, such as improving her quality of life and she is going to use the profits to improve the quality of feed for her pigs. Her wish is to be able to have a farm where she can raise a number of pigs to be able to improve her economic stability.

loans.use: to buy pigs for her business

loans.name: Tilateñas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “TILATEÑAS” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Adela, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Ignacia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de coca, transporte público, venta de carne, tienda de pulpería, venta de comida, venta de carne de cordero, servicio de transporte público, ayudante de albañil.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Ignacia es una integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de cordero; nos cuenta que este negocio lo adquirió de sus padres desde niña, ya que este es un negocio familiar y con el pasar del tiempo ella lo trabaja sola.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de cordero) mismo que adquiere de las ferias de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su negocio. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene seis hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta que le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación en crédito y salud.
texts.en:
The “Tilateñas" communal bank will start its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, through the Villa Adela regional office. It is made up of nine members, led by a board of directors of which Ignacia is the chairperson. 

The businesses that the communal bank members carry on are varied, and include: sale of coca leaves, public transportation, sale of meat, grocery store, sale of food, sale of lamb meat, and construction helper.

The loan they will be taking out will benefit small business owners including Ignacia. She says that this is the first time she has joined Pro Mujer, becoming a member at the invitation of a field worker of the institution, who came to her house. 

Currently she has a business selling lamb. She tells us that she learned this business as a small child from her parents, as this is a family business. With the passage of time, she runs it on her own. 
 
The loan she will take out now is to increase working capital, through the purchase of lamb, which she buys at the markets in the city of El Alto and will later sell at her business. This livelihood allows her to generate income to support her family as best she can, since she is married and has six children.   

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the training in credit and health.

loans.use: To buy lamb.

loans.name: Twitezimbere/rbr Group

texts.fr:
Jean Bosco fait partie du groupe Twitezimbere / Rbr. Le nom du groupe signifie « Améliore le niveau du travail ». Il a 36 ans, il est marie avec 6 enfants de 1 ans à 13 ans, dont 3 scolarises. Son niveau d’éducation est de 8 ans de primaire.
Jean Bosco est agriculteur de riz. C’est son troisième cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimique et payer la main d’œuvre.
Pour faire croitre son agriculture des riz, il planifie de solliciter d’autres crédit pour renforcer son agriculture de riz. Dans les prochaines années, Jean Bosco voudrait être un grand agriculteur de riz dans sa région. Avec les profits, il prévoit de construire une maison.
texts.en:
Jean Bosco is a member of the Twitezimbere/Rbr group. The group’s name means “Increasing the level of work.” He is 36 years old, married, and has six children ranging from one to 13 years of age. Three of his children attend school. Jean Bosco's education level is eight years of elementary school.

Jean Bosco is a rice farmer. This is his third loan cycle with ACB. He will use his loan to buy chemical fertilizers and pay for labor.

In order to expand his business, his strategy is to keep taking out other loans to strenghten his farming activity. In the  years to come, Jean Bosco would like to become an important rice producer in his region. With the profits, he plans to build a house.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers and pay for labor.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock of canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Eric

texts.en:
Eric is 22 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married, with one child. 

Eric  has a food/retail shop, or sari-sari store, that sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products, and beverages. He has had this business for four years.  He requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages. 

Eric  has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future, he hopes to improve his business for the education of his child.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en: Anahit is involved in agriculture. She keeps hens, cultivates wheat, and grows apple trees. Anahit would like to renovate the old greenhouse in her orchard which is why she has applied for this loan. This will allow Anahit to grow larger variety of vegatables. Anahit will also purchase a polyethylene cover and wood to heat the green house during the winter. Besides, she plans to purchase fertilizer and medicine for the cultivation of land. This loan will help Anahit to implement these goals and earn more profit from the farm.

loans.use: to pay for wood, green house renovation, fertilizer, medicine and a polyethylene cover

loans.name: Nubar

texts.en:
Nubar lives in Uyts village with her two sons: 8-year-old Artak and 15-year-old Artyom. 

Nubar earns her income from farming and cattle breeding. She raises hens, keeps beehives, cultivates wheat, potatos, and cabbage, and grows fruit trees. 

As it's difficult for Nubar to do all the sowing process alone, she has to hire workers to it.  Nubar also plans to buy two calves and get more profit by gathering milk.  She also needs to purchase seeds for the autumn sowing. In order to implement all these plans, Nubar has applied for this loan to get necessary funds. 

Agriculture is the main source of income for Nubar.  Ongoing investments in its development are vital for her to cover her family's rising costs.

loans.use: to buy two calves, seeds, fuel, and sowing and transportation services

loans.name: Kristine

texts.en:
Kristine is involved in retail. She rents a little booth in one of the markets in Yerevan, where she has been trading in clothing since 2010. 

Kristine has applied for this loan to add more jeans to her inventory in her booth, as demand for such clothing has increased recently. This is important for Kristine to meet her clients' demand and increase sales. 

Kristine lives with her husband, Margar, and two children: an 8-year-old son and a 4-year-old daughter. 

Development of the business will bring more income for Kristine and help her to cover the family's costs.

loans.use: to pay for stocks of jeans.

loans.name: Diana Maria

texts.es: Diana de 46 años,  está muy satisfecha porque con su credikiva  compró un carro de perros  y mucha materia prima, con lo  cual preparó las mas deliciosas comidas rápidas. Ahora vende mucho más refrescos acompañados de los nuevos productos que tiene para la venta. En la actualidad está aplicando aun nuevo credikiva con el cual comprará cervezas y materias primas como harina, e insumos como queso y carnes, para elaborar sus productos fritos, que son lo que mayor rotación tienen, porque les gusta mucho a la clientela. Ella envía el siguiente mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva : “Mis agradecimientos por apoyarme, a través de ustedes ha crecido mi negocio. “
texts.en:
Diana, 46 years old, is very satisfied because with her "credikiva" she bought a hot dog cart and many raw materials, with which she prepared the most delicious fast food.  Now she sells a lot more soft drinks accompanied by the new products that she has to sell.  

Currently, she is applying for a new Credikiva with which she will buy beer, raw materials like flour and supplies like cheese and meat in order to make her fried products, which have the best turnover because her customers like them very much.  She sends the following message to the Kiva lenders:  “My gratitude for supporting me, through you my business has grown.”

loans.use: to buy beer, raw materials like flour and supplies like cheese and meat in order to make her fried products.

loans.name: Petros

texts.en:
Petros runs a grocery store. He started this business in 2006. During the last few years, Petros has expanded his business and now aims to purchase more food to diversify product variety in the grocery. Unable to find sufficient means, Petros has applied for this loan. 
Petros lives with his mother, wife and 2 school-aged daughters. Development of the business is important for this entrepreneur to gather more income and improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for food for his grocery store

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is 49 years old and a widow from Panglao, Bohol.  She has five children; her eldest is 28, and her youngest is 13. 

Angelina operates a sari-sari store in her neighborhood. She sells basic household items like canned goods, chips, seasonings, and toiletries. She is also into making pots for sale.

She is asking for a loan to buy in bulk such merchandise as noodles, eggs, seasonings, toiletries, soft drinks, and rice. 

She is confident that with hard work and perseverance, she can continue to support her children. 

In the future, she would like to make her store bigger and sell items that she does not now carry. Any additional income will be for her family's daily consumption, savings, and school fees.

loans.use: to buy in bulk such merchandise as noodles, eggs, seasoning, toiletries, soft drinks, and rice

loans.name: Donesia

texts.en:
Donesia is 65 years old from Cortes, Bohol. She is married, with three adult children. 

Donesia is engaged in selling wood from coconut trees. This type of wood is usually used in building houses by the residents of her place. 

She is asking for a loan to buy more coconut wood to resell to her customers. Her income will be used to pay for a healthy diet and for savings for future use.

loans.use: to buy more coconut wood to resell to her customers

loans.name: Siranush

texts.en: Siranush runs a little booth at one of the markets in Yerevan where she sells women's clothing. Siranush started this business in 2007. She has gained a large number of loyal clients due to her ability to choose fashionable clothing. Now Siranush wants to add a greater variety of clothing to her booth, which is why she has applied for this loan. With the loan's help, Siranush will increase her income and save money to invest in the expansion of her booth.

loans.use: To pay for clothing to sell

loans.name: Eugenie

texts.en: Eugenie is from Talibon, Bohol. She has been selling home-cooked meals in her restaurant for two years now.  She is asking for a loan to buy more ingredients like vegetables, meat, seasonings, rice, and soft drinks. Eugenie is optimistic that with her hard work and perseverance, she can make a difference in the life of her family, especially for her parents. Her profits will pay for healthy foods for her family.  She will also use some of her profits to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients like vegetables, meat, seasonings, rice, and soft drinks

loans.name: Cresencia's Group

texts.en:
Cresencia is 58 years old and lives in Taraka, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed with 3 children. 

Cresencia has a store that sells groceries and other products. She has had this business for just one year. She requested a loan of 3,000 PHP to purchase more items for her general store such as shampoo, toothpaste, and beverages.

Cresencia has been a member of PMPC for one year.  In the future, Cresencia hopes to expand her business. Cresencia is the leader of a 2-person group. Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loans.use: To purchase more items for her general store such as shampoo, toothpaste, and beverages

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is married, with one child. Teresita is 33 years old and lives in Causwagan, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte.

Teresita buys and sells charcoal to earn a living, and she has had this business for one year. Each month, she earns PHP 10,000 doing this type of work. 

She has requested a loan of PHP 30,000 to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell.

Teresita is a new member of PMPC. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is married, with five children. She is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Jocelyn is a farmer and grows corn to earn a living. She has been doing this for five years. She has requested a loan of PHP 14,000 to purchase  seedlings and fertilizer for corn production.

Jocelyn has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, she hopes to save for additional capital for her business .

loans.use: To purchase seedlings and fertilizer for corn production

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 46 years old and lives in Imelda, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married, with two children.

To earn a living, Gina has a business selling dried fish. She earns about PHP 10,000 each month doing this type of work. 

Gina has requested a loan of PHP 14,000 to purchase more dried fish to sell.

Gina has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, she would like to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Penninah

texts.en:
Peninah is 37 years old and married.  She describes herself as a patient and faithful woman. 

She operates a grocery store where she sells vegetables and fruits, such as cabbages, onions, bananas, and kale. She has been involved in this business for seven years and employs one staff member. 

Her business is located within a conducive shopping market, and her primary customers are local residents . She describes her biggest business challenge to be the lack of permanent business premises for carrying out her business activities. 

She will use the KES 10,000 loan to buy more fruits and vegetables for resale.  

Her business goal is to run a big grocery store within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be a self-dependent woman.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables and fruits for resale.

loans.name: Wairimu

texts.en: Wairimu is a married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from 11 years to 13 years. She describes herself to be honest and industrious. She operates a grocery store where she sells kale. She has been involved in this business for four years and employs one staff member. Her business is located at a busy market, and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving her business. She will use the Kes 10,000 loan to buy more kale to sell. Her business goal is to improve her business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have expanded her business by opening many more similar grocery stores within her town. This is the first loan that Wairimu has received from SMEP DTM.

loans.use: To buy kale to sell

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth is a 38-year-old married woman. She has four children with ages ranging from 7 years to 18 years. She describes herself to be an honest and jovial woman. She operates a beauty salon where she provides hair services. She has been involved in this business for three years and employs one staff member. Her business is located in a busy area, and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving her business. She will use the Kes 10,000 loan to buy more beauty products. Her business goal is to improve her business within five years.

loans.use: To buy beauty products for her hair salon

loans.name: David Antonio

texts.es:
El señor David tiene 65 años de edad, es casado y tiene cinco hijos. Desde hace doce años se dedica a la venta de sorbetes, actividad que aprendió de un amigo. Antes él realizaba actividades de jornalero; pero los ingresos no eran suficientes para el sostenimiento de su familia. Por ese motivo, se decidió por la venta ambulante en una bicicleta de sorbetes en las escuelas, partidos de fútbol, algún otro evento y en las calles de la comunidad.

Cada ocho días le llegan a dejar a su casa la mercadería, él los mantiene en un friser, luego saca cantidades pequeñas para salir a venderlas en su bicicleta. 

El préstamo será invertido en la compra de mercadería para surtir su negocio y la otra parte para realizarle mejoras a su vivienda en donde vive con su esposa y sus cinco hijos.  Aumentando la mercadería podrá  recibir mejores ingresos, con el objetivo de brindar seguridad y comodidad a su familia.

Lo que él desea es comprar una tricimoto, debido a que por su edad se cansa pedalear en la bicicleta.
texts.en:
David is 65 years old, married, and has five children. For 12 years he has made a living by selling sorbets, an activity that he learned from a friend. Before he was a day laborer, but his income was not sufficient for the support of his family. For that reason, he decided on the traveling sorbet business on a bicycle to schools, soccer games, other events, and on the streets of the community. 

Every eight days the merchandise is dropped off at his house. He maintains it in a freezer, and later he takes out small quantities for going out to sell it on his bicycle. 

The loan will be invested in the purchase of merchandise to stock his business and to make improvements to his home, where he lives with his wife and five children. By increasing his stock of merchandise, he will be able to receive better income, with the objective of providing security and comfort for his family. 

What he wants is to buy a tricycle-style motorcycle, due to the fact that his age causes him to tire while pedaling on the bicycle.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock his store and to make improvements to his home.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is a 35-year-old married woman. She has 5 children with ages ranging from 4 years to 12 years. She describes herself to be an honest woman. She operates a grocery stall where she sells items such as kale, onions etc. She has been involved in this business for 4 years and employs 1 staff member. Her business is located within a good business environment and her primary customers are local residents and retailers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving her grocery stall business. She will use the Kes 10,000 loan to buy more kale for resale. Her business goal is to run another grocery stall within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her business.

loans.use: to buy kale for resale

loans.name: Rene

texts.es: El señor Rene tiene 64 años de edad casado con la Sra. Valentina se dedican a la agricultura que es la fuente de sus ingresos económicos producen papa, haba, con practica de rotación de cultivos en terreno de 3 Has en la comunidad de Santa Isabel y Liriuni, en la agricultura tiene bastante experiencia en cuanto manejo de los cultivos, tratamientos fitosanitarios, cosecha y mercadeo, viven en una comunidad rural Liriuni a 50 km de la ciudad de Cochabamba, Don Rene necesita dinero para comprar insumos agrícolas abono orgánico (gallinaza) semilla de papa, el ahorro que tenia gasto en la construcción de su casa que su sueños era tener una casa cómoda con todo los servicios básicos, Don Rene nos comenta con el préstamo seguirá sembrando para garantizar la seguridad alimentaria para su familia y ahorrar dinero para ayudar a sus nietos.
texts.en:
Mr. Rene is 64 years old and married to Mrs. Valentina.  They make a living in agriculture; it is the source of their economic income.  They produce potatoes and lima beans and practice crop rotation on 3 hectares of land in the community of Santa Isabel y Liriuni.  He has considerable experience in agriculture in crop management, phytosanitary (plant health) treatments, harvesting and marketing.  They live in a rural community, Liriuni, 50 kilometers from the city of Cochabamba. 
 
Don Rene needs the money to buy agricultural supplies, manure (hen droppings) and potato seeds.  He spent the savings that he had on the construction of his house.  His dream was to have a comfortable house with all of the basic services.  Rene comments to us that with this loan he will continue planting in order to guarantee the food security for his family and to save money to help his grandchildren.

loans.use: to buy supplies, seeds and organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Thavy's Group

texts.en:
Thavy, aged 36, lives in a rural village of the Ou Reang Ov district of Kampong Cham province. She has two children, both of whom are dependents and still in school. She and her husband are rice farmers who have engaged in this business to make a living for ten years. Together they can earn about KHR12,000 per day to meet the family’s needs. Low prices of the crop yield is the main challenge for her business.

This is the first micro loan for Thavy’s all-female group of four members with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She is now leading her group members to apply for a loan with VisionFund of KHR 1,000,000 each. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and use a portion of it to buy pesticides for protecting her rice paddy. She hopes to increase her crop yields and sell it for a good price so as to better her living condition and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.es:
Zenaida tiene 43 años, vive en compañía de Fernando, su esposo, tienen siete hijos, pero ahora sólo viven con cinco de ellos.
Gracias a los ahorros por el trabajo de su esposo, pudo adquirir una fábrica de ladrillos. Cuenta que su familia (sus hijas y yernos) le ayudan en el negocio y por eso se siente feliz, ya que puede brindar un apoyo a su familia. “El trabajo es muy duro y se necesita de muchas personas”, afirma. Ya tiene 20 años de experiencia, es por ello que siempre cuenta con pedidos de sus clientes fijos, al mes realiza 22 millares de ladrillos. Ahora, lo que desea es comprar nuevos hornos, con una mejor tecnología, pues actualmente realiza el quemado de los ladrillos de manera rústica.

Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “Los emprendedores” y este es su crédito número 18 con MFP, por tanto agradece el apoyo que le dan para cumplir con sus objetivos. Promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas y además le agrada ser parte de su asociación, pues lleva muchos años de conocerlos.
Zenaida invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de más aserrín para la realización de los ladrillos.
texts.en:
Zenaida is 43 years old. She lives with her husband Fernando, and they have seven children. But now they only live with five of them.

Thanks to savings from her husband's work, she was able to acquire a brick-making operation. She has her family (her daughters and sons-in-law) to help her in the business; that is why she feels happy, as she is able to offer support to her family. “The work is very hard and you need a lot of people," she says. 

She already has 20 years of experience; this is why she always has orders from her established customers. She makes 22 thousand bricks a month. Now she wishes to buy new ovens with better technology, as currently she fires the bricks in the traditional country way. 

She belongs to the “Los Emprendedores” communal bank, and this is her 18th loan with MFP. Therefore she is grateful for the support they give her in meeting her objectives. She promises to make her installment payments, and is also thankful to be part of her communal bank, as she has known them for many years. 

Zenaida will invest the money applied for in the purchase of more sawdust for making the bricks.

loans.use: To buy more sawdust for making bricks.

loans.name: Chipotrer Group

texts.es:
La señora Isabel Maria esta soltera, tiene 23 años de edad, cursó los 2 años de educacion primaria, se dedica al comercio a la atención a una tienda en general, inicio este negocio vendiendo gaseosas, y lleva hasta ahora 6 años de experiencia.

Organiza un grupo para poder solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de productos para la tienda que tiene: jugos, aguas gaseosas, golosinas, lácteos, embutidos, etc. Espera seguir aumentando sus ganancias. Los demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a la crianza de animales, y atención a tienda de consumo diario.
texts.en:
Señora Isabel Maria is single. She is 23 years old. She had two years of primary education. She works in business, tending to a general store. She began this business selling soft drinks, and she has now had 6 years of experience.

She organized a group to be able to apply for a loan that she will use to purchase products for her store: juices, sparkling waters, candies, milk products, sausages, etc. She hopes to continue increasing her earnings. The other members of the group work in raising animals and tending to a store with basic products for daily use.

loans.use: to buy products for her store.

loans.name: Nayseng's Group

texts.en:
Nayseng is 53 years old and is living in a rural area in the Ou Reang Ov district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She is a married mother of five children, two of whom are dependent on her and still in school. To make a living, she has been farming rice on 1.5 hectares of farmland. Having been in this business for thirty years, she is able to earn about KHR12,000 per day and manages to save about KHR4,000 each day after daily expenses. 

Nayseng’s group consists of two members who live in the same village and this is their first micro loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She and her group members are requesting a loan of KHR1,000,000 each. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to increase her income from the rice paddy so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Feliciano

texts.es:
Feliciano tiene 18 años de edad, es soltero, vive con sus padres  en el Municipio del Negrito, departamento de Yoro. 
Feliciano desde niño se ha dedicado a la agricultura a través de las enseñanzas de su padre.  Desde hace 3 años se  dedica a la producción del cultivo de arroz de excelente calidad, con el apoyo de su familia (padres).
Él comercializa su cosecha en el mercado regional de manera colectivo con otros productores.
En la actualidad está solicitando un crédito por la cantidad de 6,000 Lempiras, los que piensa invertir en la preparación del terreno (arado y rastreo del suelo), mano de obra para la siembra y en la fertilización del cultivo. 
Considera que el financiamiento le asegura el buen manejo del cultivo y una producción de calidad. Él espera obtener ganancias que le permitan mantener sus gastos personales y realizar la compra de activos.
texts.en:
Feliciano is 18 years old and single. He lives with his parents in the town of Negrito in the Department of Yoro.

From the time he was a boy, Feliciano has engaged in agriculture as a result of the lessons he learned from his father. For the past three years, he has been producing rice of excellent quality with the help of his parents. He sells his harvest at the regional market as part of collective with other producers.

At the moment, he is requesting a loan in the amount of 6,000 HNL. He plans to invest in the preparation of his farmland (plowing and dredging the soil) and labor (planting and fertilizing his crops). Feliciano expects to earn a profit so that he can maintain his personal expenses and purchase more assets.

loans.use: to invest in the preparation of his farmland and pay for labor.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es: Gloria de 39 años de edad vive al sur occidente de la ciudad con su cónyuge y sus 3 hijos en las edades de 20 a 25 años. Ella se dedica a la actividad comercial desde el año 2003, la cual inició con el objetivo de apoyar los gastos de su hogar para conseguir un mayor bienestar familiar. En su negocio vende calzado, cosméticos, ropa interior y entre personas de su propio barrio, que se han convertido en su  principal clientela. Sus ventas las realiza en la modalidad de crédito, ajustado a las posibilidades de su clientela y sus compras las hace de contado en almacenes  del centro de la ciudad. Ella también vende productos cosméticos, que adquiere  mediante guías especializadas y que ofrece a sus clientes, con los descuentos especiales que tanto gustan a ellos. Gloria trabaja todos los días de lunes a domingo y dedica  8 horas diarias a su negocio, con el fin de generar cada vez  más ingresos;  aunque necesita ampliar el surtido que ofrece, su capital de trabajo no es suficiente para hacerlo. Esta es la razón por la cual acude aun credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace ala Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprara calzado, cosméticos perfumería y ropa interior; con este nuevo surtido espera expandirse a otras zonas y ampliar el número de clientes que han sido referenciados por sus fíeles compradores y que aun no les ha podido dar respuesta, en ello justamente radica el éxito de su credikiva.
texts.en:
Gloria, 39, lives in the southwest of the city with her common law husband and their three children, aged 20 to 25 years old. She has been engaged in commercial activity since the year 2003, when she began her business with the goal of helping with household expenses in order to achieve greater family well-being. 

In her business, she sells shoes, cosmetics and underwear to people in her own neighborhood who have become her main customers. She sells on credit, adjusted to her customer’s abilities and she makes her purchases in cash at stores in the business center of the city. She also sells cosmetic products that she acquires through specialized catalogs and that she offers to her clients at special discounts, which they greatly appreciate.

Gloria works every day from Monday to Sunday and spends 8 hours daily at her business, with the goal of generating more and more income. However she needs to expand her inventory and her working capital is insufficient to do so. That is why she has come for a Kiva loan, her first funding request to Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use it to buy shoes, toiletries and underwear. With this new merchandise she plans to branch out to other regions and expand her customer base through referrals from her faithful buyers. She still has orders she has been unable to fill and to do so only needs her request for a Kiva loan to succeed.

loans.use: to purchase shoes, toiletries and underwear.

loans.name: Gladis Esperanza

texts.es: Gladis, es una mujer muy trabajadora y responsable, quien cuenta con buenas referencias por parte de sus vecinos y amigos, ya que siempre se ha esforzado por dar lo mejor de sí y salir adelante. Ella es madre soltera y vive junto a un hijo menor de edad, por quien lucha para contar con todo lo necesario para su hogar. Gladis posee una venta de fruta congelada y de paletas de sabores que ella misma elabora, así también comercializa chocobananos, los cuales son hechos de bananos bañados de chocolate, lo cual es una golosina muy típica del país. Gladis solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, para poder comprar mayor cantidad de materia prima como: frutas, bolsas plásticas, chocolate, palillos para las paletas y otros más, lo que le permitirá incrementar su venta, lo cual sería de mucho beneficio para ella porque incrementara los ingresos para su hogar.
texts.en: Gladis is a very hard-working and responsible woman who has good references from her neighbors and friends, since she has always strived to give the best of herself and to advance. She is a single mother and lives with a son who is a minor, for whom she struggles to have everything necessary for her household. Gladis has a business selling frozen fruit and flavored popsicles that she herself makes. She also sells chocobananos, which are made from bananas dipped in chocolate, which is a very typical candy of the country. Gladis is applying to INTEGRAL for a loan to be able to buy a larger quantity of basic materials such as fruits, plastic bags, chocolate, sticks for the popsicles, and other items that will allow her to increase her sales, which will be of great benefit to her because she will increase the income for her household.

loans.use: to buy fruits, plastic bags, chocolate, and other items for her business

loans.name: Chanly's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural village of the Ou Reang Ov district of Kampong Cham province, Chanly is 49 years old and is a married mother of six children: two daughters and four sons. Three of her children are dependent on her and help the family business in their spare time. 

Rice farming has been the main source of her family’s income for 20 years and she is usually able to earn about 20,000KH--but drought has ruined her rice field and the low selling price of the smaller crop yield is the main challenge of family’s business.

This is the first micro loan for Chanly’s group with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Her group consists of Chanly and another female member who lives in the same village. Chanly, who is the group leader, will use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend on labor. She hopes to grow more rice to earn more income than the current business so that she can make a good living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Mujeres De Nicaja Group

texts.es:
La señora Lesbia esta casada, tiene 28 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 3 hijos 1 de los cuales esta estudiando, se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva, inicio este negocio vendiendo ropa para niños y hasta el momento lleva 10 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica al mismo negocio.

Organiza un grupo para solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de productos: Suéteres, playeras, camisa, ropa para bebes, gorras, bufanda, etc. Espera en el futuro tener varias tiendas para su venta. Las demás integrantes se dedican a la venta de ropa y a la crianza de animales.
texts.en:
Lesbia is married and is 28 years old. She did not have an opportunity to attend school, but now one of her three children is studying. She works selling new clothing. She started out selling clothing for children and now has ten years of experience. She works alongside her husband who also sells clothing. 

She organized a group in order to apply for a loan that will be used to buy products: sweaters, t-shirts, dress shirts, clothing for infants, hats, scarves, etc. She hopes in the future to have various shops from which to sell her products. The other members of the group work selling clothing and raising animals.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Soeurng's Group

texts.en:
A widow living in a rural village located in the Ou Reang Ov district, Soeurng is 59 years old and has one dependent son who helps with the family’s business. Soeurng is rice farmer to support the family. She has been in this business for thirty years, earning about 10,000KHR per day and can manage to save about 4,000KHR each day. The main challenge for her business is low crop yield as a result of flooding.

This is the first micro loan for Soeurng’s group with VisionFund. She is leading her group of two women to apply for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and use a portion to pay for labor costs. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase the current business income, allowing her to improve her family’s living standard.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Luis

texts.es: Luis de 62 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa y una hija quienes se dedican a la elaboración de tamales y venden de forma ambulante, juntos  trabajan  arduamente para  vivir mejor. Luis es joyero y se dedica a la elaboración de cadenas, pulseras, aritos y otros más, así mismo para obtener mayor capital de trabajo compra oro, su negocios está ubicado estratégicamente en el centro del pueblo en que reside por lo que  muchas personas lo conocen por ser responsable y confiable. Luis solicita un préstamo con el deseo de contar con el dinero necesario para la compra de mayor cantidad de oro en diferentes quilatajes y de esta forma incrementar la variedad en estilos y precios de las joyas que comercializa, lo cual le permitirá incrementar su mercado. El mayor deseo de Luis es poder aumentar sus ventas y contar con una vida mejor.
texts.en: Luis is 62 years old. He lives with his wife and a daughter, who prepare tamales and sell them as walking vendors. They work hard together in order to live better. Luis is a jeweler and makes chains, bracelets, earrings, and other items.  Thus he buys gold to obtain more working capital. His business is located strategically in the center of the town where he lives, and for this reason many people know him to be responsible and trustworthy. Luis is applying for a loan with the desire to have the necessary money to buy a larger quantity of gold of different carats, and in this way he can increase the variety of styles and prices of the jewelry that he sells, which will allow him to increase his market. Luis greatest desire is to be able to increase his sales and have a better life.

loans.use: to buy gold as a basic material for his business.

loans.name: Blanca Lidia

texts.es: Blanca  de 61 años de edad,  vive junto a tres nietos  menores de edad, quienes dependen por completo del trabajo de Blanca. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora, la cual ha luchado mucho por brindarles todo lo necesario a sus nietos, desde hace muchos años atrás que ella se ha dedicado a trabajar haciendo tortillas, su negocio es muy rentable, en el cual se puede generar muy buenas ganancias. Blanca solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de masa para elaborar más tortillas, así mismo desea poder comprar varios cilindros de gas propano con el fin de poder contar con una reservar de estos, lo cual le permita ahorrar un poco de dinero, y así mismo invertir en su tienda. Esto llena de mucha ilusión a Blanca ya que a través del crédito solicitado a INTEGRAL ella espera mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en: Blanca is 61 years old and lives with her three young grandchildren who completely depend on her. She is a very hard-working woman who has fought hard to provide everything her grandchildren need. For many years she has made a living making tortillas, and her business is very lucrative, generating very good profits. Blanca is requesting the loan so she can purchase a large quantity of dough to make more tortillas, and she also wants to buy some propane cylinders so she can have a reserve of them, which will save her money. Blanca is filled with excitement because with this loan from Kiva partner Apoyo Integral she will be able to increase her profits.

loans.use: to purchase corn and propane gas to improve her business.

loans.name: Channin's Group

texts.en:
Channin is 45 years old and lives in the Ou Reang Ov district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She is a married mother of two daughters, both of whom are dependent on her and still in school. 

To make a living, she has been in rice farming for eighteen years and supplements her family’s income through raising pigs. The current business earns her approximately 18,000KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. The main challenge for her business is drought has ruined her crop yield.

Channin’s group consists of two members who live in the same village. This is the first loan for her group with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Channin, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and pig feed. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her business income--allowing her to expand her current business and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Humphrey

texts.en:
Humphrey is a 27 year old married man with a son who is 3 years old. He describes himself to be faithful man. Humphrey operates a retail store where he sells items such as water, juice, margarine, flour, sugar, salt, tea leaves, soao, maize flour, rice, etc. He has been involved in this business for 5 years and is helped by his wife. In addition to the retail store, Humphrey also farms.

His business is located within a busy area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the high price of sugar. He will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more household items for resale in his store. His business goal is to run a big retail shop within 5 years. He hopes that in the future he will be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy more household items to sell in his store

loans.name: Manuel De Jesús

texts.es: Manuel de 30 años de edad, es una persona que trabaja desde muy joven, vive junto a su esposa quien trabaja como ama de hogar y dos hijos menores de edad. Manuel posee un pick up en el cual comercializa frutas y verduras de forma ambulante por diferentes colonias, cuenta con varios clientes fijos, por lo que desea mejorar en gran forma su negocio solicitando un préstamo a INTEGRAL, por medio del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para realizar la compra de mayor cantidad de frutas, verduras y de esta forma brindarles el mejor servicio a sus clientes, quienes en muchas ocasiones le hacen pedidos a Manuel los cuales desea cumplir. Gracias a esto Manuel espera mejorar sus ganancias y así salir adelante.
texts.en: Manuel is 30 years old and has worked since he was very young. He lives with his spouse, who is a housewife, and their two young children. Manuel has a pick-up truck he uses to sell fruits in vegetables in different villages. He has a number of fixed customers, but wants to improve on a larger scale. He is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Apoyo Integral so he can have the necessary money to purchase a larger quantity of fruit and vegetables and in this way provide a better service to his customers, who on many occasions places orders through Manuel that he wishes to fulfill. Thanks to this loan, Manuel hopes to increase his profits and keep moving forward.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: María Elena

texts.es: María Elena vive junto a su esposo y dos hijos menores de edad, quienes se dedican a estudiar. María posee una panadería, la cual desde hace varios años funciona en su casa, su esposo le ayuda a elaborar el pan, que posteriormente sale a repartir a todos sus clientes, quienes tienen negocios como tiendas, en donde obtiene pedidos muy grandes. El deseo de María es crecer aún más en el negocio, de manera que pueda atender mayor cantidad de clientes, es por esta razón que solicita un préstamo, a través del cual pueda comprar harina por mayor, levadura y todos los productos que se utilizan para la elaboración del pan, en cantidades grandes para obtenerla a menores precios. Esto sería de mucho beneficio tanto para su negocio como para su familia quien depende absolutamente de la panadería, ya que esta es la única fuente de ingresos que poseen, razón por la cual se esfuerza día con día para brindar el mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en: Maria Elena lives with her husband and two minor children, who are in school. Maria has a bakery, which she has operated in her house for a number of years. Her husband helps her make bread, which he later goes out to deliver to all their customers, who have businesses such as stores, from which they obtain very large orders. Maria's desire is to grow even more in her business, in such as way that she can serve a larger number of customers. It is for this reason that she is applying for a loan with which she can buy flour wholesale, along with leavening and all the products that are used to make bread in large quantities so that she can obtain them at better prices. This will be of great benefit to her business as much as for her family, who depend absolutely on the bakery, since it is the only source of income that they possess. This is the reason why she strives day after day to offer better service to her customers.

loans.use: to buy flour wholesale

loans.name: Sochea's Group

texts.en:
Orginally from the Ou Reang Ov district of Kampong Cham province, Sochea is a 33 year-old married mother of six children, four daughters and two sons, all of whom are dependent on her and still in school. To support the family, she has been involved in farming rice for ten years. She can earn about 15,000KHR per day from the current business. Low earnings due to poor crop yield continues to be the main challenge for her business.

This is the first loan for Sochea's group of two with VisionFund. She and her group member are requesting a loan of 1,000,000KHR each. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and pesticides to protect her rice paddy and use a portion of it to pay for labors. She hopes this loan will enable her to grow her rice healthily and yield more crops. The additional income will allow her to run a new business and keep the children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her rice paddy

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Chuisacaxacol Group

texts.es:
La señora Paulina Francisca está casada, tiene 59 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 8 hijos 1 de los cuales está estudiando, se dedica a la agropecuaria a la crianza de animales domésticos, inicio este negocio con la crianza de pollos, lleva 6 años de experiencia, cuenta el  apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica a la confección de prendas.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para comprar cerdos y así poder tener una buena recuperación de capital cuando venda los cerdos,  espera tener una granja grande, las demás integrantes se dedica al mismo oficio la crianza de animales domésticos.
texts.en: Paulina Francisca is married and 59 years old. She did not have the opportunity to go to school. She has eight children, one of whom is still in school. Paulina makes a living raising domestic animals. She started the business raising chickens and has six years of experience. She counts on the support of her husband, a dressmaker. She organizes the group and is requesting a loan, which she plans to use to purchase pigs. She plans to have a good return on her investment when she resells them and hopes to have a big farm. The other members make a living in the same trade of raising domestic animals.

loans.use: to purchase pigs.

loans.name: José Atiliano

texts.es: José  es una persona muy joven y responsable, quien trabaja muy duro por darle lo mejor a su esposa y su pequeña hija de tres años de edad, quien es la principal razón de salir adelante y esforzarse cada día más. José se dedica a la venta de leña la cual comercializa por mayor y por menor, este  negocio lo heredó de su padre trabajando en el desde que era muy pequeño por lo que conoce muy bien su mercado facilitando más el trabajo, razón también por la que desea mejor el negocio y obtener nuevos clientes. José solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, con la intención de poder comprar más leña y de esta forma atender a más personas y aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en: Jose is a responsible young man who works very hard to provide the best for his wife and three-year-old daughter. His daughter is the main reason he keeps moving forward and strives each day to succeed. Jose works selling firewood both wholesale and retail, a business he inherited from his father after working for him ever since he was very young. He therefore knows the market very well, which helps facilitate business and is another reason he wishes to expand and obtain new customers. Jose is seeking a loan through INTEGRAL, with the intention of using it to buy more firewood so he can better serve his customers and increase sales.

loans.use: to buy firewood to sell.

loans.name: Kimnay's Group

texts.en:
Kimnay is a 53-year-old widowed mother of five children living in a rural village of the Ou Reang Ov district, Cambodia. Of her five children, she still has three daughters to take care of. To support her family, Kimnay has been farming rice and raising pigs for thirty years. The current business earns her about KHR20,000 per day. Lower income due to poor crop yield continues to be the main challenge for her business.

Kimnay’s group consists of three members and she is the leader of this group. She is a return-borrower while the other two members are new borrowers with VisionFund. Kimnay will use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland and feed for her pig raising business. She hopes to grow her current business to earn more income, improving her family's living condition.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Irma Angélica

texts.es: Irma se destaca por ser muy trabajadora, ella vive junto a su esposo y tres hijos menores de edad quienes se dedican a estudiar. Irma trabaja comercializando ropa deportiva y casual para hombres y mujeres, las cuales vende de forma ambulante por diferentes zonas del país, así mismo comercializa productos de temporada como sombrillas, chumpas y suéteres, con lo que logra brindarle la ayuda necesaria a su esposo con todos los gastos del hogar . Irma solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, por medio del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para invertir en la compra de más ropa como blusas y calzonetas las cuales por los lugares que transita tienen más demanda. Irma invierte largas horas a realizar su trabajo por lo que desea contar con más productos para incrementar sus ventas y de esta manera darles una vida mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Irma stands out as being very hardworking. She lives together with her husband and three younger children who are in school. Irma works selling sports and casual clothing for men and women. She sells them as a mobile vendor throughout different areas of the country. In the same way, she sells seasonal products like umbrellas, jackets, and sweaters. With this, she is able to give her husband the necessary help with all the household expenses. 

Irma is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL, through which she can have the necessary money to invest in the purchase of more clothing - like blouses and swimsuits – which are in greater demand in the areas where she travels. Irma spends many hours carrying out her work, with which she hopes to have more products to increase her sales, and in this way give a better life to her children.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to sell.

loans.name: Ana Ruth

texts.es: Ana Ruth de 45 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo y una hija de 12 años de edad quien se dedica a estudiar, y  por quien Ana se esfuerza día con día por dar lo mejor de sí. Ana posee una venta de tortillas, las cuales están hechas a base de maíz, su negocio está ubicado en su casa, en donde las personas llegan a comprarlas. Desde hace varios años que ella trabaja elaborando este alimento el cual es muy necesario en la dieta de las personas salvadoreñas, ya que se comen a diario hasta dos o tres veces al día, por lo que este es un negocio bastante estable. Ana  desea mucho poder mejorar su negocio, debido a que las ganancias generadas de este, le permiten brindarle todo lo necesario a su hija, quien es la razón principal para querer mejorar y poder brindarle lo mejor. Es por esto que Ana solicita un préstamo por medio del cual cuente con el dinero necesario para comprar maíz por mayor y de esta manera atender a más personas y así  obtener más ganancias las cuales beneficien a su hogar.
texts.en:
Ana Ruth is 45 years old. She lives with her husband and her 12 year old daughter, who is in school, and for whom Ana tries hard day after day to give more than she had herself. Ana has a business selling tortillas, which are made with corn. Her business is located in her house, where people come to buy them. She has worked for many years producing this food, which is a staple in the diet of the El Salvadoran people. They eat them every day up to two or three times a day, so this is a very stable business. 

Ana hopes very much to give her daughter everything that she needs; she is the main reason that Ana wants to improve and be able to offer her the best. For this reason, Ana is requesting a loan, through which she will have the necessary money to purchase corn in bulk. In this way, she can serve more people and therefore obtain more earnings to benefit her household.

loans.use: to purchase corn for producing tortillas and selling them.

loans.name: Sokun's Group

texts.en:
Sokun, 61, is from a rural village located in the Ou Reang Ov district of Kampong Cham province. She is married with three children; two daughters and one son, and all are dependent on her and still in school. To feed the family, she and her husband work as rice farmers and supplement the income by working for others for a fee. The current business earns them about 10,000 KHR per day. Drought is the main challenge for her business. 

Sokun’s group consists of two members who live in the same village; this is the first micro loan for her group with VisionFund. She and her group member are applying for a loan of 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and spend on labor costs. With this loan, she hopes to make more rice to increase her family’s income so as to improve her living condition.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Amos

texts.en: Amos is a 34-year-old married man. He has two children with ages ranging from five to 10 years. He describes himself to be social man. He operates a retail stall where he sells clothes. He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located within a busy environment and his primary customers are daily customers from environs. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. He will use the KES 8,700 loan to buy a water tank for his family's household activities. His business goal is to run a boutique within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will expand his business. Amos also does farming.

loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Kea

texts.en:
Living in a rural area located in Kampong Cham province's Tbaung Khmum district, Kea is 40 years old and married with seven children who have their own employment to make their living. To feed her big family, she and her husband farm rice and also plant cassava as the main source of the family's income; they have been in this business for twenty-two years. Together, they can earn about US $6 per day from the current business and can save about US $2 each day after expenses.

Kea has been a member of VisionFund for two cycles already and she completely paid back the past loans, which have helped her family relieve financial burden and sustain the main business. Now, she is applying for another loan of US $1,000. She will use this loan to buy fertilizers for rice field and cassava plantation and use a portion of it to spend for labor. She hopes to gain more yields and increase her family's income to improve her family's lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her rice field and cassava plantation.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Annah is a single woman. She has two children who are 12 and 17 years old. She describes herself to be an honest and diligent woman. She operates a retail business where she sells wooden utensils such as serving and cooking spoons. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located within a densely populated estate, and her primary customers are its residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving her business. 

She will use the 20,000 Kenyan shillings loan to buy more wooden utensils to resell. Her business goal is to be a wholesale supplier of wooden utensils  within five years. In addition, Annah runs a rental estate where she provides accommodation to tenants.

loans.use: to buy more wooden utensils.

loans.name: Sreynat

texts.en:
Aged 32 years, Sreynat is married and lives with her husband and two sons in a rural area located in the Kandal Stoeng district, Cambodia. Both of her sons are dependent and are now attending school in the local area. She earns a living as a tailor; she has been in this business for twelve years while her husband is a rice farmer. He also runs a motor rickshaw during his spare time to gain additional income for the family. Together, they can earn about US $11 per day and afford to save about US $4 each day after deducting expenses. 

Sreynat has been a member of VisionFund for three cycles already and she successfully repaid the loans. She used the loans from VisionFund to improve her livelihood and improve her house. Given her husband's motor rickshaw is a bit old and out of date, she is requesting another loan of US $1,000 with VisionFund to buy a new motor rickshaw for her husband's business. This loan will enable her husband to have a new motor rickshaw to run and serve more people better. She hopes to increase her family's income to keep her sons in school to study furtfher.

loans.use: To buy a new motor rickshaw.

loans.name: San

texts.en:
Living in a wooden house in a village of the Bati district of Takeo province, San is single and earns a living as a rice farmer on a 1.3 hectare area of farmland. She has been engaged in this business for 21 years earning about US $6 per day from the current business and can afford to save about US $4 each day after expenses. 

This is the first loan for San with Kiva's partner, VisionFund. She is requesting a loan of US $600 with VisionFund to buy some materials such as cement, sand, and brick, etc. for house improvement and will use a portion of it on labor. She hopes this loan will enable her to have a decent house for living in.

loans.use: To buy some materials for house improvement.

loans.name: Saroeut's Group

texts.en:
Originally from the village of the Kror Lanh district of Siem Reap province, Saroeut is 28 years old and married with only one daughter. To make a living, she and her husband have been working as paid workers in the local area for several years. The current work earns her family about 10,000 KHR per day and they manage to save about KHR 5,000 each day after the family's expenses. 

This is the first micro loan for Saroeut's group with Kiva's partner, VisionFund. As the leader, she is leading the other three members in her group to apply for a loan of KHR 1,000,000 each. She will use her portion to buy some materials to build a latrine for her family. This loan will enable her family to have a decent, clean latrine for consumption to improve living environment and have good health.

loans.use: To buy some materials to build a latrine.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Kror Lanh district

loans.name: Chekmach's Group

texts.en:
Chekmach is a 32-year-old mother of three children living in a rural area of the Dambe district, Cambodia. All of her children are still studying in the local area. She and her husband are peasants who have been planting cassava as their main business for twelve years. The current business earns her about 13,000 KHR per day and they can save about 7,000 KHR each day after expenses. The main challenge for her family's business is the decrease of cassava's price, which has affected her family's income. 

This is the first micro loan for Checkmach's group of three members who are all female. As the leader, she and the other two members are applying for a loan of 1,000,000 KHR each. She will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her plantation and use a portion of it to spend on labor. She hopes to grow her cassava business and earn more income to better her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her plantation.

loans.name: Anzhela

texts.en:
Anzhela lives in Artashat with her parents and sister. Her parents are both doctors. In 2008, the family founded a pharmacy, which is currently managed by Anzhela. 

She would like to purchase more medicines and expand the pharmacy. This loan will help Anzhela to implement this goal and to develop the business. Anzhela hopes to earn more income which is important for her to support her family to meet their needs.

loans.use: to buy medicines to sell

loans.name: Sofik

texts.en:
Sofik lives in Katnaghbyur village with her husband. They are involved in agriculture: they keep cows, pigs, turkeys, sheep and hens, as well as cultivating barley and growing apple trees. 

In order to increase the number of cattle, Sofik has applied for this loan. With the requested amount, she plans to purchase two cows as well as grass to feed them. This loan is important for Sofik so she can earn more income and improve her household's conditions.

loans.use: to buy two cows and grass to feed them

loans.name: Sovan's Group

texts.en:
A widow living in Kampong Cham province's Dambe district, Sovan, aged 40, earns a living as a rice farmer. She supplements her family's income by planting cassava to gain extra income to better feed and support her children, who are all in school in the local area. She has been in this business for twenty years earning about 16,400 KHR per day from the current business and managing to save about 9,000 KHR for future needs.

Sovan has been a member of VisionFund for one cycle already while the other members are just beginning with VisionFund this loan cycle. As the leader, she and her group of four are applying for a loan after her successful previous loan repayment. She is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend on labor. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her crop business to earn more income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Burastan

texts.en: Burastan lives in Ashotavan village with her husband, Armen, and 24-year-old son, Arman. The family gathers main income from farming; they cultivate potatoes, beans, and grow fruit trees. In addition to farming, Burastan also would like to get involved in cattle breeding. She has applied for this loan to purchase three oxen. Such expansion will significantly increase profit from agriculture, which Burastan plans to use for purchasing more cattle in the future.

loans.use: to pay for three oxen.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is a 40-year-old married woman who has two children aged 10 and 15. She describes herself as an optimistic woman. Salome operates a restaurant where she sells food, tea and snacks. She has been involved in this business for three years and employs one staff member. Her business is located within a potential business estate and her primary customers are employees from nearby institutions and residents from estates. 

Salome describes her biggest business challenge as being the lack of sufficient capital for improving her business. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy chairs and tables for her restaurant. Salome's business goal is to attract more customers. She hopes that in the future, she will build permanent premises for her restaurant.

loans.use: to buy chairs and tables for her restaurant

loans.name: Wilfrida

texts.en: Wilfrida is a 49-year-old married woman. She has four children. She describes herself to be a patient and polite woman. She operates a retail store where she sells items such as snacks, bread, sugar, salt, and sodas, etc. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a strategic business environment and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. She will use the KES 30,000 loan to purchase two bags of sugar, five crates of soda, and five bundles of maize flour. Her business goal is to run a mini shopping mall within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be a financially stable woman. She has previously received a loan of KES 20,000, which she managed to repay.

loans.use: to purchase two bags of sugar, five crates of soda, and five bundles of maize flour.
